A wide body of musicology since the 1980s with a focus upon the cultural study, aesthetics, criticism, and hermeneutics of music. It began in part a reaction against the traditional positivist musicology (focused on primary research) of the early 20th century and postwar era. Many of the procedures of new musicology are considered standard, although the name more often refers to the historical turn rather than to any single set of ideas or principles. Indeed, although it was notably influenced by feminism, gender studies, queer theory, postcolonial studies, and critical theory, new musicology has primarily been characterized by a wide-ranging eclecticism.

Mostly female performance artists who dress in masculine drag and personify male gender stereotypes as part of an individual or group routine. They are often lesbian, bisexual, transgender, genderqueer, or otherwise part of the LGBTQIA+ community. They may also be straight. A typical drag show may incorporate dancing, acting, stand-up comedy, and singing, either live or lip-synching to pre-recorded tracks. Drag kings often perform as exaggeratedly macho male characters, portray marginalized masculinities such as construction workers, rappers, or they will impersonate male celebrities like Elvis Presley, Michael Jackson, and Tim McGraw.

A political ideology that combines left-wing politics with populist rhetoric and themes. Its rhetoric often consists of anti-elitism, opposition to the Establishment and speaking for the "common people". https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Left-wing populism
https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q11900614

A political ideology which combines right-wing politics and populist rhetoric and themes. The rhetoric often consists of anti-elitist sentiments, opposition to the Establishment, and speaking to the "common people". Both right-wing populism and left-wing populism object to the perceived control of liberal democracies by elites. however, populism of the left also objects to the power of large corporations and their allies, while populism of the right normally supports strong controls on immigration.

The belief or notion that individuals who form an elite—a select group of people perceived as having an intrinsic quality, high intellect, wealth, power, notablity, special skills, or experience—are more likely to be constructive to society as a whole, and therefore deserve influence or authority greater than that of others.

A term which refers to a range of political stances that emphasize the idea of "the people" and often juxtapose this group against "the elite". The term developed in the 19th century and has been applied to various politicians, parties, and movements since that time, although it has rarely been chosen as a self-description. Within political science and other social sciences, several different definitions of populism have been employed, with some scholars proposing that the term be rejected altogether. A common framework for interpreting populism is known as the ideational approach: this defines populism as an ideology which presents "the people" as a morally good force and contrasts them against "the elite", who are portrayed as corrupt and self-serving. Populists differ in how "the people" are defined, but it can be based along class, ethnic, or national lines. Populists typically present "the elite" as comprising the political, economic, cultural, and media establishment, depicted as a homogeneous entity and accused of placing their own interests, and often the interests of other groups—such as large corporations, foreign countries, or immigrants—above the interests of "the people".

An IMC is a platform in which a group of people can group their ideas, beliefs, and concepts into one large media base. Advertising campaigns utilize diverse media channels over a particular time frame and target identified audiences.

Information content entity that is an empirical result found to be meaningful to one or more person(s) or a community, such that it can be interpreted by them in ways that they value, and which arises from a systematic analytic and/or deliberative process of investigation and study of other information content entities, that are often, but not exclusively other data item(s), thereby accounting for those other information content entities.
Any of various conditions related to one's sexual health.

A condition characterized by hardening of the penis due to the formation of fibrous plaques on the dorsolateral aspect of the penis, usually involving the membrane (tunica albuginea) surrounding the erectile tissue (corpus cavernosum penis). This may eventually cause a painful deformity of the shaft or constriction of the urethra, or both.
Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining healthcare provider.
The quality of being hard, the process of hardening, or an abnormally hard spot or place, particularly of the skin.
A knowledge content entity comprised of a data item about some thing.
A disorder that affects fibroblasts.
Biological entity which consists of a maximum number of some instances of discontinuous members of the same class.
A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the soft tissue.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A neoplastic disorder that affects the connective tissue.

A behavioral or mental pattern that causes significant distress or impairment of personal functioning. Such features may be persistent, relapsing and remitting, or occur as a single event. Many disorders have been described, with signs and symptoms that vary widely between specific disorders.
A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the connective tissue.
A set of medical signs and symptoms that are correlated with each other and, often, with a particular disease or disorder.

A syndrome is composed of a set of several clinically recognizable features, signs (observed by someone other than the patient), symptoms (reported by the patient), phenomena or characteristics that often occur together.

A medical condition that impairs normal functioning of bodily processes that remains largely undetected under examination, dissection or even under a microscope. At the exterior, there is no appearance of abnormality.
Older persons who are LGBTQIA+.
An older person who is bisexual.
A group which advocates for any of various sexual reforms.

The study of victimization, including the psychological effects on victims, relationships between victims and offenders, the interactions between victims and the criminal justice system—that is, the police and courts, and corrections officials—and the connections between victims and other social groups and institutions, such as the media, businesses, and social movements.

The field of science and engineering that aims at developing methods and technologies for the acquisition, processing, and study of patient data, which can come from different sources and modalities, such as electronic health records, diagnostic test results, medical scans. The health domain provides an extremely wide variety of problems that can be tackled using computational techniques.
The science underlying the acquisition, maintenance, retrieval, and application of medical knowledge and information to improve patient care, medical education, and health sciences research.

Bioinformatics derives knowledge from computer analysis of biological data. These can consist of the information stored in the genetic code, but also experimental results from various sources, patient statistics, and scientific literature. Research in bioinformatics includes method development for storage, retrieval, and analysis of the data. Bioinformatics is a rapidly developing branch of biology and is highly interdisciplinary, using techniques and concepts from informatics, statistics, mathematics, chemistry, biochemistry, physics, and linguistics. It has many practical applications in different areas of biology and medicine.
The science underlying the acquisition, maintenance, retrieval, and application of biomedical knowledge and information to improve patient care, medical education, and health sciences research.
Legal rights afforded to LGBTQIA+ victims of crime.
The application of existing informatics knowledge to practical applications, like technology or inventions.
A person who practices occultism or any of its various associated practices.

The development of informatics knowledge and predictions, principally in natural sciences but also in other empirical sciences, which are used as the scientific foundation for applied informatics. Basic informatics develops and establishes information to predict phenomena and perhaps to understand nature.
A person who uses magic.

An interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from noisy, structured and unstructured data, and apply knowledge and actionable insights from data across a broad range of application domains.
A change in location or position.
An academic field which is primarily concerned with analysis, collection, classification, manipulation, storage, retrieval, movement, dissemination, and protection of information.
The study of the structure, algorithms, behavior, and interactions of natural and artificial computational systems.
A right bestowed onto a person by a given legal system.

The study of algorithmic processes, computational machines and computation itself. As a discipline, computer science spans a range of topics from theoretical studies of algorithms, computation and information to the practical issues of implementing computational systems in hardware and software.
Rights that are not dependent on the laws or customs of any particular culture or government, and so are universal and inalienable.

Legal rights afforded to victims of crime. These may include the right to restitution, the right to a victims' advocate, the right not to be excluded from criminal justice proceedings, and the right to speak at criminal justice proceedings.
A romantic relationship which is considered casual in nature.
Any of various gender modalities which are considered to be non-cisgender.

term: persons by number of pronouns used
comment: Individuals classified by number of pronoun or pronouns that they do or do not use.

term: persons by type of pronouns used
comment: Individuals classified by type of pronoun or pronouns that they do or do not use.

term: persons by pronoun use in relationship to gender modality
comment: Individuals classified by type of pronoun or pronouns that they do or do not use, and the relationship that those pronouns have to their gender modality.
A cisgender person who uses the pronouns associated with their assigned gender at birth.
A transgender person who uses pronouns not associated with their assigned gender at birth.
A hierarchical polygamous relationship, in which the importance or status of partners is determined via competition.
A polygamous relationship which is hierarchical in nature.
False, inaccurate, or misleading information about COVID-19 that is communicated regardless of an intention to deceive.
False, inaccurate, or misleading medical information that is communicated regardless of an intention to deceive.
The false belief that human beings have had no impact on the depletion of the Earth's ozone layer.
The false belief that tobacco has no potential and/or possible negative effects on individual health.
A colorless or blue form of methamphetamine that takes the shape of crystals and is typically smoked.
The false belief that second-hand smoke has no potential and/or possible negative effects on individual health.

The purified, alkaloidal, extra-potent form of cocaine. It is smoked (free-based), injected intravenously, and orally ingested. Use of crack results in alterations in function of the cardiovascular system, the autonomic nervous system, the central nervous system, and the gastrointestinal system. The slang term "crack" was derived from the crackling sound made upon igniting of this form of cocaine for smoking.

Actions and processes often undertaken by Neo-Confederates and Neo-Confederate-related or -aligned entities to present a version of the American Civil War in which secession was not rebellion, the Confederacy did not fight for slavery, and the Confederate soldier was defeated by overwhelming numbers and resources.

a group of chemical compounds based upon the molecular structure R-ONO. Formally they are alkyl esters of nitrous acid. They are distinct from nitro compounds.. Alkyl nitrites were initially, and largely still are used as medications and chemical reagents, a practice which began in the late 19th century. In their use as medicine, are often inhaled for relief of angina and other heart-related symptoms of disease. However, when referred to as "poppers", alkyl nitrites represent recreational drugs.

Any of various ideologies which portray the Confederate States of America and its actions during the American Civil War in a positive light. Some neo-Confederate organizations such as the League of the South continue to advocate the secession of the former Confederate States.
Any of various services or businesses which provide pornographic material.

A political movement born in the United States during the 1960s among liberal hawks who became disenchanted with the increasingly pacifist foreign policy of the Democratic Party and with the growing New Left and counterculture of the 1960s, particularly the Vietnam protests. Some also began to question their liberal beliefs regarding domestic policies such as the Great Society. Neoconservatives typically advocate the promotion of democracy and interventionism in international affairs, including peace through strength, and are known for espousing disdain for communism and political radicalism.

A political philosophy and variety of conservatism in the United States stressing American nationalism, Christian ethics, regionalism, and traditionalist conservatism. Paleoconservatism's concerns overlap with those of the Old Right that opposed the New Deal in the 1930s and 1940s as well as with paleolibertarianism and right-wing populism.
A person who is a victim of an anti-bisexual motivated hate crime.
An ethnic group of the Mambasa Territory, Ituri Interim Administration in the Orientale Province on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire).
Mostly historical (late 18th, early 19th century) cross-dressing which took place during the American Thanksgiving season.
Cross-dressing during Halloween as a form of Halloween costume.
The use of biological agents in terrorism. This includes the malevolent use of bacteria. viruses. or other biological toxins against people, animals. or plants.
Cross-dressing during any of various holidays.
Usage of alcohol.
An instance of purposeful misinterpretation.
Use of a chemical substance, usually involving an individual consuming said substance (which may or may not be considered a drug by cultural definition).
A subculture based around a particular kind of body modification or modifications.
An instance of an incorrect interpretation, regardless of intention.
The use of the Internet or other electronic means to stalk or harass an individual, group, or organization.
An extreme body modification subculture made up mostly of men who have had their genitals (and sometimes also their nipples) surgically removed.
A translational activity in which one produces a first and final translation on the basis of a one-time exposure to an expression in a source language.

The act of forcefully criticizing, insulting, or denouncing another person. Characterized by underlying anger and hostility, it is a destructive form of communication intended to harm the self-concept of the other person and produce negative emotions.

As defined by Mikki Kendall, hood feminism "is the feminism of the working class of people who live in inner cities, rural communities, who absolutely have to make a way out of no way, regardless of jargon".

Terrorism that is motivated by a variety of different right-wing and far-right ideologies, most prominently by neo-Nazism, neo-fascism, white nationalism, white separatism, ethnonationalism, religious nationalism, and anti-government patriot/sovereign citizen beliefs and occasionally by anti-abortion and tax resistance.

The intersection between fascism and Christianity and it also encompasses the fascistic, totalitarian, and imperialistic aspects of the Christian Church. It is sometimes referred to as "Christofascism", a neologism coined by liberation theologist Dorothee Sölle in 1970.

Terrorism meant to overthrow capitalist systems and replace them with Marxist–Leninist or socialist societies. Left-wing terrorism also occurs within already socialist states as activism against the current ruling government.
A form of fascism which incorporates some kind of religion.
Terrorism which has a political ideology or is led by some form of political viewpoint or viewpoints.
A type of infodemic in which disinformation is especially prevalent.
The act, process, or result of a whole body or any of its parts passing from one place or position to another.
A change of place or position of part of an organism that does not involve the entire organism.
The act of moving any of the tissues and hard structures surrounding the mouth other than teeth, jaws or filter structures.

A portmanteau of "information" and "epidemic" that typically refers to a rapid and far-reaching spread of both accurate and inaccurate information about something, such as a disease. As facts, rumors, and fears mix and disperse, it becomes difficult to learn essential information about an issue.
Sudden increase in the incidence of a particular type of information or information availability.
A sudden increase in occurrences of something when cases are in excess of normal expectancy for the location or season.
The act of seizing with teeth or jaws an object or organism so as to grip or break the surface covering.

An area of science research focused on scanning the internet for user-contributed health-related content, with the ultimate goal of improving public health. It is also defined as the science of mitigating public health problems resulting from an infodemic.
Any substance introduced into a living organism with therapeutic or diagnostic purpose.
The application of existing epidemiological knowledge to practical applications, like technology or inventions.
A drug prescribed for andrological use. that is, for an affected area or areas studied primarily in andrology.
Any of various drugs used to treat erectile dysfunction.

An interdisciplinary or multidisciplinary field that applies the practices, perspectives, and tools of management, information technology, education, and other areas to libraries. the collection, organization, preservation, and dissemination of information resources. and the political economy of information.
The act of stroking or touching with the tongue.

Licking which is sexual in nature.

Critical and exhaustive investigation or experimentation, having for its aim the discovery of new facts and their correct interpretation, the revision of accepted conclusions, theories, or laws in the light of newly discovered facts, or the practical application of such new or revised conclusions, theories, or laws.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.
Steroid hormones that interact with vertebrate steroid hormone receptors. The sex steroids include the androgens, estrogens, and progestogens.
Relations between heterosexual persons and bisexual persons, often tied to cultural or social attitudes.
Insensitivity to any of various androgens.
The condition of being insensitive to any of various hormones.

The extension of lesbian feminism into theoretical, fictional, or philosophical discourse.
The systematic and methodical manipulations of body tissues best performed with the hands for the purpose of affecting the nervous and muscular systems and the general circulation.

A brief greeting or parting tradition in which two people grasp one of each other's like hands, in most cases accompanied by a brief up-and-down movement of the grasped hands.
Relations between heterosexual persons and gay men, often tied to cultural or social attitudes.

Unfair or improper legal action initiated with selfish or malicious intentions. Abuse can originate from nearly any part of the legal system, including frivolous and vexatious litigants, abuses by law enforcement, incompetent, careless or corrupt attorneys and misconduct from the judiciary itself.
Any action or failure to act which causes unreasonable suffering, misery or harm to the patient.

The analysis of a group by determining the characteristics of a significant percentage of its members chosen by some process.

A populous region surrounding the San Francisco, San Pablo, and Suisun Bay estuaries in Northern California. Although the exact boundaries of the region vary depending on the source, the Bay Area is defined by the Association of Bay Area Governments to include the nine counties that border the aforementioned estuaries: Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Solano, Sonoma, and San Francisco.
A transgender person who is a student.
A theoretical concept which posits that the more older brothers a man has from the same mother, the greater the probability is that he will be gay.
A transgender person who is a librarian.
A form of police misconduct in which law enforcement officers end up breaking their political contract and abuse their power for personal gain.

A relationship between a bisexual man and a woman of any sexual orientation.
Any method of selecting a sample in which cases are not chosen by random sampling.

Insertion of a solution or compound through the rectum with the purpose of cleansing the colon or for diagnostic procedures.
The word enema can refer to the liquid so injected, as well as to a device for administering such an injection.
The insertion or injection of a substance through the anus, usually for the purpose of stimulating evacuation of the bowels.
Any of various tests utilized to showcase examples of sexism or sexist behaviors or portrayals in culture or media.
A form of psychological abuse in which a victim is manipulated into doubting their own memory, perception, and sanity.

One of five gender categories observed in Bugis culture. A bissu must be intersex or transgender in nature, having an externally male appearance and an internal female spirit (this may be represented by ambiguous genitalia, but this is not always necessarily the case). The combination of maleness and femaleness enable a "meta-gender" identity to emerge. Finally, the potential bissu must learn the language, songs, and incantations, and have a talent for bestowing blessings to be given the title of bissu. Bissu remain celibate throughout their lives and wear relatively conservative clothing.
When a person with a disability is abused physically, financially, sexually and/or psychologically due to the person having a disability.

One of five gender categories observed in Bugis culture. A calabai is a person typically assigned male at birth who takes on a more feminine role. Such persons live as women in this sense, but do not think of themselves as female and are thought of as male by other men.
An ideology which holds that a certain ethnic group or racial group is superior to others, and that they should dominate, control, and subjugate others, or are entitled to do so.
An ideology which holds that a certain class of people is superior to others, and that they should dominate, control, and subjugate others, or are entitled to do so.
A Khmer term for a culturally specific gender identity considered intermediate between pros (ប្រុស, male) and srey (ស្រី, female).
A Khmer term for a culturally specific gender identity considered intermediate between pros (ប្រុស, male) and srey (ស្រី, female).

A term in Khmer used to refer to a man who acts and dresses stereotypically masculine and engages in sexual activities with other men, but is typically married to a woman and does not usually exclusively have sex with men.

A term in Khmer used to refer to a man who acts and dresses stereotypically masculine and engages in sexual activities with other men, but is typically married to a woman and does not usually exclusively have sex with men.
Harassment or unwelcome attention of a political nature, often occurring in the environment of a workplace including hospitals, schools and universities.

A Khmer term describing a Cambodian person assigned male at person who identifies as female, occupies a more stereotypically feminine gender role, and who may use hormones or surgery to feminize their appearance.

A Khmer term describing a Cambodian person assigned male at person who identifies as female, occupies a more stereotypically feminine gender role, and who may use hormones or surgery to feminize their appearance.
A type of social influence that aims to change the behavior or perception of others through abusive, deceptive, or underhanded tactics.

A Khmer term describing a Cambodian person assigned male at person who identifies as female, occupies a more stereotypically feminine gender role, and who may use hormones or surgery to feminize their appearance.

A Khmer term describing a Cambodian person assigned male at person who identifies as female, occupies a more stereotypically feminine gender role, and who may use hormones or surgery to feminize their appearance.
Sexism in the medical profession or in medical settings.

A sex film involving bisexual people which does not usually claim any artistic merit.
Segregation in which groups of persons are separated in some or all contexts, usually dependent on some attribute of a group of persons.
A person who is married.
The process during which newcomers or minorities are incorporated into the social structure of the host society.

term: therapeutic procedure by site or system
comment: Therapeutic procedures organized by anatomical site, system, or location.
Pseudoscientific belief that empirical evidence exists to support or justify sexism, inferiority of women and/or gender minorities, or superiority of men or cisgender persons.
Sex segregation that is neither legally mandated, nor enacted in an administrative capacity, nor explicitly permitted by law.
A gay man who is part of and/or is employed by the military.

Segregation which is explicitly permitted by law, i.e. affirmatively authorized, but not necessarily legally required or encouraged. Permissive sex segregation exempts certain things from anti-sex-discrimination laws, often allowing for, among others, segregation of religious and military schools, undergraduate schools that have traditionally admitted based on sex, health clubs, athletic teams, social fraternities and sororities, choirs and choruses, voluntary youth service organizations such as the Girl Scouts and Boy Scouts, father/son and mother/daughter activities, and sex-exclusive beauty pageants and scholarships.
A lesbian who is part of and/or is employed by the military.

Administrative sex segregation involves public and government institutions segregating by sex in their operating capacity, rather than as the result of a formal mandate. Examples of administrative sex segregation include sex segregation in government sponsored medical research, sports leagues, public hospitals with shared rooms, rehabilitation programs, and some public education facilities.
An intersex person who is part of and/or is employed by the military.
Sex segregation that is legally required and enforces separation based on sex. Examples include separation of men and women in prisons, law enforcement, military service, public toilets, and housing.
A sex film involving LGBTQIA+ people which does not usually claim any artistic merit.
Sexual slavery and exploitation of persons for commercial gain.
A Telugu term for a cultural identity similar to hijra observed in the Indian states of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and the Union Territory of Puducherry.
A Telugu term for a cultural identity similar to hijra observed in the Indian states of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and the Union Territory of Puducherry.
A Gujarati term for a cultural identity similar to hijra observed in the Indian state of Gujarat.

Narrowly, the trade of humans for the purpose of forced labor, sexual slavery, or commercial sexual exploitation for the trafficker or others. Broadly, the smuggling of persons for any reason, whether consensual or non-consensual. If consensual, the term "people smuggling" or "human smuggling" may be used instead.
An inventory which assesses prejudice against a particular group or groups.
The distribution of illegal or illicit services or products.

The illegal transportation of objects, substances, information or people, such as out of a house or buildings, into a prison, or across an international border, in violation of applicable laws or other regulations.
A kind of questionnaire which elucidates aspects of a person's personality.
Services which make a product or service available for a consumer or business.

A Punjabi term for a cultural identity similar to hijra observed in northwest India and eastern Pakistan.

An inventory which assesses homophobia.

A global black market dedicated to the cultivation, manufacture, distribution and sale of drugs that are subject to drug prohibition laws. Most jurisdictions prohibit trade, except under license, of many types of drugs through the use of drug prohibition laws.
The illegal acquisition, sale, production, transport, movement, and distribution of controlled substances such as narcotics.
A tattoo which is a depiction of a specific person or item.
A tattoo with a specific meaning pertinent to the wearer.

Erotic massage which incorporates elements from the neotantric movement in the Western world massages the primary erogenous zones of the body, those being the mouth, the phallus (penis), the vagina, and the anus.
An index which aims to assess some aspect of one's identity.
Trafficking of persons for the purpose of unfree and/or forced labor, i.e. labor slavery.
A movement which aims to innovate or reform a religion or belief system. alternatively, a movement which is characterized as the emergence of a new religion or belief system.
A person who dresses and acts in a feminine manner who is devoted to the goddess Yellamma in Karnataka and may be contemporarily considered assigned male at birth.
A person who dresses and acts in a feminine manner who is devoted to the goddess Yellamma in Karnataka and may be contemporarily considered assigned male at birth.

In Warao culture, a person who may contemporarily be considered assigned male at birth who occupies a mostly female gender role, is said to possess two spirits, and may assume a sociocultural role as a shaman. The term "tida wena" literally translates as "twisted women".

In Thai culture, an assigned female at birth person who is gay or bisexual and dresses and acts in a stereotypically masculine fashion. Toms typically engage in relationships in dees (similar to butch-femme relationships).

In Thai culture, an assigned female at birth person who is gay or bisexual and dresses and acts in a stereotypically masculine fashion. Toms typically engage in relationships in dees (similar to butch-femme relationships).

A form of hate crime arising from the hostility of the perpetrator towards the disability, or perceived disability, of the victim, or because of their perceived connection to disability. It is often viewed politically as a logical extreme of ableism (sometimes known in the United Kingdom by the disputed word "disablism"), carried through into criminal acts against the person.
An index which assesses prejudice against LGBTQIA+ persons.

A form of harassment, primarily sexual harassment that consists of unwanted comments, gestures, honking, wolf-whistlings, catcalling, exposure, following, persistent sexual advances, and touching by strangers in public areas such as streets, shopping malls, and public transportation.

One of five gender categories observed in Bugis culture. A calalai is a person typically assigned female at birth who takes on a more masculine role. Such persons dress and present as men, hold stereotypically masculine professions, and usually live with female partners to adopt children.

The most numerous ethnic group of the three major linguistic and ethnic groups of South Sulawesi (the others being Makassar and Toraja), in the southwestern province of Sulawesi, third largest island of Indonesia. The Austronesian ancestors of the Bugis people settled on Sulawesi around 2500 BCE.

Narrowly, misconduct which occurs when a judge acts in ways that are considered unethical or otherwise violate the judge's obligations of impartial conduct. broadly, any kind of misconduct associated with any part of the legal process or to the administration of justice.
A person who is a victim of an anti-lesbian motivated hate crime.
A person who is a victim of an anti-gay motivated hate crime.
Trafficking which occurs when organs are removed from the body for the purpose of commercial transactions.
Trafficking of children for any purpose, including slavery, forced labor, or sexual exploitation.

An Indigenous Amerindian people inhabiting northeastern Venezuela, Trinidad and Tobago, Guyana, and Suriname. The term Warao translates as "the boat people," after the Warao's lifelong and intimate connection to the water. Most of the approximately 20,000 Warao inhabit Venezuela's Orinoco Delta region, with smaller numbers in neighboring Guyana, Trinidad and Tobago, and Suriname. They speak an agglutinative language, Warao.
An insult which takes the form of a verbal expression or statement.
An action or form of speech deliberately onr unintentionally rude.
A behavior which is deemed disrespectful or scornful.

A religious or spiritual group that has modern origins and is peripheral to its society's dominant religious culture. NRMs can be novel in origin or part of a wider religion, in which case they are distinct from pre-existing denominations. Some NRMs deal with the challenges posed by the modernizing world by embracing individualism, whereas others seek tightly knit collective means.
Low-intensity uncivil behaviors which violate respectful workplace norms.

A term applied to a range of spiritual or religious beliefs and practices that grew rapidly in Europe and the United States during the 1970s. Precise scholarly definitions of the New Age differ in their emphasis, largely as a result of its highly eclectic structure. Although analytically often considered to be religious, those involved in it typically prefer the designation of spiritual or Mind, Body, Spirit and rarely use the term New Age themselves.
Social behavior deemed as lacking in civility.

A contemporary European and American variation of tantra associated with new religious movements. Some of its proponents refer to ancient and traditional texts and principles, and many others use tantra as a catch-all phrase for "sacred sexuality", and may incorporate unorthodox practices.

Sending, receiving, or forwarding sexually explicit messages, photographs, or images, primarily between mobile phones, of oneself to others. It may also include the use of a computer or any digital device.
Communication between cell phone users via the Short Message Service protocol which allows the interchange of short written messages.

The act of composing and sending electronic messages, typically consisting of alphabetic and numeric characters, between two or more users of mobile devices, desktops/laptops, or other type of compatible computer. Text messages may be sent over a cellular network, or may also be sent via an Internet connection.
Services offered to end users in a mobile telecommunications environment by a service provider or a specific service plan of a service provider.
An insult directed towards one's parents.
Public locations where members of a community tend to gather for group activities, social support, public information, and other purposes.
Public locations where members of the LGBTQIA+ community tend to gather for group activities, social support, public information, and other purposes.

Wrongdoings perpetrated when an institution fails to prevent or appropriately respond to wrongdoings by other individuals. In instances when individuals experiencing traumatic events place a great deal of trust in the legal, medical, and mental health systems to address their wrongs they risk disbelief, blame, and refusal of help.
A structure of the body which has had its morphology altered in some way.
Trauma as a result of sexual assault, harassment, violence, or other related sexual behaviors.
Any part of an organism.

A traumatic psychological effect shared by a group of people of any size, up to and including an entire society. Traumatic events witnessed by an entire society can stir up collective sentiment, often resulting in a shift in that society's culture and mass actions.
A marker for when handedness of an organism is not known.
Deleterious experiences in first 18 years of life.
Betrayal trauma experienced when a relationship's unspoken agreements have been breached.
A mass of cells which is proliferative in nature.
Sexual assault that occurs during, or in a situation related to, military service.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.
Experiences of sexual assault, or repeated threatening sexual harassment that occurred while a person was in the military.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Sexual trauma experienced during adulthood.
A body structure which has undergone some process of alteration which is nonnormative or otherwise considered abnormal.
Sexual trauma experienced during childhood.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.
A new, uncontrolled cell growth outside of typical physiologic control.
Elderly sexual assault is victimization of persons over the age of 60, most of whom suffer from decreased functionality, frailty and weakness, and therefore are reliant on caretakers.

A Tanner stage characterized by an elevation of the breast and extension beyond the borders of the areola, which continue to widen but remain in contour with surrounding breast (typically between age 11.5 and 13).
The offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting of any item of value to influence the actions of an official, or other person, in charge of a public or legal duty.
A Tanner stage characterized by the formation of the breast bud, with a small area of surrounding glandular tissue and a widening of the areola (typically age 10 to 11.5).
Violation of laws, regulations, or professional standards.
A Tanner stage characterized by a complete lack of glandular tissue. the areola follows the skin contours of the chest (typically age 10 and younger).
The commission of an unlawful act, done in an official capacity, that affects the performance of official duties.
Intentional falsification of scientific data by presentation of fraudulent or incomplete or uncorroborated findings as scientific fact.
A Tanner stage characterized by a testicular volume between 1.6 and 6 ml accompanied by the scrotal skin reddening and enlarging. the penis length remains unchanged (typically ages 9 to 11).
Trauma caused by man-made, technological and natural disasters, including war, abuse, violence, mechanized accidents (car, train, or plane crashes, etc.) or medical emergencies.
A Tanner stage characterized by testicular volume less than 1.5 ml accompanied by a relatively small penis (typically age 9 and younger).
A pattern of passive hostility and an avoidance of direct communication.
A Tanner stage characterized by the breast reaching its final adult size during which the areola returns to contour of the surrounding breast with a projecting central papilla (typically age 15+).
Misconduct involving financial and/or business matters.

A Tanner stage characterized by increased breast sizing and elevation during which the areola and papilla form a secondary mound projecting from the countour of the surrounding breast (typically ages 13 to 15).
A failure to exercise appropriate and or ethical ruled care expected to be exercised amongst specified circumstances.
A Tanner stage characterized by a testicular volume greater than 20 ml during which the scrotum and penis reach their adult sizes (typically age 14+).
A Tanner stage characterized by a testicular volume between 12 and 20 ml during which the scrotum enlarges further and darkens and the penis increases in length (between ages 12.5 and 14).
A trauma perpetrated by someone with whom the victim is close to and reliant upon for support and survival.
A Tanner stage characterized by a testicular volume between 6 and 12 ml during which the scrotum enlarges further and the penis begins to length (between ages 11 and 12.5).
Trauma experienced by workers who witness their clients' trauma.
A distortion of the historical record.
Denial of the scientific consensus.
Health services utilized in order to prevent the spread of or otherwise prevent infectious disease.
An anxiety disorder in which a person who is normally capable of speech cannot speak in specific situations or to specific people.
The act of denying the genocide of Jews in the Holocaust during World War II.

The belief, contradicted by conclusive evidence, that human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) does not cause acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS). Some of its proponents reject the existence of HIV, while others accept that HIV exists but argue that it is a harmless passenger virus and not the cause of AIDS. Insofar as they acknowledge AIDS as a real disease, they attribute it to some combination of sexual behavior, recreational drugs, malnutrition, poor sanitation, haemophilia, or the effects of the drugs used to treat HIV infection (antiretrovirals).

A term used primarily, but not exclusively, in the United States to describe any community not considered white. The term encompasses all non-white communities, emphasizing common experiences of systemic racism.
A therapeutic procedure that either destroys or inhibits the growth of microbes (such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans).
Selective mutism as a result of gender dysphoria.
Health services which aim to prevent HIV infection or the onset of AIDS.
The alteration of the growth process of an organism or something else.
A common law criminal offense consisting of the intentional maiming of another person's genitalia.

The collective sexual assault of women, and sometimes children, in public by groups of unrelated men. Typically acting under the protective cover of large gatherings, victims have reported being groped, stripped, beaten, bitten, penetrated and raped.
A term that refers to the classification of a neoplastic process according to the anatomic site that is involved.

A form of abuse where the perpetrator, who is responsible for caring for someone who is unable to care for themselves, fails to do so. It can be a result of carelessness, indifference, or unwillingness.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas. malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
An abnormal and excessive growth of tissue which is uncoordinated with that of surrounding tissue and persists growing abnormally even if its original trigger is removed.

A form of child abuse and a deficit in meeting a child's basic needs, including the failure to provide adequate supervision, health care, clothing, or housing, as well as other physical, emotional, social, educational, and safety needs.
A population of cells following a period of cell population proliferation.
A form of emotional abuse projected by a narcissist on to another individual.
A grouping of individual biological cells.
An act that constitutes a serious violation of the laws of war that gives rise to individual criminal responsibility.
Refusal to admit the truth or reality of a situation or experience.
A psychological defense mechanism that allows a person to avoid the reality of the situation by refusing to acknowledge it.

Course of conduct directed at a specific person that involves repeated (two or more occasions) visual or physical proximity, nonconsensual communication, or verbal, written, or implied threats, or a combination thereof, that would cause a reasonable person fear.
A neoplasm that is non-cancerous.
The intentional, direct injuring of body tissue, done without the intent to commit suicide.
Neoplasms organized by their status in regard to their malignancy.

Group psychological abuse refers to groups where methods of psychological abuse are frequently or systematically used on their members. Such abuse would be practices that treat the members as objects one is free to manipulate instead of respecting their autonomy, human rights, identity and dignity.
Kaposi's sarcoma related to AIDS.

A behavioral condition in which an individual neglects to attend to their basic needs, such as personal hygiene, appropriate clothing, feeding, or tending appropriately to any medical conditions they have.
An essentially irrational action that withholds the validation of a historical experience or event, when a person or movement refuses to accept an empirically verifiable reality.
A person who is associated with AIDS and/or its viral agent, HIV. This includes those infected with HIV, those who study the virus and disease, and those indirectly affected by it.
Epidemics of infectious disease that have spread to many countries, often more than one continent, and usually affecting a large number of people.
A gay man who has HIV.
A child of a person who has HIV.
A parent of a person who has HIV.

term: family member of person with HIV
comment: A person who is related to, or otherwise or belongs to the same family as, a person who has HIV.
A bisexual man who has HIV.
A bisexual person who has HIV.
An overwhelming, irrational, and persistent fear of contracting Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome.
Prejudice based on one's disease status.
A substance used in the prophylaxis or therapy of retroviral diseases (diseases caused by members of the family Retroviridae).
A man who has HIV.
A gay person who has HIV.
A heterosexual person who has HIV.
A child who has HIV.

Sudden outbreaks of a disease in a country or region not previously recognized in that area, or a rapid increase in the number of new cases of a previous existing endemic disease. Epidemics can also refer to outbreaks of disease in animal or plant populations.
Sudden increase in the incidence of a disease. The concept includes epidemics and pandemics.
A woman who has HIV.

The surgical creation of a clitoris in transgender women (as part of gender confirmation surgery), restoration in the case of procedures reversing the damage caused by female genital cutting, or surgery to change clitoral size for women and girls with congenital adrenal hyperplasia.
The surgical removal, reduction, or partial removal of the clitoris.
Surgical repair of the vagina.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the vagina.
Creation of a new vagina where one was previously absent.
Any surgical procedure that results in the construction or reconstruction of the vagina.
Any surgical procedure that results in the construction or reconstruction of the vagina.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the intestine to create the vagina.
Construction of a vagina following damage to it or its destruction.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the colon to create the vagina.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the ileum to create the vagina.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the ileocecal intestine to create the vagina.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the clitoris.

A general term encompassing three types of excision of the external female genitalia: Sunna, clitoridectomy, and infibulation. It is associated with severe health risks and has been declared illegal in many places, but continues to be widely practiced in a number of countries.
Neocolporrhaphy using part of the rectosigmoid colon.
A surgical procedure that repairs a defect in the wall of the neovagina.
Phalloplasty using a pedicled flap.
Surgical creation of a feminized vulva without a vagina.
Phalloplasty with tissue completely removed from the forearm with blood vessels and nerves intact.
Phalloplasty using skin grafts with intact blood vessels and nerves.

term: anterior lateral thigh pedicled flap phalloplasty
comment: Phalloplasty in which the tissue is separated from the blood vessels and nerves of the anterior lateral thigh.
Persons who are transgender or gender nonconforming.
Phalloplasty in which donor tissue is taken from the back muscles underneath the arm.

term: genderqueer, gender nonconforming, and gender nonbinary people
comment: Persons who are genderqueer, identify as nonbinary, or are otherwise gender nonconforming.
Phalloplasty using a suprapubic abdominal flap.
A person who identifies as agender.
A person who identifies as agender.

term: osteocutaneous radial forearm free flap phalloplasty
comment: Phalloplasty using an osteocutaneous radial forearm free flap.
A person who considers themself to be gender nonconforming or someone who expresses gender nonconformity to some extent.
A person who does non conform to expected or enforced gender roles, identities, and/or expressions.
A person who considers themself to be gender nonconforming or someone who expresses gender nonconformity to some extent.
A person who does non conform to expected or enforced gender roles, identities, and/or expressions.
Phalloplasty utilizing any of various skin flaps which lack significant bias in their vascular patterns.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the sigmoid colon to create the vagina.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the cecum to create the vagina.
Vaginoplasty which utilizes peritoneum flaps to line a portion of the vaginal canal. The remainder of the surgery is performed in a similar manner to penile inversion vaginoplasty.
Vaginoplasty which uses a section of the rectosigmoid colon to create the vagina.
Vaginoplasty in which the vaginal canal is constructed from part of the rectal cavity.
Vaginoplasty using the buccal mucosa lining the mouth.
Vaginoplasty in which the skin from outside the penis is removed and used to create the lining of the vagina.
Vaginoplasty using penile skin and a urethral flap.
Vaginoplasty which uses a penile skin graft and scrotal flaps.
A surgical procedure that repairs a defect in the wall of the vagina.
Vaginoplasty in which the vagina is lined with a skin graft which is placed on a vaginal mold and then placed into the space that is opened to become the vagina.
An instance of adrenogenital syndrome that is acquired during the lifetime of the individual.
Inequality based upon age.

Abnormal sex differentiation or congenital intersex conditions caused by abnormal levels of steroid hormones expressed by the gonads or the adrenal glands, such as in congenital adrenal hyperplasia and adrenal cortex neoplasms.

Abnormal sex differentiation or congenital intersex conditions caused by abnormal levels of steroid hormones expressed by the gonads or the adrenal glands, such as in congenital adrenal hyperplasia and adrenal cortex neoplasms.
Inequality based upon economic status. distribution of income, distribution of wealth, etc.
Occurence of adrenarche at a later than normal age.
The condition of not being equal.
An instance of adrenogenital syndrome that is congenital.

Inequality which occurs when resources in a given society are distributed unevenly, typically through norms of allocation, that engender specific patterns along lines of socially defined categories of persons.
First period after the age of 15 years.
Gender inequality is the state of unequal ease of access to resources and opportunities based on, or otherwise related to, gender, including economic participation and decision-making.
Inequality based upon race.
Any of various flags used to represent the LGBTQ community or any of its subcommunities.
Various medical interventions organized by type or intended result.
Later than normal development of the breasts.
The unequal distribution of academic resources, including but not limited to. school funding, qualified and experienced teachers, books, and technologies to socially excluded communities.
Inequality based upon educational status.
Any of various symbols relating to sexuality.
Any of various surgeries aiming to masculinize intersex anatomical variations.
Privilege based on one's race.
Any of various symbols relating to gender and/or sexuality.
Any of various medical interventions for those expressing intersex conditions or variations.
Privilege based on one's sexuality and/or sexual orientation.
Any of various symbols related to masculinity or male genitalia, especially the penis.
Any of various intersex-related surgeries performed on the genitalia.
The use of scientific studies and pseudo-evidence in effort to legitimize homophobic beliefs and rhetoric.

A gender symbol is a pictogram or glyph used to represent either biological sex or sociological gender in either biology, medicine, genealogy or selective breeding, or in sociology, gender politics, LGBTQ subculture and identity politics.
Any of various surgeries aiming to feminize intersex anatomical variations.
A special, unearned advantage or entitlement, used to one's own benefit or to the detriment of others. often, the groups that benefit from it are unaware of it.
Any of various genital surgeries used as treatment for transfeminine persons in alleviation of gender dysphoria.
Any of various social ideologies which focus upon sexuality-specific identities.
Any of various genital surgeries used as treatment for transmasculine persons in alleviation of gender dysphoria.
A social ideology which posits that heterosexual persons are superior to persons who are not heterosexual.
A mental health difference that adversely affects disadvantaged populations.
Any of various social ideologies which focus upon ethnicity-specific identities.
Differences in access to or availability of medical facilities and services.
The tendency to look at the world primarily from the perspective of one's own traditional, deferred, or adoptive ethnic culture.
Any of various genital surgeries used as treatment for transgender persons in alleviation of gender dysphoria.
Removal of ovotestis.
Surgery during which an ovotestis or ovotestes are excised.
The tendency to focus on the procreation and rearing of children in society.
Any of various social ideologies which focus upon species-specific identities.
A social ideology which posits that humans are the most important entity in the universe.
Any of various chest surgeries used as treatment for transgender persons in alleviation of gender dysphoria.
A grouping of disorders caused by abnormal levels of steroid hormones expressed by the gonads or the adrenal glands.
Any of various conditions or states in the field of mathematics.
Any disease affecting the adrenal gland.
The quality of being the same in quantity or measure or value or status.

term: congenital adrenogenital disorder associated with enzyme deficiency
comment: An adrenogenital disorder which is present at birth and which is associated with an enzyme deficiency.
Any of various social ideologies which focus upon religion-specific identities.
An adrenogenital disorder which is congenital in nature.
A social ideology which posits that a person's own religion is more important or is superior to the religions of others.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the pansexual community.

A surgical procedure in which one or both testicles are removed (bilateral orchiectomy). The surgery is typically performed as treatment for testicular cancer, in some cases of testicular torsion, and is sometimes used in the management of advanced prostate cancer. It may also be performed as part of transfeminine gender confirmation surgery.

A surgical procedure in which one or both testicles are removed (bilateral orchiectomy). The surgery is typically performed as treatment for testicular cancer, in some cases of testicular torsion, and is sometimes used in the management of advanced prostate cancer. It may also be performed as part of transfeminine gender confirmation surgery.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the asexual community.
Surgical removal of the testes.

Any unearned advantages accrued by an individual by virtue of being a national of a First World country. There is a large overlap between First World privilege and white privilege, as most First World nations were founded and developed by white people.
A health difference that adversely affects LGBTQIA+ populations.
Discrimination against and negative perception of people based on how their voices sound.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Taiwanese.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Tanzanian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Thai.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Tongan.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Trinidadian or Tobagonian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Trinidadian.
Privilege based on one's spoken and/or written language, dialect, or accent.
A surgery during which one of both testicles are removed, along with the spermatic cord.
Ideas and/or beliefs about how persons of particular gender roles, identities, and/or expressions should behave and act.
A surgery during which part of a testicle is removed.
Any of various social norms reflecting sexuality and what "normal" sexuality looks like in regards to certain sex acts, sexual criteria, social roles, socioeconomic status, etc.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the labia.
Privilege based on one's quality, tone, or other aspects of voice.
A surgery during which one or both testicles are removed.
The social privilege gained by those with a deep voice.

The branch of linguistics which inquires into the nature of language itself and seeks to answer fundamental questions as to what language is. how it works. how universal grammar (UG) as a domain-specific mental organ operates, if it exists at all. what are its unique properties. how does language relate to other cognitive processes, etc.
Surgical removal of the gonads, usually the ovaries or the testes.
Any of various social norms reflecting romantic feelings and what "normal" romantic feeling looks like in regards to certain romantic acts, romantic criteria, social roles, socioeconomic status, etc.
The work of objectively analyzing and describing how language is actually used (or how it was used in the past) by a group of people in a speech community.
Medical procedures performed for the purposes of castration or otherwise causing castration.
The idea that romance is tied to traditional ideas of sexual activity, monogamy, and/or marriage and that romantic love is not possible outside of these traditional boundaries.
The study of the history of words. By extension, the term "the etymology (of a word)" means the origin of the particular word and for place names, there is a specific term, toponymy.
Partial or complete removal of one or both of the ovaries.
Partial or complete removal of one or both of the ovaries.
The idea that heterosexuality is normative or default and that sexual and marital relationships "fit" between men and women.
An interdisciplinary field which identifies, investigates, and offers solutions to language-related real-life problems.
Chemical castration of the gonads, usually the ovaries or the testes, by usage of any of various pharmaceutical agents.
The idea that being cisgender is normal. i.e. the assumption that a person's gender identity always matches their sex as assigned at birth.
An ideogram that conveys its meaning through its pictorial resemblance to a physical object.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the testes.
Privilege based on one's gender.
Any of various symbols related to femininity or female genitalia, especially the vagina.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the wolffian genital system.
An ideogram used to represent a given phenotypic sex or gender identity, depending on context.
Surgery to move an undescended (cryptorchid) testicle into the scrotum and permanently fix it there.
Heterosexual privilege confers unearned and unchallenged advantages and rewards on heterosexuals solely as a result of their sexual orientation.
A pictogram used to represent a given phenotypic sex or gender identity, depending on context.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the penis.

The societal privilege that benefits white people over non-white people, particularly if they are otherwise under the same social, political, or economic circumstances. With roots in European colonialism, the spread of the British Empire, and the enactment of the Atlantic slave trade, white privilege has developed over centuries, in circumstances that have broadly sought to protect white racial privileges, various national citizenships and other rights or special benefits.
Surgical procedures performed on the urethra.
Privilege based on one's religious status.
Privilege based on one's social class.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the lesbian community.
Surgery in which hypospadias is repaired.

A concept within sociology for examining social, economic, and political advantages or rights that are available to men solely on the basis of their gender. A man's access to these benefits may vary depending on how closely they match their society's ideal masculine norm.
Surgery in which the urethra is repaired.
Privilege based on one's ethnicity, ethnic group, and/or ethnic heritage.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the bisexual community.
Construction of a penis following damage to it or its destruction.
Social privilege based on one's identity as cisgender or being non-transgender.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the gay male community.
Surgery in which epispadias is repaired.
Privileges based on multiple intersecting identities.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the intersex community.
Surgical repair of the testicle.

Any of several advantages bestowed upon Christians in some societies. This arises out of the presumption that Christian belief is a social norm, that leads to the marginalization of the nonreligious and members of other religions through institutional religious discrimination or religious persecution. Christian privilege can also lead to the neglect of outsiders' cultural heritage and religious practices.
Flags used by or used to represent members of the transgender community.
Creation of a new penis where one was previously absent.
A concept used to examine the economic, social, and political advantages or benefits that are made to both men and women solely based on their physical appearance.
Therapy that emphasizes lifelong patterns, affective change techniques, and the therapeutic relationship.
The construction or reconstruction of a penis, or the artificial modification of the penis by surgery.
The construction or reconstruction of a penis, or the artificial modification of the penis by surgery.

Pertaining to sexual behavior or identity which does not conform to conventional heterosexual norms, assumptions etc.
A growth or enlargement of some part of an organism's morphology.

Physical, sexual, and/or psychological maltreatment or neglect of a child or children, especially by a parent or a caregiver. Child abuse may include any act or failure to act by a parent or a caregiver that results in actual or potential harm to a child, and can occur in a child's home, or in the organizations, schools or communities the child interacts with.
The jargon or language of a group, often employed to exclude or mislead people outside the group.
Surgery in which the condition of chordee is released.
Domestic violence by a current or former spouse or partner in an intimate relationship against the other spouse or partner.
A secret language used by various groups (e.g., schoolmates, outlaws, colleagues, gay people among many others) to prevent outsiders from understanding their conversations.
A bladder exstrophy-epispadias-cloacal exstrophy complex that is characterized by a defect in the urethra, bladder and bowel.
The assumption that romantic and sexual relationships can only occur, or are only normal, between two monogamous partners.
A technical terminology unique to a particular subject.

Violence or other abuse by one person against another in a domestic setting, such as in marriage or cohabitation.
An argot used specifically by gay people.
A congenital anomaly that involves the protrusion of the exstrophied bladder through the abdominal wall.
A single, or repeated act, or lack of appropriate action, occurring within any relationship where there is an expectation of trust, which causes harm or distress to an older person.

The perpetration or threat of an act of violence by at least one member of an unmarried couple on the other member in the context of dating or courtship. It also arises when one partner tries to maintain power and control over the other through abuse or violence, for example when a relationship has broken down. This abuse or violence can take a number of forms, such as sexual assault, sexual harassment, threats, physical violence, verbal, mental, or emotional abuse, social sabotage, and stalking. In extreme cases it may manifest in date rape. It can include psychological abuse, emotional blackmail, sexual abuse, physical abuse and psychological manipulation.
A gay person who is a Buddhist.

According to Rushton, this theory explains race differences in fertility, IQ, criminality, and sexual anatomy and behavior. The theory also hypothesizes that a single factor, the "K factor", affects multiple population statistics Rushton referred to as "life-history traits".

However, because Jensen and proponents often used this theory to argue scientifically racist thought, it became associated with the theory that Black persons are genetically mentally inferior to white persons, based on the results of IQ tests.

A white supremacist ideology which views the supposed Aryan race as a distinct and superior racial group which is entitled to rule the rest of humanity. Initially promoted by racist theorists such as Arthur de Gobineau and Houston Stewart Chamberlain, Aryanism reached its peak of influence in Nazi Germany. In the 1930s and 40s, the regime applied the ideology with full force, sparking World War II with the 1939 invasion of Poland in pursuit of Lebensraum, or living space, for the Aryan people. The racial policies which were implemented by the Nazis during the 1930s came to a head during their conquest of Europe and the Soviet Union, culminating in the industrial mass murder of six million Jews and eleven million other victims in what is now known as the Holocaust.
A racist and white supremacist ideology which views the "Nordic race" as an endangered and superior racial group.
