A device that has been modified or constructed specifically for the purpose of making music. In principle, anything that somehow produces sound can serve as a musical instrument, but the term is generally reserved for items having this specific purpose.

A category of firearms with longer barrels than most other types. In small arms, a long gun is generally designed to be held by both hands and braced against the shoulder, in contrast to a handgun, which can be fired being held with a single hand.

A short-barrelled firearm that can be held and used with one hand. The two most common handgun sub-types in use today are revolvers and semi-automatic pistols, although other handguns like machine pistols and derringers also see infrequent usage.
Any of various weapons meant specifically for throwing.
A ranged weapon system consisting of an elastic launching device (bow) and long-shafted projectiles (arrows).

A weapon designed to pneumatically discharge solid projectiles but can also be liquid (as in water guns/cannons and projected water disruptors) or even charged particles (as in a plasma gun) and may be free-flying (as with bullets and artillery shells) or tethered (as with Taser guns, spearguns and harpoon guns).
Groups that advocate for civil rights.

Rights affecting transgender people encompassing everything from the prohibition of intersex genital mutilation and inclusive, comprehensive intersex health care.
Any of a a diverse array of media technologies that reach a large audience via mass communication.

While originally applied to the reportage of current events in printed form, specifically newspapers, with the advent of radio and television the use of the term has broadened to include all printed and electronic communication dealing with current affairs.

A health care provider may ask a patient to consent to receive therapy before providing it, or a clinical researcher may ask a research participant before enrolling that person into a clinical trial. Informed consent is collected according to guidelines from the fields of medical ethics and research ethics.

The human practice of defecating outside (in the open environment) rather than into a toilet. People may choose fields, bushes, forests, ditches, streets, canals or other open space for defecation. A slogan that arose in the late 1980s and early 1990s that has primarily been used by social conservatives as a political stance and strategy. The term is described as a response to gay pride adopted by various LGBTQ groups in the early 1970s, or to the accommodations provided to gay pride initiatives.
Male gender roles classified by relative role importance in the individual.
Heterosexual women who self-identify with what is considered to be a traditional femininity.

A color-coded system, employed usually among the gay male casual-sex seekers or BDSM practitioners in the United States, Canada, Australia and Europe, to indicate preferred sexual fetishes, what kind of sex they are seeking, and whether they are a top/dominant or bottom/submissive. Note that, since the 1970s, many groups of LGBTQIA+ persons (not just gay men) have started using similar codes in certain spaces.
Heterosexual men who self-identify with what is considered to be a traditional masculinity.
A psychological term for the absence of female stereotypical traits.
A psychological term for the exaggeration of female stereotypical behavior.
Polyamorous relationships in which partners fall within particular hierarchies as primaries, secondaries, etc.
Female gender roles classified by relative role importance in the individual.
Experience of romantic attraction.

The concept that transgender women are women trapped in men's bodies. This idea has been interpreted in many senses, as a female mind, spirit, soul, personality, etc., as well as in more literal senses such as having a female brain structure. it is also a psychological narrative, that is, a self-description of how some transgender women see themselves, or of how they may portray themselves to qualify for certain medical treatments.

Syphilis acquired in utero and manifested by any of several characteristic tooth (Hutchinson's teeth) or bone malformations and by active mucocutaneous syphilis at birth or shortly thereafter. Ocular and neurologic changes may also occur.

Situational sexual behavior differs from that which the person normally exhibits, due to a social environment that in some way permits, encourages, or compels the behavior in question. This can also include situations where a person's usual sexual behavior may not be possible, so rather than not engaging in sexual activity at all, they may engage in different sexual behaviors.
A syphilis that is the first stage of syphilis, marked by the development of a chancre, which is characterized by mononuclear leukocytic infiltration, macrophages, and lymphocytes.
A psychological term for the exaggeration of male stereotypical behavior, such as an emphasis on physical strength, aggression, and sexuality.
A partner in a polyamorous relationship that one lives with.

A psychological term for the absence of male stereotypical traits. For example, it is the absence of the de-emphasising of feelings and relationships. Oftentimes, individuals who exhibit hypomasculine traits display unmasculine professional or physical characteristics that deviate from the norm.
Psychological process that occurs when an individual adapts to a significant emotional event or stimulus.
Damage to the mind that occurs as a result of a distressing event.
Personal care products used by menstruators during menstruation or vaginal discharge.

A theory which states that trauma can be transferred from the first generation of trauma survivors to the second and further generations of offspring of the survivors via complex post-traumatic stress disorder mechanisms.
Any of various menstruation devices that can only be used once and then must be disposed.

A culturally specific gender identity in Kanaka Maoli (Native Hawaiian) and Maohi (Tahitian) cultures. Such persons typically have specific traditional spiritual and social roles within the specific culture. The term means "in the middle".

A culturally specific gender identity in Kanaka Maoli (Native Hawaiian) and Maohi (Tahitian) cultures. Such persons typically have specific traditional spiritual and social roles within the specific culture. The term means "in the middle".
Any of various devices utilized for the purposes of personal hygiene.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the integumentary system.
The state of being subjugated. forced control by others.
A hygiene device that is inserted into the vagina during menstruation. Its purpose is to collect menstrual fluid (blood from uterine lining) and prevent its leaking onto clothes.
A gender role and category in the Chamorro culture of the Northern Marianas Islands, including Guam.

Oppression can refer to an authoritarian regime controlling its citizens via state control of politics, the monetary system, media, and the military. denying people any meaningful human or civil rights. and terrorizing the populace through harsh, unjust punishment, and a hidden network of obsequious informants reporting to a vicious secret police force.

An absorbent item worn in the underwear by persons who are menstruating, bleeding after giving birth, recovering from gynecologic surgery, experiencing a miscarriage or abortion, or in any other situation where it is necessary to absorb a flow of blood from the vagina.
Any of various menstruation devices that can be used multiple times.
The act of dominating. exercise of power in ruling. dominion. supremacy. authority, often when arbitrary or insolent.

A hygiene product designed to absorb the menstrual flow by insertion into the vagina during menstruation. Once inserted correctly a tampon is held in place by the vagina and expands as it soaks up menstrual blood.

term: skin and subcutaneous tissue surgical procedures
comment: Surgical procedures performed on parts of the skin and subcutaneous tissue.
Oppression based primarily upon social class.
A set of breasts feminized in a cisgender woman, typically without external hormones and/or surgery.
A member of Indonesia's traditional transfeminine third gender category.
Oppression based primarily upon gender roles, gender norms, gender identity, gender expression, or other manifestations of gender.
Having an identity considered nonbinary or as falling under the nonbinary umbrella.
Having an identity considered nonbinary or as falling under the nonbinary umbrella.
Social oppression is when a single group in society takes advantage of, and exercises power over, another group using dominance and subordination.
Public international organizations and agencies of international government.
Transgender identity in Japan which is not considered male or female. Sometimes considered equivalent to words like genderqueer or non-binary.
Transgender identity in Japan which is not considered male or female. Sometimes considered equivalent to words like genderqueer or non-binary.
Oppression based primarily upon racial categories.
To attribute or refer to a person qualities which do not match their gender.

An extinct gender designation or category historically observed among the Kamchadals, especially the Itelmens. Most resources describe them as persons assigned male at birth who lived as women in the community, especially in the role of shamans. However, some sources also describe persons assigned female at birth occupying male roles as "koekchuch".

An extinct gender designation or category historically observed among the Kamchadals, especially the Itelmens. Most resources describe them as persons assigned male at birth who lived as women in the community, especially in the role of shamans. However, some sources also describe persons assigned female at birth occupying male roles as "koekchuch".

An alternative gender role or categorization referred to in Oman and some parts of the Arabian Peninsula. The term usually refers to those assigned male at birth who may express themselves in a somewhat feminine manner or engage in relationships with men.

An alternative gender role or categorization referred to in Oman and some parts of the Arabian Peninsula. The term usually refers to those assigned male at birth who may express themselves in a somewhat feminine manner or engage in relationships with men.
Any therapeutic procedure in which hormone levels are intentionally deprived.

Something that misleads or distracts from a relevant or important question. It may be either a logical fallacy or a literary device that leads readers or audiences toward a false conclusion. A red herring may be used intentionally, as in mystery fiction or as part of rhetorical strategies (e.g., in politics), or may be used in argumentation inadvertently.

A heterogeneous gender role or categorization of the Indian subcontinent. Typically used to refer to persons assigned male at birth who take on a passive role in sexual relationships with other men (analogous to the idea of a "bottom" in many English-speaking countries).

A heterogeneous gender role or categorization of the Indian subcontinent. Typically used to refer to persons assigned male at birth who take on a passive role in sexual relationships with other men (analogous to the idea of a "bottom" in many English-speaking countries).

A heterogeneous gender role or categorization of the Indian subcontinent. Typically used to refer to persons assigned male at birth who take on a passive role in sexual relationships with other men (analogous to the idea of a "bottom" in many English-speaking countries).
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of hormones.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of hormones.
In law, a preliminary prospectus (a document that advertises or describes in order to inform clients or other persons).

Providing a character implied to be queer or express queerness, only to be revealed as heterosexual and cisgender (such as Jughead Jones being coded as asexual in the TV series "Riverdale" and then later expressing heterosexuality).
Use of homosexuality as a device to distract, as during the "Lavender Scare" of the 1950s in the United States.
In psychoanalysis, the idea that sexual orientation actually reveals very little about a person's unconscious and is only focused on as a conceptualization of a cisnormative and heteronormative world
Hormone therapy provided for the purposes of delaying the onset of puberty and the development of secondary sexual characteristics.
Racism as practiced by persons who are part of the LGBTQiA+ community,
An equivalent identity to kothi observed in Cochin.

A political approach and analysis based on people prioritizing the concerns most relevant to their particular racial, religious, ethnic, sexual, social, cultural or other identity, and forming exclusive political alliances with others of this group, instead of engaging in more traditional, broad-based party politics.

A political approach and analysis based on people prioritizing the concerns most relevant to their particular racial, religious, ethnic, sexual, social, cultural or other identity, and forming exclusive political alliances with others of this group, instead of engaging in more traditional, broad-based party politics.
A removal of people who are considered undesirable by those in power from a government, another organization, their team leaders, or society as a whole.
An equivalent identity to kothi observed in Kolkata.
An equivalent identity to kothi observed in Kolkata.
Political activities based upon cultural designations, groups, and/or relationships between said entities.
A removal of LGBTQ persons by those in power from a government, another organization, their team leaders, or society as a whole.
An equivalent identity to kothi observed in Pakistan.
An equivalent identity to kothi observed in Pakistan.
Hormone therapy provided to transgender youth for the purposes of delaying the onset of puberty and the development of secondary sexual characteristics.

term: Gay and Lesbian Kingdom of the Coral Sea Islands
comment: A micronation established as a symbolic political protest by a group of gay rights activists based in Australia. Declared in 2004 in response to the Australian government's refusal to recognise same-sex marriages, it was founded on Australia's external overseas Territory of the Coral Sea Islands, a group of uninhabited islets east of the Great Barrier Reef. The Kingdom was dissolved on 17 November 2017 following the decision made by the Australian people to legalise gay marriage.

A Nepali word with no direct translation in English. it is often used to refer to transgender women or other persons assigned female at birth with expression of some female gender identity. however, it can also be used to refer to cross-dressers, hijra, and feminine cisgender gay men.
An equivalent identity to kothi observed in Nepal.
Political activities which openly acknowledge how aspects of sociopolitical identity discrimination overlap (for example, race and gender).
The introduction of polymeric organic silicon based material through the skin, as for breast augmentation or reconstruction.

Allyship in which diversity and inclusivity as practiced by the methodologies involved act only on a superficial level. allyship which fundamentally misunderstands issues and may actually make situations worse for marginalized peoples.

A gender designation offered by the government of Nepal in addition to male and female. It is often used as a "catch-all" term for gender variance in Nepal, but its usage varies greatly depending on context.

A gender designation offered by the government of Nepal in addition to male and female. It is often used as a "catch-all" term for gender variance in Nepal, but its usage varies greatly depending on context.
A state of harmony between internal needs and external demands and the processes used in achieving this condition.

One of the eight federal districts of Russia. It is located in extreme southern Russia, in the geographical area of the North Caucasus. The federal district was split from Southern Federal District on 19 January 2010.
A relationship process in which one builds trust and accountability with members of a marginalized group or groups.
A removal of primarily gay men by those in power from a government, another organization, their team leaders, or society as a whole.
Administration of a drug through the skin.
Allyship which is fabricated. allyship which is simulated for any of various purposes (such as a political election or for a university's diversity rankings).
A removal of primarily gay women by those in power from a government, another organization, their team leaders, or society as a whole.

The individual rights as applied to members of racial, ethnic, class, religious, linguistic or gender and sexual minorities. and also the collective rights accorded to minority groups. Minority rights may also apply simply to individual rights of anyone who is not part of a majority decision.
Rights affecting LGBTQ people encompassing everything from the legal recognition of same-sex marriage to the death penalty for homosexuality.
A gender identity (or lack thereof) which may be described as lacking gender, genderless, gender neutral, neutrois, or unknown gender, among other descriptions.
Events pertaining to or focused on drag.
Having a gender identity which partially overlaps with a particular gender identity, such as feeling partially female but not entirely.
An annual graduation conducted at some universities to honor LGBTQIA+ students and acknowledge their accomplishments and contributions.

A dyke march is a lesbian visibility and protest march, much like the original LGBTQ Pride parades and LGBTQ rights demonstrations. The main purpose being the encouragement of activism within the lesbian community.
Fields of inquiry in human constructs and concerns as opposed to natural processes and social relations. These are traditionally the study of literature, philosophy, and religion.
A march which addresses lesbian rights, builds community, and creates lesbian visibility.
A branch of knowledge.

A group of one or more populations of an organism or organisms seen by taxonomists to form a unit. Although neither is required, a taxon is usually known by a particular name and given a particular ranking, especially if and when it is accepted or becomes established. It is not uncommon, however, for taxonomists to remain at odds over what belongs to a taxon and the criteria used for inclusion. If a taxon is given a formal scientific name, its use is then governed by one of the nomenclature codes specifying which scientific name is correct for a particular grouping.
The view that every entity has a set of attributes that are necessary to its identity and function.
The promotion of the self-affirmation, dignity, equality, and increased visibility of LGBTQIA+ people as a social group.
a type of garment fetish in which a person derives pleasure from the diaper and/or use of it.
Commemorative events specific to the LGBTQ community and LGBTQ people.
A system that is composed of non-physical objects, i.e. ideas or concepts.
A sexual fetish that involves role-playing a regression to an infant-like state.
Having a gender identity which fluctuates or switches (such as being male sometimes and female other times).
Oppression based primarily upon sexuality.
A set of breasts masculinized in a transgender man, typically due to surgery and/or hormones.
Oppression based primarily upon religion, religious sect, or particular religious beliefs.
A device used to introduce a stream of water into the body for medical or hygienic reasons, or the stream of water itself.
A procedure in which a stream of liquid is introduced into a body cavity, most commonly the vagina, for medical or hygienic reasons.
Having a gender identity that is genderless or having no gender identity whatsoever.
A set of breasts virilized in a cisgender man, typically without external hormones and/or surgery.
Having a multiple gender identities simultaneously.
Oppression based primarily upon age.
A set of breasts feminized in a transgender woman, typically due to hormones and/or surgery in a transgender woman.
Having a gender identity which includes part of another gender identity, but not all of it (for example, identifying somewhat with female, but not entirely).
A qualitative analytic framework that identifies how interlocking systems of power affect those who are most marginalized in society.
Any garment worn underneath others, especially one worn next to the skin. an item of underwear.
Conferences specific to the transgender community and transgender people.
Having a gender identity which overlaps somewhat with other gender identities but not in their entirety.
Clothing as sorted by primary anatomical usage.
Having a gender identity which overlaps with other gender identities, but doesn't necessarily fit into them.

Oppression in which an oppressed group comes to use against itself the methods of the oppressor. Internalized oppression occurs when one group of people recognizes a distinct inequality of value compared to another group of people and, as a result, desires to be like the more highly valued group.
A douche utilized for the purposes of vaginal irrigation.
Having a gender identity which is neutral, placed between other gender identities, such as between male and female.

A form of internalized oppression in which a member of a given racial group consciously or unconsciously accepts another racial group's racist views, stereotypes, and biases toward their own racial group.
A device designed to rinse the rectum with the intent to clean it, in many cases in preparation for anal intercourse.
Having three gender identities.
Conferences specific to the bisexual community and bisexual people.
Having two gender identities.
Festivals specific to the bisexual community and bisexual people.

Having a gender identity which varies over time (usually with a discernable pattern, but not always), usually between male or female, although not always. Genderfluid persons may switch pronoun usage or prefer gender-neutral pronouns.
An item of clothing that is worn on the foot
Having more than three gender identities. more broadly, having more than one gender identity.
Accessories worn on the hand.
A behavior marked by ethical characteristics, a pleasant disposition, and concern and consideration for others. It is considered a virtue, and is recognized as a value in many cultures and religions.

An outward expression of an appropriate inner, or self regard, and is contrasted with humiliation which is an imposition, often external, of shame upon a person. Humility may be misappropriated as ability to suffer humiliation through self-denouncements which in itself remains focused on self rather than low self-focus.
The quality of being humble.

A set of beliefs and practices that aim to improve the genetic quality of a human population by excluding (through a variety of morally criticized means) certain genetic groups judged to be inferior, and promoting other genetic groups judged to be superior.
An East Asian ethnic group and nation native to China. They constitute the world's largest ethnic group, making up about 18% of the global population.

A widely influential concept at the interface of the social and biological sciences in the 19th century which theorized that civilization might be in decline and that the causes of decline lay in biological change. These ideas derived from pre-scientific concepts of heredity ("hereditary taint") with Lamarckian emphasis on biological development through purpose and habit. Degeneration concepts were often associated with authoritarian political attitudes, including militarism and racist science, as well as with fears of national decline.
Personal guarantees and freedoms that the government cannot abridge, either by law or by judicial interpretation, without due process.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily in China.
The hypothesis that an organism can pass on characteristics that it has acquired through use or disuse during its lifetime to its offspring.
A movement aiming to free or liberate a particular group of persons from societal expectations, standards, bondage, or other various types of discriminatory behavior.
A Romance ethnic group native to Spain. Within Spain, there are a number of nationalisms and regionalisms, reflecting the country's complex history and diverse culture.
Any of various scientific theories addressing parts of the phenomenon known as biological evolution.

One of the seven virtues and is understood by Thomas Aquinas as "the friendship of man for God", which "unites us to God". The Catechism of the Catholic Church defines "charity" as "the theological virtue by which we love God above all things for His own sake, and our neighbor as ourselves for the love of God".

An ethnic group inhabiting the Arab world. They primarily live in the Arab states in Western Asia, North Africa, the Horn of Africa and western Indian Ocean islands. They also form a significant diaspora, with Arab communities established around the world.

A theory of biological evolution developed by the English naturalist Charles Darwin (1809–1882) and others, stating that all species of organisms arise and develop through the natural selection of small, inherited variations that increase the individual's ability to compete, survive, and reproduce.
The rights of individuals to act and make decisions without external constraints.

An East Slavic ethnic group and nation native to European Russia and other parts of Eastern Europe (some territories of the former Tsardom of Russia and Russian Empire), the most numerous ethnic group in Europe. The majority of ethnic Russians live in the Russian Federation, notable minorities exist in other former Soviet states such as Belarus, Kazakhstan, Moldova, Ukraine and the Baltic states.
The systematic study of the nature of literature and of the methods for analyzing literature.

An Indo-Aryan ethnic group native to the Bengal region in South Asia, specifically in the eastern part of the Indian subcontinent, presently divided between Bangladesh and the Indian states of West Bengal, Tripura, Assam's Barak Valley, who speak Bengali, a language from the Indo-Aryan language family.

The extension of feminism into theoretical, fictional, or philosophical discourse. Feminist theory focuses on analyzing gender inequality. Themes explored in feminism include discrimination, objectification (especially sexual objectification), oppression, patriarchy, stereotyping, art history and contemporary art, and aesthetics.
Any change or disturbance in social interaction or ability to socially interact.
An East Asian ethnic group native to Korea and southwestern Manchuria. Koreans mainly live in the two Korean states: North Korea and South Korea (collectively and simply referred to as Korea).
Humanities fields that form the basis of humanities studies. i.e. non-applied humanities.

A political alignment of women and feminist intellectualism that emerged in the late 1960s and continued into the 1980s primarily in the industrialized nations of the Western world, which affected great change (political, intellectual, cultural) throughout the world.
A Germanic ethnic group native to Central Europe, who share a common German ancestry, culture and history. German is the shared mother tongue of a substantial majority of ethnic Germans.
A branch of critical theory that focuses on human–object interactions in literature and culture.
The interests, opinions, behaviours, and behavioral orientations of an individual, group, or culture.

An ethnic group of Americans with total or partial ancestry from any of the Black racial groups of Africa. The term typically refers to descendants of enslaved Black people who are from the United States.
A Romance ethnic group native to the Italian peninsula and its neighbouring insular territories. Most Italians share a common culture, history, ancestry or language.
Humanities fields that apply knowledge in specific contexts.
A set of beliefs that explains or accounts for a general philosophy or specific branch of philosophy.
The virtues recognized by Plato and in the Bible, Old Testament, classical antiquity and in traditional Christian theology as prudence, courage, temperance, and justice.
A contemplative and rational type of abstract or generalizing thinking about a phenomenon, or the results of such thinking.
The ability to govern and discipline oneself by the use of reason.
Awareness events specific to the LGBTQ community and LGBTQ people.
Analytical frameworks, or paradigms, that are used to study and interpret social phenomena.
Legal rights and freedoms relating to reproduction and reproductive health that vary amongst countries around the world.
A parade celebrating lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer (LGBTQ) social and self-acceptance, achievements, legal rights and pride.
Philosophical theories falling under the scope of the field of metaphysics.

The ability to do as one pleases. In modern politics, liberty is the state of being free within society from oppressive restrictions imposed by authority on one's way of life, behavior, or political views. In philosophy, liberty involves free will as contrasted with determinism. In theology, liberty is freedom from the effects of "sin, spiritual servitude, [or] worldly ties".
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily on the continent of Europe.

Perspectives in sociology and social psychology that emphasize a materialist interpretation of history, dialectical method of analysis, a critical stance toward existing social arrangements, and political program of revolution or, at least, reform. Conflict theories draw attention to power differentials, such as class conflict, and generally contrast historically dominant ideologies. It is therefore a macro-level analysis of society.
An interdisciplinary field of study analyzing the cultural, historical, and interpersonal impact of the asexual experience on society.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily on the continent of Africa.
Statements of how and why particular facts about the social world are related. They range in scope from concise descriptions of a single social process to paradigms for analysis and interpretation.
One of the seven heavenly virtues. Diligent behavior is indicative of a work ethic. a belief that work is good in itself. Diligence is carefulness and persistent effort or work.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily in Oceania.

An explanation of an aspect of the natural world that can be repeatedly tested and verified in accordance with the scientific method, using accepted protocols of observation, measurement, and evaluation of results. Where possible, theories are tested under controlled conditions in an experiment.
Moderation or voluntary self-restraint. It is typically described in terms of what an individual voluntarily refrains from doing.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily on either of the Americas.

The reflective assessment and critique of society and culture by applying knowledge from the social sciences and the humanities. Critical theory has origins in sociology and also in literary criticism.
The traditional four classical cardinal virtues combined with the three theological virtues (faith, hope, and clarity) adopted by the Church Fathers.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily on the continent of South America.
Any of various theories in the realm of biology which are considered defunct, disproven, and/or obsolete.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily on the continent of North America.
Scientific theories falling under the scope of the field of biology.

The ability to endure difficult circumstances such as perseverance in the face of delay. tolerance of provocation without responding in annoyance/anger. or forbearance when under strain, especially when faced with longer-term difficulties. Patience is the level of endurance one can have before negativity. It is also used to refer to the character trait of being steadfast.
Any of various ethnic groups located primarily on the continent of Asia.
An interdisciplinary field of study analyzing the cultural, historical, and interpersonal impact of the gay and lesbian experience on society.

term: LGBTQ culture in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
comment: LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
An interdisciplinary field of study analyzing the cultural, historical, and interpersonal impact of gay men's experiences on society.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of South Africa.
The subfield of queer studies dealing specifically with transgender people.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of China.
An umbrella term for analyzing lesbian, gay, and bisexual experiences. Sometimes used to distance the lesbian, gay, and bisexual communities from the transgender community via its exclusion.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Bangladesh.
An interdisciplinary field of study analyzing the cultural, historical, and interpersonal impact of the bisexual experience on society.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Indonesia.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of India.
An interdisciplinary field of study analyzing the cultural, historical, and interpersonal impact of the intersex experience on society.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Japan.
An adolescent man who is bisexual.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Israel.
An adolescent woman who is bisexual.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Oman.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Nepal.
A field of history that looks at the lived experience of the past.
A small ethnic group of approximately 95,000 located in the Southern Nations, Nationalities, and People's Region at the border between north and south Omo of Ethiopia.
A field of interdisciplinary study covering multiple areas under the umbrellas of gender and sexuality.
Studies or areas of the humanities which utilize specialized knowledge from multiple domains.
LGBTQIA+ cultures on the continent of Asia.
An interdisciplinary academic field devoted to topics concerning men, masculinity, feminism, gender, and politics.
LGBTQIA+ cultures on the continent of Africa.

Gender studies is a field for interdisciplinary study devoted to gender identity and gendered representation as central categories of analysis. This field includes women's studies (concerning women, feminism, gender, and politics), men's studies and queer studies.

Gender studies is a field for interdisciplinary study devoted to gender identity and gendered representation as central categories of analysis. This field includes women's studies (concerning women, feminism, gender, and politics), men's studies and queer studies.

Gender studies is a field for interdisciplinary study devoted to gender identity and gendered representation as central categories of analysis. This field includes women's studies (concerning women, feminism, gender, and politics), men's studies and queer studies.
LGBTQIA+ cultures on the continent of South America.
An interdisciplinary academic field of study that is focused on girlhood and girls' culture that combines advocacy and the direct perspectives and thoughts of girls themselves.
LGBTQIA+ cultures on the continent of North America.
The academic field which examines topics concerning women, feminism, and the relationship of gender and politics.
LGBTQIA+ cultures on the continent of Europe.
An interdisciplinary field of study analyzing the cultural, historical, and interpersonal impact of the lesbian experience on society.
LGBTQIA+ cultures on the continent of Oceania.
An interdisciplinary academic field of study that is focused on boyhood and boys' culture.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Kenya.

The study of issues relating to sexual orientation and gender identity usually focusing on lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, gender dysphoria, asexual, queer, questioning, intersex people and cultures.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Egypt.
the study of issues relating to sexual orientation, sexual fetishes, kink, and other aspects of sexuality and sexual diversity.
LGBTQIA+ cultures in the country of Nigeria.
Male chauvinism is the belief that men are superior to women.
Chauvinism which believes in the superiority of a gender category over another.
An extreme form of nationalism that promotes absolute devotion to the interests of one's own state or people above all others.
Female chauvinism is the belief that women are superior to men.
A state of Germany from 1918 to 1947.
Former state in north central Germany. Formally abolished March 1, 1947. Kingdom established 1701.

Fascism is a form of radical authoritarian ultranationalism, characterized by dictatorial power, forcible suppression of opposition and strong regimentation of society and of the economy, which came to prominence in early 20th-century Europe.
A political ideology that combines the political and economic doctrines of fascism and clericalism.

A country in Central Europe that existed from 1947 to 1989, and the predecessor of the modern democratic Republic of Poland. With a population of approximately 37.9 million inhabitants near the end of its existence, it was the most populous state of the Eastern Bloc after the Soviet Union.
A post-World War II political ideology which usually includes various fascist elements such as ultranationalism, racial supremacy, populism, authoritarianism, nativism, and xenophobia.

A theoretical political ideology in which an authoritarian government would require individuals to put environmental issues above all other interests. It is almost exclusively used as a rhetorical pejorative to undermine environmental movements.

a form of nationalism based on the belief that all inhabitants of a particular distinctive sub-sovereign region should share a common national identity, regardless of their ethnic, linguistic, religious, cultural and other differences.

Queer nationalism is a phenomenon related both to the gay and lesbian liberation movement and nationalism. Adherents of this movement support the notion that the LGBT community forms a distinct people due to their unique culture and customs.
Nationalism based upon LGBTQIA+ identities.

A form of nationalism in which the nation is defined by a shared culture. It is an intermediate position between ethnic nationalism and civic nationalism. Therefore, it focuses on a national identity shaped by cultural traditions, but not on the concepts of common ancestry or race.
Homonationalism is the favorable association between a nationalist ideology and LGBTQ people or their rights.
Homonationalism is the favorable association between a nationalist ideology and LGBTQ people or their rights.
An ideology of extending a country's rule over foreign nations, often by military force or by gaining political and economic control of other areas.

An aggressive radical form of nationalism or ethnic nationalism that incorporates autonomous, heightened ethnic consciousness and patriotic sentiments with atavistic fears and hatreds focused on "other" or foreign peoples, framing a belief in expansion or recovery of formerly owned territories through militaristic means.
An aggressive or fanatical patriotism, particularly during time of war, in support of one's own nation (e.g., government, culture, etc.) versus other nation(s).
A form of extreme patriotism and nationalism and a belief in national superiority and glory.
A term used for the political notion that welfare benefits should be restricted to certain groups, particularly to the natives of a country as opposed to immigrants.
A political ideology most often associated with the Nazi Party (the National Socialist German Workers' Party) in Nazi Germany and other far-right groups expressing similar goals and desires.

The racist belief that white people are superior to people of other races and therefore should be dominant over them. White supremacy has roots in scientific racism, and it often relies on pseudoscientific arguments. Like most similar movements such as neo-Nazism, white supremacists typically oppose members of other races as well as Jews.
Post-World War II political ideologies seeking to implement the ideas of Nazism.

Gender variance, or, sometimes, gender nonconformity, is behavior or gender expression exhibited by an individual that does not match cultural/social masculine and feminine gender norms and/or expectations.

Gender variance, or, sometimes, gender nonconformity, is behavior or gender expression exhibited by an individual that does not match cultural/social masculine and feminine gender norms and/or expectations.
A racial supremacist belief which maintains that Black people are superior to people of other races.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, the African-American bisexual community.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, the African-American pansexual community.
Any of various glucocoricoids which act as a steroid hormone.

A group of corticosteroids carrying hydroxy groups, usually in the 11- or 17-positions. They comprise the bulk of the corticosteroids used systemically. As they are relatively insoluble in water, salts of various esterified forms are often used for injections or solutions.

A group of hydroxycorticosteroids bearing a hydroxy group at the 17-position. Urinary excretion of these compounds is used as an index of adrenal function. They are used systemically in the free alcohol form, but with esterification of the hydroxy groups, topical effectiveness is increased.
A regimen of combined oral contraceptives in which 21 days of active contraceptive pills are followed by a hormone-free interval (HFI) of 7 placebo pills.
Any of various regimens involving combined oral contraceptives (COCs).
A regimen of combined oral contraceptives in which 24 days of active contraceptive pills are followed by a hormone-free interval (HFI) of 4 placebo pills.

term: congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to steroid 17α-hydroxylase deficiency
comment: A rare form of congenital adrenal hyperplasia which is caused by steroid 17α-hydroxylase deficiency.

Decreased or absent activity of the enzyme 17-alpha-hydroxylase/17,20 lyase due to loss-of-function mutation(s) in the CYP17A1 gene. The clinical manifestations of the deficiency are dependent on whether one or both activities of the enzyme are affected, and may include hypertension due to reduced 17-hydroxylase activity and incomplete genital masculinization in 46,XY infants due to reduced 17,20 lyase activity.
Any of various regimens of oral contraceptives.
Any of various regimens related to contraceptive use.
A vaginoplasty procedure in which a functional vagina is constructed and the penis is left intact.
Any of various surgeries for gender confirmation which involve removal of all genital structures, with preservation of the urethra.
Surgical resection of the scrotum.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the face.
Any of a variety of surgical procedures that alter anatomical traits to provide physical traits more comfortable to the nonbinary person's gender identity and functioning.
Surgical repair of the vulva.
Any surgical procedure that results in the construction or reconstruction of the vulva.
The surgical removal of all or part of the scrotum.
Surgical repair of the scrotum.
Lip augmentation using one's own tissue.
Lip augmentation in which a soft, solid silicone implant or implants are implanted in the lip or lips.
Lip augmentation in which lip fillers are injected into the upper and/or lower lips.
A modification of the bullhorn lip lift, which aims to achieve the same aesthetic effect while using a shortened incision.
A lip lift procedure which consists of a lenticular excision of the white skin surrounding the upper oral commissure in order to lift this part of the lips.
A lip lift technique similar to the subnasal bullhorn lift, which involves shortening the space between the lips and the nose by using an incision at the lower nose.

A technical variant of the gull-wing lip lift is the sub-nasal lip lift (bull-horn lip lift), which involves the removal of either an ellipse or a curved-edge ellipse of tissue from under the nose. The skin then is raised, and sutured to lift the lip and expose more of the upper-lip vermilion. Depending upon the indications of the patient, this technique can increase the drooping the corners of the mouth (commissures). thus, the sub-nasal lip lift often includes a corner-lift surgical step. In the corner lift procedure (external angle oral commissuroplasty), triangles of tissue are resected from above the commissures, thereby elevating the corners of the mouth.[3] A descending wedge of tissue can also be removed to add contour to the Cupid's bow or to reduce bulky lips.

A surgical technique for increasing the prominence (display) of the vermilion coloring of the lips, by removing skin (and other tissues) as required, ether directly from or from above the white line of skin that borders onto, and sets off, the vermilion of the lips (the white roll). The incisions remove tissue and significantly alter the shape of the lips by moving up the vermilion from both peaks of the Cupid's bow outwards to the commissures, the corners of the mouth. Incisions are also made below the lower lip to increase the projection of the vermilion of the lower lip.
A plastic surgery procedure that modifies the appearance of the lips by reshaping them to increase the prominence of the vermilion border.
The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
Any of various sex positions in which one person is on top of another person during a penetrative sexual activity.
Lip augmentation in which a tissue graft to the lips is made. Typically, skin is removed from the lower stomach area and utilized.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.
A subspecialty of internal medicine concerned with morphology, physiology, and pathology of the blood and blood-forming tissues.
A sex position In which one person lies on one side with knees bent while the other person lies with their front pressed against the other person's back, with possible penetration.
Lip augmentation in which fat transfer to the lips is made.
Studies or areas of the biology which utilize specialized knowledge from multiple domains.
The study of the chemical substances and vital processes occurring in living organisms.
The study of the composition, chemical structures, and chemical reactions of living things.
The branch of biochemistry dealing with the chemical nature and biological activity of enzymes.

Any of various emotionally and physically intimate acts between two or more people meant to create sexual arousal and desire for sexual activity. Although foreplay is typically understood as physical sexual activity, nonphysical activities, such as mental or verbal acts, may in some contexts be foreplay. Foreplay can mean different things to different people.
Studies or areas of the chemistry which utilize specialized knowledge from multiple domains.
The study, evaluation, and interpretation of literature.

A parenting style in which gender roles are not directly imposed upon a child. This may involve presenting activities as non-gendered, buying of gender-neutral or unisex clothing until the child chooses their own, and/or usage of gender-neutral pronouns and forms of address until specified by the child.
Any of various behaviors which precede sexual activity in animals.
A plastic surgery procedure in which excess skin is removed from the forehead.
A plastic surgery procedure in which the eyebrows are raised on the forehead.
Any surgical procedure that results in the reconstruction of the brow.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the brow.
Forehead reduction surgery in which the hairline is lowered.
A surgical procedure in which the sape and/or volume of the forehead is changed.
A surgical procedure in which the height of an individual's forehead is reduced.
Lobuloplasty in which the size and shape of the earlobe or earlobes is reduced.
An oral contraceptive pill taken as part of a 365+0 oral contraceptive regimen.
A type of procedure that aims to increase lip "fullness" through enlargement using fillers such as hyaluronic acid, fat or implants.
An oral contraceptive pill taken as part of an 84+7 oral contraceptive regimen.
A regimen of combined oral contraceptives in which 84 days of active contraceptive pills are followed by a hormone-free interval (HFI) of 7 placebo pills.
An oral contraceptive pill taken as part of a 21+7 oral contraceptive regimen.
Any of various sex positions in which an orifice, typically the vagina or anus, is entered from behind.
A mosaic karyotype in which some cells are 45,X and some are 47,XXX.
A regimen of combined oral contraceptives in which 365 consecutive days of active contraceptive pills per year. there are no placebo pills in this regimen.

An umbrella term used to refer to interpersonal relationships which exist in the intermediate space between casual sexual encounters ("hooking up") and formal relationship statuses. Also used to refer to the development of more romantic feelings during the course of a purely sexual relationship.
A genetic mosaic in which some cells are 45,X and others are 47,XXX.

An approach to counseling or therapy which embraces a positive view of an individual's identities and relationships and addresses the negative influences that discrimination and marginalization have on the lives of clients.
Surgery performed in which the jaw bone is reduced.
Surgery performed in which the shape of the jaw bone is changed.
A surgery in which which a person's own bone is used to change the shape of the chin.
Surgical operations on the mandible.
Surgical operations on the facial bone.
Surgical operations on the maxillofacial bone.
An event, often held at local libraries or similar venues, in which a drag performer reads a books to children. such events often feature other activities such as doing crafts.
The act of putting an end to slavery by law.
An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of gay identity and gay relationships and addresses the negative influences that homophobia and heterosexism have on the lives of gay clients.
Pain which affirms one's gender identity. for instance, chest and back pain in transgender women.

The act of putting an end to something by law. Typically used to refer to ending the Atlantic slave trade and slavery in Western Europe and the Americas, but may refer to abolition of various other systems.

A type of counseling where the therapist addresses the struggles of a client whose race, gender, socioeconomic background, religion, or any other part of their identity which is marginalized or minoritized.

An abolitionist movement which seeks to reduce or eliminate prisons and the prison system, and replace them with systems of rehabilitation that do not place a focus on punishment and government institutionalization.
An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of disability-related identities and relationships and addresses the negative influences that ableism has on the lives of disabled clients.
A social phenomenon that transmits collective illusions of threats, whether real or imaginary, through a population in society as a result of rumors and fear.
The act of putting an end to prisons or other forms of incarceration by law.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of LGBTQIA+ identities and relationships and addresses the negative influences that homophobia, transphobia, and heterosexism have on the lives of LGBTQIA+ clients.
The branch of medical science that deals with the classification of mental health conditions or psychiatric conditions.

Any of various movements to end slavery in any of its various forms. Usually used to apply to the end of the Atlantic slave trade and ending slavery in Western Europe and the Americas. However, it may also refer to historical movements attempting to end "white slavery", i.e. the sexual enslavement of white women.
Drag events merged with stage bingo events, often held by LGBTQIA+ bars and LGBTQIA+-oriented organizations.
A hierarchical classification of mental health conditions or psychiatric conditions.

A mass hysteria that inaccurately suggests that if transgender women are allowed to use bathroom facilities matching their gender identity, that cisgender men would disguise themselves as transgender women to access those facilities and sexually assault cisgender women.

A movement which became prominent in the late 19th century, via the International Abolitionist Federation (IAF), which aimed to abolish state regulation of sex work and fought the international trafficking of women in prostitution and sexual slavery.

Use of an abortifacient to prevent embryonic implantation in the event that fertilization has occurred. Various methods are used to do this: the morning-after pill (diethylstilbesterol), prostaglandins in vaginal suppositories, and RU 486 (mifepristone). Menstrual extraction was also somewhat popular in the 1970s, but is no longer recommended.
A surgery which uses implants to change the shape of the cheeks.
Surgical operations on the cheek.
Rhinoplasty which is performed to increase the projection of the nasal dorsum in profile.

Another variation of a lip lift is for a surgeon to make an incision inside the mouth to loosen the mucosa and vermilion, which are then advanced and secured, leaving a portion of scar tissue inside the mouth which may take 2–4 months to heal. Yet another technique uses a "W" incision inside the mouth to create several "V" flaps, which are then used in a V-to-Y plasty technique to advance the vermilion of either or both lips.[3] This procedure leaves no exposed areas inside the mouth, but can be painful and has a lengthy recovery period.
A lip lift in which the columella of the nose is not incised.
double duck lip lifts

A variant of the indirect lip lift in which a square stitch is placed from one nostril to the other and down to the peaks of the Cupid's bow. This variation has fallen out of favor because the results are short-lived.
A lip lift in which the incisions are hidden at the base of the nose.
Any surgical procedure that results in the reconstruction of the lip or lips.
The study of the social, cultural, psychological, cognitive, and biological aspects of aging.

Spontaneous or induced abortion which involves an embryo or fetus present in the abdominal cavity. Occasionally, abdominal abortion can happen following a brief tubal pregnancy, as the embryo becomes too large for the distal part of the tube and is therefore ejected into the abdominal cavity. Following the abortion, an embryo or fetus may be reabsorbed, calcified over an extended period of time, or require surgical removal.
Any of various procedures which use surgical implants to alter the underlying structure of the chin.
Ideas which conform to societal expectations of masculinity or understandings of what "normal" masculinity should look like in a given society.
Deliberate and voluntary abandonment of a marital partner with the intention of ending the marriage agreement without justification and without intent of reunion.
Surgical operations on the chin.
Culture attributed to "bottoms", usually (but not always) meaning persons who are penetrated during gay male intercourse.
Birth which occurs via the vagina.
A surgery in which buccal fat is removed in order to reduce the size of the cheeks.
Culture attributed to "tops", usually (but not always) meaning persons who are penetrating during gay male intercourse.
Surgical removal of part or all of the uterus via an abdominal approach.

The practice of relinquishing interests and claims over one's offspring in an illegal way with the intent of never resuming or reasserting guardianship. The phrase is typically used to describe the physical abandonment of a child, but it can also include severe cases of neglect and emotional abandonment, such as when parents fails to provide financial and emotional support for children over an extended period of time.
A specialty concerned with the use of x-ray and other forms of radiant energy in the diagnosis and treatment of disease.
A month dedicated to bringing awareness to a certain health cause and/or condition.
Culture based upon sexual role, or role during sexual performance.
Birth which occurs via the abdominal cavity, almost always via Caesarean section.
Delivery of an infant through the vagina in a person who has had a prior Caesarian section.

The branch of psychology that studies unusual patterns of behavior, emotion and thought, which may or may not be understood as precipitating a mental disorder. Although many behaviors could be considered as abnormal, this branch of psychology typically deals with behavior in a clinical context. There is a long history of attempts to understand and control behavior deemed to be aberrant or deviant (statistically, functionally, morally or in some other sense), and there is often cultural variation in the approach taken. The field of abnormal psychology identifies multiple causes for different conditions, employing diverse theories from the general field of psychology and elsewhere, and much still hinges on what exactly is meant by "abnormal".

A potentially life-threatening condition in which embryo implantation occurs outside the cavity of the uterus. Most ectopic pregnancies (>96%) occur in the Fallopian tubes, known as tubal pregnancy. They can be in other locations, such as uterine cervix. ovary. and abdominal cavity (pregnancy, abdominal).

Any of various non-governmental social movement engaged in activism related to the issues of human rights. The foundations of the global human rights movement involve resistance to: colonialism, imperialism, slavery, racism, segregation, patriarchy, and oppression of Indigenous peoples.
Any intervention which utilizes progestogens.
Any therapeutic procedure in which progestogen levels are intentionally deprived.
Any therapeutic procedure in which estrogen levels are intentionally deprived.
Any therapeutic procedure in which androgen levels are intentionally deprived.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of nonbinary identity and nonbinary relationships and addresses the negative influences that nonbinaryphobia has on the lives of nonbinary clients.
The pathological sudden breaking away of a portion from a mass.
Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is an implant.
Menstruation as experienced by transgender men.
The separation of parts of the body that are normally joined together.

term: testosterone replacement therapy by subcutaneous injection
comment: Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is subcutaneous injection.
Menstruation as experienced by cisgender women.
Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is injection.
Menstruation as experienced by nonbinary persons.
Premature separation of the normally implanted placenta from the uterus. Signs of varying degree of severity include uterine bleeding, uterine muscle hypertonia, and fetal distress or fetal death.
Placental separation from the uterus with bleeding (concealed or vaginal) before fetal birth, with or without maternal/fetal compromise.

term: testosterone replacement therapy by intramuscular injection
comment: Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is intramuscular injection.
Any of various human rights movements which advocate for reproductive rights.
A form of hormone therapy in which testosterone is replaced.
An action or event regarded as morally or legally wrong and causing general public outrage.
A human rights movement which advocate for legal access to induced abortion services.
A form of hormone therapy in which progestogens are replaced.
A war between organized groups within the same state or country.
A body structure which has undergone some mechanical process of alteration which is nonnormative or otherwise considered abnormal.
The active, professed refusal of a citizen to obey certain laws, demands, orders or commands of a government.
A person who carries out induced abortions. Typically this term is applied to persons who perform illegal induced abortions or is otherwise used to convey disapproval of induced abortions.
Menstruation as experienced by intersex men.
Menstruation as experienced by intersex persons.
A word, phrase, or expression which has a technical definition.
Menstruation as experienced by intersex women.

term: affirmative counseling for persons questioning their sexual orientation
comment: Affirmative counseling provided for persons who are questioning their sexual orientation.
An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of asexual identity and asexual relationships and addresses the negative influences that aphobia has on the lives of asexual clients.
An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of intersex identity and asexual relationships and addresses the negative influences that intersexphobia has on the lives of intersex clients.
Affirmative counseling provided for intersex persons.
An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of pansexual identity and pansexual relationships and addresses the negative influences that biphobia has on the lives of pansexual clients.
An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of bisexual identity and bisexual relationships and addresses the negative influences that biphobia has on the lives of bisexual clients.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of transgender identity and transgender relationships and addresses the negative influences that transphobia has on the lives of transgender clients.

A personality is a complex sum of dispositions and predispositions towards mental processes and behaviour. It inheres in a person. Personality is not the same as mood, although a person may have a personality that includes a predisposition to moods of certain types, moods may come and go but a personality stays relatively constant, not appearing and disappearing. Personality typically changes slowly over time.

An estrogen medication which was previously used for estrogen-type indications such as the treatment of menopausal symptoms in women. The term specifically refers to formulations of estriol conjugates which were manufactured from the estrogen-rich urine of pregnant women and were used as medications in the 1920s and 1930s. Conjugated estriol is analogous to and was superseded by conjugated estrogens (brand name Premarin), which is manufactured from the urine of pregnant mares.
The aborted fetus following an incomplete abortion, in which some fetal tissue remains in the uterus.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of transgender identity and transgender relationships and addresses the negative influences that transphobia has on the lives of transgender women clients.
A state in which attention is largely directed outward from the self.
A personality trait manifesting itself in individual behavioral characteristics that are perceived as positive, assertive, social, and outgoing.

A theory of gender development introduced by Sandra Bem in 1981. It asserts that gender-associated information is predominantly transmuted through society by way of schemata, or networks of information that allow for some information to be more easily assimilated than others.
The aborted fetus following an in-progress abortion or an otherwise inevitable abortion.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of transgender identity and transgender relationships and addresses the negative influences that transphobia has on the lives of transgender men clients.
A state in which attention is largely directed inward upon one's self.
The aborted fetus following a spontaneous abortion.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of lesbian identity and lesbian relationships and addresses the negative influences that homophobia and heterosexism have on the lives of lesbian clients.
A process whereby individuals of a given gender are encouraged or otherwise helped in overcoming systematic bareers to gender equality (such as health or education disparities).
The aborted fetus following an incomplete abortion which has become infected.

An approach to therapy that embraces a positive view of gay male identity and gay male relationships and addresses the negative influences that homophobia and heterosexism have on the lives of gay male clients.
The aborted fetus following an induced abortion.

term: affirmative counseling for persons questioning their gender identity
comment: Affirmative counseling provided for persons who are questioning their gender identity.
The right to a safe and legal abortion for pregnant persons.
A bodily disposition is a disposition that inheres in some extended organism.
The aborted fetus following an impending abortion.
A mental disposition is a bodily disposition that is realized in a mental process.

Steroidal compounds related to estriol. Estriol congeners include important estradiol precursors in the biosynthetic pathways, metabolites, derivatives, and synthetic steroids with estrogenic activities.
The aborted fetus following a completed abortion.
Women's empowerment is the process in which women elaborate and recreate what it is that they can be, do, and accomplish in a circumstance that they previously were denied.
Someone who advocates for abortion rights.

Broadly, the strong social reactions of outrage, anger, or surprise, when accusations or rumours circulate or appear for some reason, regarding a person or persons who are perceived to have transgressed in some way.
Someone who advocates for reproductive rights.
A scandal involving allegations or information about possibly immoral or illegal sexual activities being made public.
A sex scandal of a political nature or involving political figures.
The process of collecting and restating the law of a jurisdiction in certain areas, usually by subject, forming a legal code, i.e. a codex (book) of law.
A principle which allows for the exercise of a legal right only to cause annoyance, harm, or injury to another in civil law jurisdictions.
Laws regarding one's own personal status.
A message posted in an electronic or Internet forum of some kind.
A principle which fundamentally underlies jurisprudence and the legal process.
A medical gel that is applied topically under the armpits.
A medication that is applied via a topical gel.
A medication that is applied via a topical cream.
The concept covering the mental health conditions experienced by transgender people, usually related to social disadvantages or discriminatory acts.
A post on a Usenet newsgroup.

People who take substances such as drugs for an effect considered non-therapeutic or non-medical by any of various legal and/or medical entities. The substances may be legal or illegal, but their use may result in adverse medical, legal, or social consequences for the users.
Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is oral.

The science and practice of protecting and improving the health of a community, as by preventive medicine, health education, control of communicable diseases, application of sanitary measures, and monitoring of environmental hazards.
Groups that advocate for science.
A person who has suffered from any of various forms of child abuse.
Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is by mouth.
The concept covering the physical and mental conditions of men.
Slang used within any of various cross-dressing communities.

term: estradiol replacement therapy by transdermal patch
comment: Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is a transdermal patch.
The concept covering the physical and mental conditions of women.
Materials in any medium which are issued under the same title in succession. they are usually numbered and/or dated and appear at given intervals, typically without a predetermined conclusion.
A person who uses any of various recreational substances.

term: estradiol replacement therapy by topical gel
comment: Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is an topical gel.
A post on a social media website.
Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is an implant.
A post on an internet forum.
Victims of abuse who are LGBTQIA+.
Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is injection.
A post on a blog.
A victim of abuse is transgender.
A form of hormone therapy in which estradiol is utilized.
A post on the social media website Twitter.
A victim of abuse is bisexual.
An implant applied subcutaneously.
Differences in health outcomes based primarily on, or otherwise tied to, gender.
A term which was considered to be medical at some point, but is no longer used in medicine at all.
A word, phrase, or expression which is used in medicine, medical care, or is otherwise part of medical terminology.
Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is by mouth.
Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is a gel.

term: testosterone replacement therapy by topical cream
comment: Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is a topical cream.

term: testosterone replacement therapy by transdermal patch
comment: Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is a transdermal patch.
A term which describes the psychological aspects of premenstrual syndrome, namely tension, depression, hostility, and increased seizure activity in persons with seizure disorder.
Short stature that is observed between the ages of 2 and 15, caused by extreme emotional deprivation or stress.

term: testosterone replacement therapy by axillary gel
comment: Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is an axillary gel.
The symptoms of premenstrual syndrome as experience by transgender men.
A person who participates, in some form or fashion, in a wedding ceremony.

term: testosterone replacement therapy by topical gel
comment: Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is an topical gel.
The symptoms of premenstrual syndrome as experience by transgender women.
A woman who will soon be or has recently been married.
Domestic violence by a current or former partner in an intimate bisexual relationship (i.e. a relationship in which at least one of the partners is bisexual) against the partner.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of progestogens.
The symptoms of premenstrual syndrome as experience by cisgender women.
A man who will soon be or has recently been married.

A form of dwarfism caused by complete or partial growth hormone deficiency, resulting from either the lack of growth hormone-releasing factor from the hypothalamus or from the mutations in the growth hormone gene (GH1) in the pituitary gland. It is also known as Type I pituitary dwarfism. Human hypophysial dwarf is caused by a deficiency of human growth hormone during development.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of estrogens.
A syndrome which primarily affects the gonads.
Philosophical theories falling under the scope of the field of ethics.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of androgens.
A syndrome which primarily affects the ovaries.
Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is sublingual.
A category of syndromes related to menses.

Any of various laws which prohibit or limit the mention or discussion of homosexuality and transgender identity in public schools. In theory, these laws mainly apply to sex education courses, but they can also be applied to other parts of the school curriculum as well as to extracurricular activities and organizations such as gay–straight alliances.
Testosterone replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is oral.

Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) is a generic term which includes a broad group of emotional, behavioral and physical symptoms that occur for several days to several weeks before menses and subside following the menstrual period.

An ethical theory or viewpoint that all actions are intrinsically right or wrong. Stealing, for instance, might be considered to be always immoral, even if done for the well-being of others (e.g., stealing food to feed a starving family), and even if it does in the end promote such a good.
A depressive disorder that does not meet full criteria for major depressive disorder but in which at least two depressive symptoms are present for two weeks.
A person engaged to be married.

Disorder where symptoms (e.g., markedly depressed mood, marked anxiety, marked affective lability, decreased interest in activities) regularly occurred during the last week of the luteal phase (and remitted within a few days of the onset of menses). These symptoms must be severe enough to markedly interfere with work, school, or unusual activities and be entirely absent for at least 1 week post menses.

A street in San Francisco which begins perpendicular to Alemany Boulevard in San Francisco's Bernal Heights district and ends perpendicular to the Embarcadero on the San Francisco Bay. For its southern half, Folsom Street runs north-south, but it turns northeasterly at 13th street. It runs through San Francisco's Bernal Heights district, Mission District, SoMa District, Yerba Buena District, and South Beach district.
The deliberate killing of a monarch.
A geographically localized community within a larger city, town, suburb or rural area.
The killing of an infant individual by its close relatives usually full or half siblings.
A neighborhood in North America.
A homicide that is determined by a government system as being non-criminal in nature.
A neighborhood in the United States.
Gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist therapy which utilizes leuprolide.
A form of suicide occurring when a group of people simultaneously kill themselves.

Denotes a person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, and who was either born in the United States or who was naturalized as a citizen of the United States.
A message left behind when a person dies by suicide, or intends to die by suicide.

Public baths contain facilities such as baths, showers, swimming pools, massage tables, saunas and steam rooms. Where they were referred to as wash-houses, the baths were co-located with facilities for washing clothes, a precursor of the self-service laundry.
An attempt to commit suicide.
A suicide method in which a suicidal individual deliberately behaves in a threatening manner, with intent to provoke a lethal response from a public safety or law enforcement officer.
A neighborhood in California.
A collection of efforts to reduce the risk of suicide.
A neighborhood in San Francisco.
A suicide undertaken with the aid of another person.

A neighborhood in downtown San Francisco, in the flatlands on the southern slope of Nob Hill, situated between the Union Square shopping district to the northeast and the Civic Center office district to the southwest. It encompasses about 50 square blocks, and is a large wedge/triangle in shape (point faces East). It is historically bounded on the north by Geary Street, on the east by Mason Street, on the south by Market Street and on the west by Van Ness Avenue. The northern boundary with Lower Nob Hill historically has been set at Geary Street.
A suicide undertaken with the aid of physician or other health professional.
The art or science of building. especially, the art of building houses, churches, bridges, and other structures, for the purposes of civil life.

A periodical that is a printed or electronic report containing news concerning of the activities of a business or an organization that is sent to its members, customers, employees or other subscribers.
A manifesto is a published verbal declaration of the intentions, motives, or views of the issuer, be it an individual, group, political party or government.

A subculture formed of persons who identified as "fairies" around the turn of the 20th century until the advent of World War II. Such persons may have variously contemporarily identified as feminine gay men, drag queens, male-to-female cross-dressers, transfeminine persons, and/or transgender women.

term: estradiol replacement therapy by intramuscular injection
comment: Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is intramuscular injection.
Estradiol replacement therapy wherein the route of administration is sublingual.
Killing of a child within its first year of life.
A street in the United States.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonists.

Killing a person willfully and illegally, with intent to cause death or serious injury. Intentional homicide does not necessarily have to be premeditated and it excludes attempted homicide, justifiable self-defense, and assisted suicide, among other things.
A street in California.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of gonadotropins.
The killing of one's parent or parents.
A street in San Francisco.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH).
Killing of a person whose social class, status, or rank is above another.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of thyroid hormones.
A case when one person kills another, with the consent of the person being killed.
A road in an urban setting.
A form of hormone therapy in which thyroid hormones are replaced.
Killing of persons in a systematic fashion.
A road in a rural setting.
Any therapeutic procedure utilized to suppress the effects of testosterone.
The systematic killing of members of a specific gender.
A public road in a populated area (such as a town or a city) with buildings on both sides. An avenue is usually longer than and runs perpendicular to a street.
Hormone therapy provided to cisgender youth for the purposes of delaying the onset of puberty (usually in the case of precocious puberty) and the development of secondary sexual characteristics.
Killing of a single person belonging to any of various family member roles.
A street in North America.
A form of hormone therapy in which micronized progesterone is utilized.
A form of hormone therapy in which medroxyprogesterone is utilized.
An offshoot of traditional studies of sexology that focuses on the intersectionality of sex and gender in relation to the sexual lives of women.

[T]he human right to maintain personal bodily autonomy, have children, not have children, and parent the children we have in safe and sustainable communities, according to SisterSong Women of Color Reproductive Justice Collective, the first organization founded to build a reproductive justice movement.

A form of liberal feminism that advocates the state's equal treatment of women and men, without challenging inequalities perpetuated by employers, educational and religious institutions, and other elements of society.
