The theory that feminist opposition to patriarchy can be achieved through women's separation from men. Because much of the theorizing is based in lesbian feminism, feminist separatism is often thought of as simply lesbian separatism, but many aspects of the feminist movement utilize and have been influenced by feminist separatism.

A phenomenon within feminism, primarily second-wave feminism and radical feminism. it includes, but is not limited to, lesbian separatism. Political lesbianism embraces the theory that sexual orientation is a political and feminist choice, and advocates lesbianism as a positive alternative to heterosexuality for women as part of the struggle against sexism.

A variety of groups and individuals who focus on general social issues and specific government services which they claim adversely impact, or in some cases structurally discriminate against, men. Common topics debated within the men's rights movement include family law, parenting, reproduction, suicide, domestic violence against men, circumcision, education, conscription, social safety nets, and health policies.

A branch of feminism which holds that the experience of Black women gives rise to a particular understanding of their position in relation to sexism, class oppression, and racism. The experience of being a Black woman, it maintains, cannot be grasped in terms of being Black or of being a woman, but must be elucidated via intersectionality.
A branch of political lesbianism which advocates for separation from patriarchal society or from heterosexual society in general.
A movement which stresses the costs of some negative portions of "traditional" masculinity.
An informal fallacy is a fallacy that originates in a reasoning error other than a flaw in the logical form of the argument.
The informal fallacy of presenting an argument that may or may not be logically valid and sound, but (whose conclusion) fails to address the issue in question.
A flaw in the structure of a deductive argument which renders the argument invalid. The flaw can neatly be expressed in standard system of logic.

An ad hominem and antidebate tactic based on criticizing a person for expressing emotion. Tone policing detracts from the validity of a statement by attacking the tone in which it was presented rather than the message itself.
A fallacy of irrelevance that is based solely on someone's or something's history, origin, or source rather than its current meaning or context.

A fallacious argumentative strategy whereby genuine discussion of the topic at hand is avoided by instead attacking the character, motive, or other attribute of the person making the argument, or persons associated with the argument, rather than attacking the substance of the argument itself.

A fallacious argumentative strategy whereby genuine discussion of the topic at hand is avoided by instead attacking the character, motive, or other attribute of the person making the argument, or persons associated with the argument, rather than attacking the substance of the argument itself.

A gender categorization observed in a specific community in Andhra Pradesh. The term refers to those persons assigned male at birth who are possessed by or married to any of various gods, most notably Shiva. Shiv-shakthis generally present a feminine gender expression and appear as women during religious ceremonies and festivals.

A gender categorization observed in a specific community in Andhra Pradesh. The term refers to those persons assigned male at birth who are possessed by or married to any of various gods, most notably Shiva. Shiv-shakthis generally present a feminine gender expression and appear as women during religious ceremonies and festivals.

A term usually used to refer to hijras living in north India. also used in other parts of India (such as Maharashtra) by hijra to refer to themselves. Some scholars consider the identity separate from hijra.
Hijra who have undergone nirvan, a ritual during which the testes, penis, and scrotum are removed.
A term used to refer to hijra in Tamil Nadu. Some prefer the term thirunangi, which translates as "daughter of god".

Kothi who have had their penis, scrotum, and testicles removed. alternatively, a term used in north India to refer to some persons assigned male at birth who have sex with men or with men and women, often these persons cross-dress, express themselves in a more feminine manner, and fulfill the role of penetrative partner in sexual relationships.
Hijra who do not plan to undergo nirvan (nirwaan).
Hijra who present as female but have not yet undergone nirvan (nirwaan), although they often intend to at some point.

A theory which states that a connection exists between various types of oppression, specifically classism, racism, and sexism. It hypothesizes that all three types of oppression need to be overcome at once.
Hatred, discrimination, and/or prejudice against sex workers.
The position that an individual and/or group occupies or is perceived as occupying within a group and/or society.
The ability for LGBTQ persons to be perceived as equal members of society, including media presence of said persons.

The practice of making only a perfunctory or symbolic effort to be inclusive to members of minority groups, especially by recruiting a small number of people from underrepresented groups in order to give the appearance of racial or sexual equality within a workforce. The effort of including a token employee to a workforce is usually intended to create the impression of social inclusiveness and diversity (racial, religious, sexual, etc.) in order to deflect accusations of discrimination.

The practice of making only a perfunctory or symbolic effort to be inclusive to members of minority groups, especially by recruiting a small number of people from underrepresented groups in order to give the appearance of racial or sexual equality within a workforce. The effort of including a token employee to a workforce is usually intended to create the impression of social inclusiveness and diversity (racial, religious, sexual, etc.) in order to deflect accusations of discrimination.

A type of tokenism in media in which a minority person or character is promoted or otherwise given some significance, but that person or character is still secondary to non-minority persons or characters in that media.
A person who is harmed by another or who suffers from a calamity.
The ability for transgender persons to be perceived as equal members of society, including media presence of said persons.

A term covering a wide range of transphobic beliefs held by some members of the transgender community. These beliefs essentially distinguish between "true" transgender people (those who experience gender dysphoria, take or will take hormones as part of hormone replacement therapy, and have or will undergo gender confirmation surgery). One of transmedicalism's central beliefs is that gender dysphoria is a medical condition which requires HRT and GCS as treatment and that anyone who says they are trans and does not have dysphoria or does not want HRT or GCS is a "transtrender" or part of a fad.

A cultural practice where nonbinary people are erased from cultural narratives. Nonbinary persons may also be ignored within the LGBTQIA+ community (and even within the transgender community) and their identity may not be acknowledged.
A branch of cyberfeminism which aims to abolish categorization, allowing for the “right of everyone to speak as no one in particular".
A space that is defined by or primarily utilized by persons of a particular gender identity and/or gender role.
A genre of contemporary feminism which foregrounds the relationship between cyberspace, the Internet and technology. It can be used to refer to a philosophy, methodology or community.

A social theory based on the history and everyday experiences of women of color, especially Black women. It seeks, according to womanist scholar Layli Maparyan (Phillips), to "restore the balance between people and the environment/nature and reconcil[e] human life with the spiritual dimension".
An area where only women are allowed.
An area where only men are allowed.
An area where only women and nonbinary persons are allowed.
the degree of differences in identifying features among the members of a purposefully defined group, specifically in terms of ethnic classifications or in relation to ethnic groups.
Diversity which is not focused on inclusion of certain groups, but rather their presence to fulfill guidelines, unspoken quotas, or other non-inclusion-related goals.
An area where persons of any gender are allowed, including those with nonbinary identities.

Traditionally, a sexual fixation on a nonliving object or nongenital body part. However, the term has been extended in common discourse to mean any sexual behavior pattern wherein an "abnormal" degree of gratification is linked to a particular object, activity, quality, etc.
Undertaking or practicing the submissive role in BDSM activities.
A sexual fetish that revolves around a fixation upon a particular article or type of clothing, a particular fashion or uniform, or a person dressed in such a style.

A socio-political system where (primarily) cisgender males and heterosexuals have authority over cisgender females and over other sexual orientations and gender identities. It is a term that emphasizes that discrimination exerted both upon women and LGBTQ people has the same sexist social principle.
The sexual attraction to specific parts of the body.

An approach to thinking about masculinity in the context of social changes that have undermined traditional hegemonic masculinity and its associated homophobia, which each have driven men to avoid certain behaviors in order to avoid being publicly perceived as gay. it holds that there are increasingly societal spaces in which men no longer need to behave in hypermasculine ways in order to be accepted.

A complimentary field of thought to ecofeminism. While ecofeminism has traditionally focused on studying issues such as how the exploitation of women and women's bodies is congruent with the exploitation of nature, ecomasculinity studies men's role in this process and looks for ways to enable men to take on roles that would challenge exploitative thought patterns and practices.

In its broadest sense includes almost any Japanese theatrical film that includes nudity (hence 'pink') or deals with sexual content. This encompasses everything from dramas to action thrillers and exploitation film features. Some writers use the term 'pink film' for Japanese sex movies produced and distributed by smaller independent studios such as OP Eiga, Shintōhō Eiga, Kokuei and Xces. In this narrower sense, Nikkatsu's Roman Porno series, Toei Company's Pinky Violence series and the Tokatsu films distributed by Shochiku would not be included as these studios have much larger distribution networks.

A subgenre of exploitation film which had its peak in Europe in the 1970s. These films typically involve Christian nuns living in convents during the Middle Ages. The main conflict of the story is usually of a religious or sexual nature, such as religious oppression or sexual suppression due to living in celibacy. The Inquisition is another common theme. Bara can vary in visual style and plot, but typically features masculine men with varying degrees of muscle, body fat, and body hair, akin to bear or bodybuilding culture. While bara is typically pornographic, the genre has also depicted romantic and autobiographical subject material, as it acknowledges the varied reactions to homosexuality in modern Japan.

A disorder in sea snails caused by the toxic effects of certain marine pollutants. These pollutants cause oocyte-producing sea snails (marine gastropod molluscs) to develop organs such as a penis and a vas deferens.

Sexual repression is a state in which a person is prevented from expressing their own sexuality. Sexual repression is often associated with feelings of guilt or shame being associated with sexual impulses. What constitutes sexual repression is subjective and can vary greatly between cultures and moral systems.

A common name for slow-moving marine gastropod molluscs, usually with visible external shells, such as whelk or abalone. They share the taxonomic class Gastropoda with slugs, which are distinguished from snails primarily by the absence of a visible shell.

An intersectional framework, grounded in Black feminism, that challenges the single-issue approach to queer theory by analyzing how power dynamics associated race, class, gender expression, sexuality, ability, culture and nationality influence the lived experiences of individuals and groups that hold one or more of these identities.

The term for socially acceptable, long-term relationships between Basotho women in Lesotho. Motsoalle can be translated from Sesotho loosely as "a very special friend." The word, motsoalle, is used to describe the other woman, as in "she is my motsoalle." and a motsoalle relationship describes the bond between the two women. Motsoalle relationships are socially sanctioned, and have often been celebrated by the people of Lesotho. These women's relationships usually occur alongside otherwise conventional heterosexual marriages and may involve various levels of physical intimacy between the female partners. Motsoalle relationships have, over time, begun to disappear in Lesotho.

The lifestyle of a wealthy man with ample time for leisure, who demonstratively is a bon vivant who appreciates the pleasures of the world, especially the company of women. The term "playboy" was popular in the early to mid-20th century and is sometimes used to describe a conspicuous womanizer.

They have their origin in Japanese entertainment, but the style and culture has spread worldwide since its introduction into the Europe and the Americas in the 1990s.

This period was characterized by the fall of the monarchy, the establishment of the National Convention and the Reign of Terror, the Thermidorian Reaction and the founding of the Directory, and, finally, the creation of the Consulate and Napoleon's rise to power.

The period of the anarchist movement continuing from the end of the Second World War and into the present. Since the last third of the 20th century, anarchists have been involved in student protest movements, peace movements, squatter movements, and the anti-globalization movement, among others.

An anti-authoritarian political philosophy that rejects hierarchies deemed unjust and advocates their replacement with self-managed, self-governed societies based on voluntary, cooperative institutions. These institutions are often described as stateless societies, although several authors have defined them more specifically as distinct institutions based on non-hierarchical or free associations.[3] Anarchism's central disagreement with other ideologies is that it holds the state to be undesirable, unnecessary, and harmful.
A child who became an orphan because one or both parents died from AIDS.
A child (or, more broadly a person) whose parents have died, are unknown, or have permanently abandoned them. In common usage, only a child who has lost both parents due to death is called an orphan.
Headache which occurs shortly before menstruation.
The symptom of pain in the cranial region. It may be an isolated benign occurrence or manifestation of a wide variety of headache disorders.
Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.
A medical symptom primarily affecting the nervous system.

A proposed condition in which a partner experiences some of the same symptoms and behavior as an expectant parent. These most often include minor weight gain, altered hormone levels, morning nausea, and disturbed sleep patterns. In more extreme cases, symptoms can include labor pains, fatigue, postpartum depression, and nosebleeds.
Syndromes which occur around orgasm or are otherwise related to orgasm.
A type of headache that occurs during, directly before, or directly after orgasm. or is otherwise related to, orgasm.

A type of headache that occur in the skull and neck during sexual activity, including masturbation or orgasm. These headaches are usually benign, but occasionally are caused by intracranial hemorrhage and cerebral infarction, especially if the pain is sudden and severe. They may be caused by general exertion, sexual excitement, or contraction of the neck and facial muscles. Most cases can be successfully treated with medication.
Headache which occurs shortly after childbirth.
A system of production, resource allocation and distribution of goods and services within a society or a given geographic area.

An anarchist school of thought that advocates anarchism and social revolution as a means of queer liberation and abolition of homophobia, lesbophobia, transmisogyny, biphobia, transphobia, heteronormativity, patriarchy, and the gender binary.
An LGBTQIA+ movement aiming to free or liberate a particular group of persons from societal expectations, standards, bondage, or other various types of discriminatory behavior.
Any of various Native American groups which speak languages of the Piman language group.
Sexually attracted to persons only after a strong emotional bond has been formed.
Sexually attracted to persons only after a strong emotional bond has been formed.
Any of various sexual orientations falling on the asexual spectrum between allosexual and asexual.
Sexual, experiencing sexual attraction. not asexual.
A postmortem erection, technically a form of priapism, observed in the corpses of persons with penises who have been executed, particularly by hanging.
Travel which includes volunteering components. volunteering with the purpose of traveling.
Medical tourism for the purposes of transgender-related health care, usually related to gender confirming surgeries.
Travel to another country for the purpose of medical treatment or care.

The industry in which such travels and sightseeing are organized. more broadly, any activity which involves cursory passing through a place or subject for one's own gain, rather than for the gains of others.

Volunteer tourism turned toward short-term out-of-home/family care for children who became orphans because one or both of their parents died from AIDS. Such tourism potentially has adverse effects on child development and may worsen institutional care in certain areas.

A warranted law employee of a police force. In most countries, "police officer" is a generic term not specifying a particular rank. In some, the use of the rank "officer" is legally reserved for military personnel.
A woman who abstains from sexual activity from men, but does not necessarily engage in sexual activity with women.
A person who is employed in a particular profession.
The time of life when one is expected to take responsibility for one's own actions and well-being.
The time during which one is a child, from between infancy and puberty.

A sociological concept for a setting in which rape is pervasive and normalized due to societal attitudes about gender and sexuality. Behaviors commonly associated with rape culture include victim blaming, slut-shaming, sexual objectification, trivializing rape, denial of widespread rape, refusing to acknowledge the harm caused by sexual violence, or some combination of these.
A set of neologistic pronouns created in 1979.

Attempts by marginalized groups to police their own members and show their social values as being continuous and compatible with dominant values rather than challenging the mainstream for what they see as its failure to accept difference.

Respectability politics in the context of the LGBTQIA+ community is the assimilation of LGBTQIA+ or otherwise marginalized people based on sexuality into hegemonic and heteronormative society. This can be achieved by downplaying stereotypes or behaviors associated with homosexuality (e.g. crossdressing or flamboyant dressing, public displays of same sex affection) or participating in heterosexual institutions.
Human penile-vaginal penetration in which reproduction is the end goal.
A type of economic system where investment, production and the allocation of capital goods take place according to economy-wide economic plans and production plans.

An economic ideology which posits private ownership of the means of production and their operation for profit in the form of a capitalist market economy. Additionally, capitalism suggests that decision-making and investments are determined by every owner of wealth, property or production ability in financial and capital markets, whereas prices and the distribution of goods and services are mainly determined by competition in goods and services markets.

An economic system in which the decisions regarding investment, production and distribution are guided by the price signals created by the forces of supply and demand. The major characteristic of a market economy is the existence of factor markets that play a dominant role in the allocation of capital and the factors of production.
An economic system blending elements of market economies with elements of planned economies, free markets with state interventionism, or private enterprise with public enterprise.

The incorporation of the LGBTQIA+ movement into capitalism and the market economy. It involves targeted inclusion of LGBTQIA+ persons who have acquired sufficient purchasing power ("pink money") to generate their own specific market.
Marketing types organized by intended and/or actual target audience.

A culturally-bound condition found in the cultures of South Asia (including Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Sri Lanka) in which male patients report that they suffer from premature ejaculation or impotence, and believe that they are passing semen in their urine. The condition has no known organic cause.

A culturally-bound condition found in the cultures of South Asia (including Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Sri Lanka) in which male patients report that they suffer from premature ejaculation or impotence, and believe that they are passing semen in their urine. The condition has no known organic cause.
A syndrome characterized by spontaneous orgasm triggered from the inside of the foot.

A rare urogenital disease characterized by the appearance of flu-like symptoms (fever, extreme fatigue, myalgia, itchy burning eyes, nasal congestion/rhinorrhea), as well as mood changes, irritability and concentration, memory and attention difficulties, within a few minutes to a few hours after ejaculation. Symptoms disappear spontaneously 3-7 days after onset.
Telling of puns, inappropriate jokes, or pointless stories in socially inappropriate situations, either compulsively (or pathologically) or as a result of underlying social issues.

A condition in which a person with an established human immunodeficiency virus infection acquires a second strain of HIV, often of a different subtype. These can form a recombinant strain that co-exists with the strain from the initial infection, as well as the strain from the new virus, and may cause more rapid disease progression or carry multiple resistances to certain HIV medications.

A cultural and societal phenomenon characterized by a man's extreme pride in his personal appearance and the fitness of his physique, which is accompanied by difficulties in coping with the requirements of psychological maturation and with the aging of his body. The DGS is characterized by a triad of symptoms that overlap, and so combine diagnostic signs of dysmorphophobia, narcissistic character traits, and the immaturity of arrested development, which often are found in paraphilias.
The feeling of sadness, anxiety, agitation or aggression after sexual intercourse.
A symptom consisting of the involuntary expulsion of air from the nose.
A sudden violent, spasmodic, audible expiration of breath through the nose and mouth.
Menstruation in which menstrual blood flows back into the pelvis instead of out through the vagina. it may increase the risk of endometriosis.
Gender equity as it applies to menstruation, which also occurs in many transmasculine persons who do not identify as female.

The act of marketing to LGBTQIA+ customers, either with dedicated ads or general ads, or through sponsorships of LGBTQIA+ organizations and events, or through the targeted use of any other element of the marketing mix.
A time interval during the lifespan of an organism.
A set of neologistic pronouns created around 2012 by an internet user "Dicebox".
The application of existing scientific knowledge to practical applications, like technology or inventions.
A set of neologistic pronouns created around 1980.

The process of diagnosing, or identifying, medical conditions in oneself. It may be assisted by medical dictionaries, books, resources on the Internet, past personal experiences, or recognizing symptoms or medical signs of a condition that a family member previously had.
A set of neologistic pronouns created in 2017.
The study of natural phenomena by observation, measurement, and experimentation.
The intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behaviour of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.

A category of academic disciplines concerned with society and the relationships among individuals within a society. The disciplines include, but are not limited to: anthropology, archaeology, communication studies, economics, folkloristics, history, musicology, human geography, jurisprudence, linguistics, political science, psychology, public health, and sociology.
Science which explores the cognitive processes within organisms and the behavioral interactions between organisms in the natural world.

The development of scientific knowledge and predictions, principally in natural sciences but also in other empirical sciences, which are used as the scientific foundation for applied science. Basic science develops and establishes information to predict phenomena and perhaps to understand nature.
A branch of science concerned with the description, prediction, and understanding of natural phenomena, based on empirical evidence from observation and experimentation.
Feminist ideologies organized by conventional placement in the history of Anglo-feminist history.

Aa period of feminist activity and thought that occurred during the 19th and early 20th century throughout the Anglo-European world. It focused on legal issues, primarily on gaining the right to vote.
The scientific study of human sexuality, including human sexual interests, behaviors, and functions.
This discipline concerns the study of sexuality, and the application of sexual knowledge such as sexual attitudes, psychology, and sexual behavior.
Feminist ideologies organized by type of ideology.
A set of neologistic pronouns utilized by Kate Bornstein.

A culturally recognized union between people, called spouses, that establishes rights and obligations between them, as well as between them and their children, and between them and their in-laws. The definition of marriage varies around the world, not only between cultures and between religions, but also throughout the history of any given culture and religion. Over time, it has expanded and also constricted in terms of who and what is encompassed. Typically, it is an institution in which interpersonal relationships, usually sexual, are acknowledged or sanctioned. In some cultures, marriage is recommended or considered to be compulsory before pursuing any sexual activity. When defined broadly, marriage is considered a cultural universal.

A culturally recognized union between people, called spouses, that establishes rights and obligations between them, as well as between them and their children, and between them and their in-laws. The definition of marriage varies around the world, not only between cultures and between religions, but also throughout the history of any given culture and religion. Over time, it has expanded and also constricted in terms of who and what is encompassed. Typically, it is an institution in which interpersonal relationships, usually sexual, are acknowledged or sanctioned. In some cultures, marriage is recommended or considered to be compulsory before pursuing any sexual activity. When defined broadly, marriage is considered a cultural universal.
A marriage between two people of the same gender.
A marriage between two people of the same gender.

A mechanism which governs the behavior of a set of individuals within a given community. Institutions are often ascribed a social purpose, transcending individuals and intentions by mediating the rules that govern living behavior.
Any stimulus involving physical contact of the genitals with another's genitals that leads to, enhances and maintains sexual arousal, and may lead to orgasm.
A marriage between two people of dfferent genders.
A set of neologistic pronouns created in 2000.
Any stimulus involving physical contact of the penis with another's penis that leads to, enhances and maintains sexual arousal, and may lead to orgasm.
A set of neologistic pronouns created around 1973.
Any stimulus involving physical contact of the vulva with another's vulva that leads to, enhances and maintains sexual arousal, and may lead to orgasm.
A set of neologistic pronouns created in 1997.
Any stimulus involving physical contact of the genitals with another's anus that leads to, enhances and maintains sexual arousal, and may lead to orgasm.
The tendency for a group to make decisions that are more extreme than the initial inclination of its members.
Behaviors where entities interact in groups.

The concept that sexuality is centralized in society. otherwise, marking a society which centralizes its institutions and structures around sexuality. parallels the idea of heteronormativity, but in reference to asexuality instead of homosexuality.
A psychological phenomenon that occurs within a group of people in which the desire for harmony or conformity in the group results in an irrational or dysfunctional decision-making outcome.
A group of thirteen virtues listed by Benjamin Franklin in his autobiography.

The absence of ambient audible sound, the emission of sounds of such low intensity that they do not draw attention to themselves, or the state of having ceased to produce sounds. this latter sense can be extended to apply to the cessation or absence of any form of communication, whether through speech or other medium.
Any action or conflict which can stop or interrupt another person's activity.
Internet identity is a social identity that an internet user establishes in online communities and websites.
Any enhancement of a motivated behavior in which individuals do the same thing with some degree of mutual stimulation and consequent coordination.

Improvement in individual performance when working with other people rather than alone. Compared to their performance when alone, when in the presence of others, they tend to perform better on simple or well-rehearsed tasks and worse on complex or new ones.
Play in which individuals interact with one another in either a structured or unstructured way.
Behaviors related to the way in which individuals change their behavior to meet the demands of a social environment.
The portion of an individual's self-concept derived from perceived membership in a relevant social group.
Behaviors related to interpersonal attractions.
The gaze of a viewer of a particular sexuality and/or sexual orientation or upon a subject of a given sexuality and/or sexual orientation.
Behavior associated with interactions which resemble sexual behavior but do not lead to copulation.
The gaze of the heterosexual viewer, specifically in regard to viewing non-heterosexual persons and blindness toward non-heterosexual issues.
A behavior that occurs between two individuals, such as parent and child, and involves an emotional attachment that implies a special and focused relationship.
An affiliation is a social relation which indicates the partnership between two or more entities.
Behavior related to having a generally positive attitude toward another person.

A period of feminist activity and thought that began in the United States in the early 1960s and lasted roughly two decades. It quickly spread across the Anglo-European world, with an aim to increase equality for women by gaining more than just enfranchisement.

An iteration of the feminist movement that began in the early 1990s United States and continued until the rise of the fourth wave in the 2010s. Born in the 1960s and 1970s as members of Generation X and grounded in the civil-rights advances of the second wave, third-wave feminists embraced individualism and diversity and sought to redefine what it meant to be a feminist.

A phase of feminism that began around 2012 and is characterized by a focus on the empowerment of women and the use of internet tools. Centered on intersectionality, the fourth wave examines the interlocking systems of power that contribute to the stratification of traditionally marginalized groups. Fourth-wave feminists advocate for greater representation of these groups in politics and business, and argue that society would be more equitable if policies and practices incorporated the perspectives of all people.

A social movement that challenged traditional codes of behavior related to sexuality and interpersonal relationships throughout the United States and subsequently, the wider world, from the 1960s to the 1980s. Sexual liberation included increased acceptance of sex outside of traditional heterosexual, monogamous relationships (primarily marriage). The normalization of contraception and the pill, public nudity, pornography, premarital sex, homosexuality, masturbation, alternative forms of sexuality, and the legalization of abortion all followed.

A social movement that accepts all forms of love. The Free Love movement's initial goal was to separate the state from sexual matters such as marriage, birth control, and adultery. It claimed that such issues were the concern of the people involved, and no one else.
A set of neologistic pronouns created by Mary Orovan in 1970.
A theoretical next wave of feminism which encourages a disconnect between the ideal of a "modern woman" and that person's identity as a modern woman.
A movement that began in the early 1980s centering on the idea that sexual freedom is an essential component of women's freedom.
Any social behavior related to fighting. The term has broader meaning than aggressive behaviour because it includes threats, displays, retreats, placation, and conciliation.
A person who is not intersex.
Laws related to gay rights.
Human or non-human animal activity through which the exchange or transmission of thoughts, messages, or information is accomplished.
Social movements related to various aspects of sex and/or sexuality.
Frequent menses. menstrual cycles lasting less than 21 days.

A social and philosophical movement that seeks to change cultural attitudes and norms around sexuality, promoting the recognition of sexuality (in the countless forms of expression) as a natural and healthy part of the human experience and emphasizing the importance of personal sovereignty, safer sex practices, and consensual sex (free from violence or coercion). It covers every aspect of sexual identity including gender expression, orientation, relationship to the body (body-positivity, nudity, choice), relationship-style choice, reproductive rights, and anything else society has lumped under the umbrella.

A general philosophical strategy for responding to conflicts. It takes the principles and practices of restorative justice beyond the criminal justice system. It applies to areas such as environmental law, corporate law, labor-management relations, consumer bankruptcy and debt, and family law.
The prevention, treatment, and management of illness or the preservation of mental and physical well-being through the services offered by the medical, nursing, and allied health professions.
Interpersonal attractions between members of different genders.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, the aromantic community.
A movement within feminism which incorporates transgender women, as well as other LGBTQIA+ women and assigned-female-at-birth (AFAB) persons.
Amenorrhea following childbirth.
Regret experienced as a result of gender transitioning, either socially, medically, or both.
Interpersonal attractions between members of the same gender (or sex, depending on the organism in question).
Interpersonal attractions between members of the same gender (or sex, depending on the organism in question).
Female persons who engage in romantic and/or sexual activity with members of the same sex.
Mainstream and socially accepted sexual interests, such as teleiophilia.

Access to specialized care for transgender populations. Health systems organized to take account of the special healthcare needs of marginalized groups who may face barriers in accessing health services.
Any of various sexual attractions considered nonnormative.
The prevention, treatment, and management of illness or the preservation of mental and physical well-being for transgender persons.

Primary amenorrhea can be diagnosed in children by age 14 if no secondary sex characteristics, such as enlarged breasts and body hair, are present. In the absence of secondary sex characteristics, the most common cause of amenorrhea is low levels of FSH and LH caused by a delay in puberty. Gonadal dysgenesis, often associated with Turner's Syndrome, or premature ovarian failure may also be the cause. If secondary sex characteristics are present, but menstruation is not, primary amenorrhea can be diagnosed by age 16. A reason for this occurrence may be that a person phenotypically female but has a Y chromosome, a situation known as androgen insensitivity syndrome. If undescended testes are present, they are often removed after puberty (~21 years of age) due to the increased risk of testicular cancer. In the absence of undescended testes, an MRI can be used to determine whether or not a uterus is present. Müllerian agenesis causes around 15% of primary amenorrhea cases. If a uterus is present, outflow track obstruction may be the cause of primary amenorrhea.
Sexual behavior considered conventional in the sense of a societal norm.
Secondary amenorrhea's most common and most easily diagnosable causes are pregnancy, thyroid disease, and hyperprolactinemia.
The act, practice, or occupation of supervising and taking care of (typically) young children.
Attraction that makes people desire sexual contact or shows sexual interest in another person or persons.
Attraction that makes people desire sexual contact or shows sexual interest in another person or persons.
The attraction between people which leads to the development of relationships or which results in a kind of positive attitude or evaluation regarding a particular person.
The process of groups of organisms working or acting together for common, mutual, or some underlying benefit, as opposed to working in competition for selfish benefit.

An awareness of shared interests, objectives, standards, and sympathies creating a psychological sense of unity of groups or classes. It refers to the ties in a society that bind people together as one. The term is generally employed in sociology and the other social sciences as well as in philosophy and bioethics.

A concept in which a strong sexual attraction may develop between close blood relatives who first meet as adults. There is no direct evidence for "genetic attraction" being an actual phenomenon and the hypothesis has been criticized as pseudoscience.
A set of neologistic pronouns created by Peter David.
The desire to get to know someone, often as a result of their personality instead of their physicality.
The desire to get to know someone, often as a result of their personality instead of their physicality.
Attraction in which someone appreciates the appearance, beauty, or aesthetics of another person or persons, disconnected from sexual or romantic attraction.
Attraction in which someone appreciates the appearance, beauty, or aesthetics of another person or persons, disconnected from sexual or romantic attraction.
Construction of the forehead following damage to it or its destruction.
An interpersonal attraction which leads to the development of platonic relationships, usually friendships.
An interpersonal attraction which leads to the development of platonic relationships, usually friendships.
A device which assists a person in the process of urination.
The desire to engage with another in an intellectual manner.
A device which aids a person to urinate while standing upright.
The desire to interact with others in a tactile, non-sexual manner, such as through hugging or cuddling.
The desire to interact with others in a tactile, non-sexual manner, such as through hugging or cuddling.
Attraction that makes people desire romantic contact or interaction with another person or persons.
Attraction that makes people desire romantic contact or interaction with another person or persons.
Relationships that are not romantic in nature, but involve very close emotional connections that are often deeper or more intense than traditional friendship.
Relationships that are not romantic in nature, but involve very close emotional connections that are often deeper or more intense than traditional friendship.
Functional, psychosocial, emotional and spiritual domains and needs of patients and families following life-threatening disease or events.
Sexual attraction to corpses.
A paraphilia involving a sexual fixation on non-human animals.
Any of various disorders primarily characterized by voyeurism.
Sexual arousal and pleasure from feces.
Any of various disorders primarily characterized by frotteurism.
Any of various disorders primarily characterized by exhibitionism.

A disorder characterized by recurrent sexual urges, fantasies, or behaviors involving acts (real, not simulated) in which the psychological or physical suffering of a victim is sexually exciting to the individual.
A disorder characterized by recurrent sexual urges, fantasies, or behaviors involving the act (real, not simulated) of being humiliated, beaten, bound, or otherwise made to suffer.

A fetishistic disorder is an extreme sexual attraction to non-human objects or body parts which are not traditionally considered sexual which occurs alongside distress or impairment deemed clinically significant.
Any of various disorders primarily characterized by pedophilia.
Sexual behavior considered unconventional in the sense of a societal norm.
A sexual interest considered culturally or socially unconventional in a given context.
A set of neologistic pronouns which includes "he'er", "him'er", "his'er", and "his'ers".
A sexual interest considered culturally or socially conventional in a given context.
A sexual disorder considered psychological in origin, wherein pathological and physiological causes have been ruled out.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
Any of various disorders which primarily affect sexual intercourse, sexuality, or have other sexual components or symptoms.
Unconventional sexual behavior resulting from an individual's paraphilic interest.

Disorders that include recurrent, intense sexually arousing fantasies, sexual urges, or behaviors generally involving nonhuman objects, suffering of oneself or partners, or children or other nonconsenting partners.
Sexual relations between a person and an animal as the result of zoophilic interests.
Any sort of abnormal menstruation or menstrual process considered unhealthy or otherwise nonnormative.
Aberration in the release of an ovum from a rupturing Graafian follicle, normally regulated by a surge in luteinizing hormone.
Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head.
The discharged blood from the uterus during the reproductive years. The discharge occurs approximately once a month.
Excessive uterine bleeding during menstruation.
Prolonged and excessive menses at regular intervals in excess of 80 mL or lasting longer than 7 days.
Uterine bleeding during menstruation.
Bleeding in pregnancy that occurs before, during, or after childbirth. Bleeding before childbirth is that which occurs after 24 weeks of pregnancy.
Bleeding from the uterus that is abnormally frequent, last excessively long, is more than normal, or is irregular.
An abnormal bleeding through the vagina that occurs during the last trimester of pregnancy.
Bleeding before 24 weeks of gestational age.
Sexual behavior involving feces.
Undinism, a fetish for or sexual dependency on either the smell and/or taste of urine, or the sight and sound of someone urinating.
A paraphilia in which sexual excitement is associated with the sight or thought of urine or urination.
Sexual attraction to children by adults.
A form of amenorrhea and chronic anovulation and is one of the most common types of secondary amenorrhea. It is classified as hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
The enjoyment of receiving pain or humiliation.
Pleasure derived from being physically or psychologically abused, whether inflicted by oneself or by others.
A condition in which there is a derivation of pleasure from inflicting pain, discomfort or humiliation on another person or persons.
Sexual pleasure derived from being physically or psychologically abused, whether inflicted by oneself or by others.
Sadism and masochism: the enjoyment by one person of both inflicting and receiving pain.
Achievement of sexual gratification by inflicting pain or humiliation on others, or watching pain or humiliation inflicted on others.
Sexual sadism and masochism: the sexual enjoyment by one person of both inflicting and receiving pain.
Decreased menstrual blood flow.
Extremely light menstrual blood flow.

Abnormal uterine bleeding that is not related to menstruation, usually in persons without regular menstrual cycle. The irregular and unpredictable bleeding usually comes from a dysfunctional endometrium.
Uterine bleeding that occurs during a time not associated with the normal menstrual period.
Prolonged/excessive menses and bleeding at irregular intervals.
A condition in which prolonged or excessive uterine bleeding occurs irregularly and more frequently than normal.
Sexual behavior involving young adolescents or children in a sense that is nonnormative and typically criminal in the given society, such as child rape in the contemporary United States.
Pop music which focuses more specifically on gender identity and gender issues, especially as they relate to transgender people.
Slang utilized primarily within the subculture of barebacking.
A person who follows any of various sub-ideologies within radical feminism.
Radical feminists who include transgender women in their spaces and/or ideologies.
Radical feminists who exclude transgender women in their spaces and/or ideologies.
Radical feminists who exclude transgender women in their spaces and/or ideologies.
Radical feminists who include female sex workers in their spaces and/or ideologies.
Any of various kinds of intimacy which help to affirm one's gender identity.
Radical feminists who exclude female sex workers in their spaces and/or ideologies.
Radical feminists who do not exclude persons, such as transgender women or female sex workers, from their spaces and/or ideologies.
Festivals pertaining to or focused on women.
Slang that is specify to, or primarily used within, the bear community, that is the subculture of gay men who consider themselves to be bears.

A community event oriented towards live performances of singing and instrument playing that is often presented with a theme such as musical genre (e.g., blues, folk, jazz, classical music), nationality, or locality of musicians, or holiday.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, the Latine transgender community.
Slang that is specify to, or primarily used within, the chubby subculture of gay men.
Research in which qualitative and quantitative data, methods, methodologies, and/or paradigms are mixed together.
Research in which more than one method of data collection is used.
A person who advocates for people's health and access to health care.
One who is politically active in the role of a citizen. especially, one who campaigns for change.
A person who advocates for the health of people with HIV/AIDS and their access to health care.
A person who advocates for people's access to and quality of medical care.
A person who supports others to make their voices heard, or ideally for them to speak up for themselves, in relationship to a particular ideology or ideologies.
A person who supports others to make their voices heard, or ideally for them to speak up for themselves, in the arena of health and health care.
An advocate of feminism. a person who believes in bringing about the equality of the sexes (of women and men) in all aspects of public and private life.
The state of a subject's or patient's HIV antibodies.
The state of a subject's or patient's antibodies.
A state in which an individual tests negative for HIV antibodies.
A state in which an individual tests positive for HIV antibodies.

A lesbian who is not out, or has not made their identity known, to others. A person may be closeted to family but not close friends or they may be closeted to everyone, depending on the circumstances.

A gay person who is not out, or has not made their identity known, to others. A person may be closeted to family but not close friends or they may be closeted to everyone, depending on the circumstances.

The act of censoring or classifying one's own discourse. This is done out of fear of, or deference to, the sensibilities or preferences (actual or perceived) of others and without overt pressure from any specific party or institution of authority.

Any media, such as television, newspapers or Internet-based publications, that is free of influence by government or corporate interests. The term has varied applications. Within the United States and other developed countries, it is often used synonymously with alternative media to refer to media that specifically distinguish themselves in relation to the mainstream media. In international development, the term independent media is used in relation to the development of new media outlets, particularly in areas where there is little to no existing media presence.
Media sources that differ from established or dominant types of media (such as mainstream media or mass media) in terms of their content, production, or distribution.
A term used to refer collectively to the various large mass media that influence many people, and both reflect and shape prevailing currents of thought.
Any of various actions which are practiced mainly by psychological methods with the aim of evoking a planned psychological reaction in other people.
Common activities and characteristics of types of war, or of wars in general.

A cultural conflict between social groups and the struggle for dominance of their values, beliefs, and practices. It commonly refers to topics on which there is general societal disagreement and polarization in societal values.

A generalization of the notion of a conversation to any form of communication. Within theoretical linguistics, discourse is understood more narrowly as linguistic information exchange and was one of the major motivations for the framework of dynamic semantics, in which expressions' denotations are equated with their ability to update a discourse context.
Literature of North America.

An electroshock weapon which fires barbed darts intended to puncture the skin and remain attached to the target. The darts are connected to the main unit by thin insulated copper wire and deliver a modulated electric current designed to disrupt voluntary control of muscles.
Literature of the United States of America.
A weapon which delivers an electric shock aimed at temporarily disrupting muscle functions and/or inflicting pain.
Literature of South America.
A form of temperature play that involves using cigars. May also overlap with ash play.
A sexual fetish based on the pulmonary consumption (smoking) of tobacco, most often via cigarettes, cigars, and also, pipes and hookahs to some extent.

A religion which originated among the Aztecs in central Mexico. Like other Mesoamerican religions, it also has practices such as human sacrifice in connection with many religious festivals which are in the Aztec calendar. This polytheistic religion has many gods and goddesses. the Aztecs would often incorporate deities that were borrowed from other geographic regions and peoples into their own religious practices.
Pornography that features detailed depictions of sexual organs or sexual acts such as vaginal, anal or oral intercourse, cunnilingus, fellatio, fingering, anilingus, ejaculation, and fetish play.

Commercial still photography or film that has a pornographic or erotic component but is less sexually graphic and intrusive than hardcore pornography, defined by a "lack of penetration" including stripteases, lingerie modeling, simulated sex, and emphasis on the sensual appreciation.
A stick with electrodes on the end which is usually used to make cattle move through a relatively high-voltage, low-current electric shock.
Egypt as it existed during the Hellenistic period (322 BCE to 30 BCE), from its conquest by Alexander the Great to its conquest by Caesar Augustus.
A short staff or stick, usually made of wood, wielded as a weapon.

Roman civilization from the founding of the Italian city of Rome in the 8th century BC to the collapse of the Western Roman Empire in the 5th century AD, encompassing the Roman Kingdom (753 BC–509 BC), Roman Republic (509 BC–27 BC) and Roman Empire (27 BC–476 AD) until the fall of the western empire.
A roughly cylindrical club made of wood, rubber, plastic or metal.

Any of a group of Indigenous religions of Mesoamerica that were prevalent in the pre-Columbian era. Two of the most widely known examples of Mesoamerican religion are the Aztec religion and the Mayan religion.
A handheld device commonly used to make cattle or other livestock move by striking or poking them.

An ancient Hellenistic state based in Egypt. It was founded in 305 BCE by Ptolemy I Soter, a companion of Alexander the Great, and lasted until the death of Cleopatra in 30 BCE. Ruling for nearly three centuries, the Ptolemies were the longest and final dynasty in ancient Egyptian history.
Any of various diseases due to an acute infection.
A particular style of moustache hair.
A particular style of beard hair.
A particular style of facial hair.
A particular style of scalp (or head) hair.
A particular style of hair.
The action or skill of cutting and styling hair.
Any of various processes of hair care which change the property of hair.
An overall term for hygiene and cosmetology involving the hair which grows from the human scalp, and to a lesser extent facial, pubic and other body hair.
Work in attending to oneself, usually in reference to one's personal hygiene or one's beautification.
A heterosexual man who has HIV.
An infant who has HIV.
An adolescent who has HIV.
Literature of the Americas.
Literatures organized by continent.
A bisexual woman who has HIV.
A heterosexual woman who has HIV.
A lesbian who has HIV.
A nonbinary person who has HIV.
A collection of literary works chosen by the compiler. it may be a collection of plays, poems, short stories, songs or excerpts by different authors.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, hotels, including by those in the hotel industry and among hotel purveyors.
The interactions between individuals of different generations.
The comical expression of connections between ideas that awaken amusement and pleasure.
A type of ectopic pregnancy in which the mammalian embryo implants in the abdominal pregnancy instead of in the endometrium of the uterus.
Any of various forms of sexual play which involve electricity.
A high-volume perpetuation of celebrities' personal lives on a global scale. It is inherently tied to consumer interests where celebrities transform their fame to become product brands.
A collection of LGBTQIA+-related literary works chosen by the compiler.

A physical attack disrupts, damages, or destroys computer equipment and/or the availability of data. A physical attack is implemented either through use of conventional weapons, creating heat, blast, and fragmentation, or through direct manipulation of wiring or equipment, usually after gaining unauthorized physical access.
A word, phrase, or expression which is used in law, legal proceedings, jurisprudence, or is otherwise part of legal terminology.
A directed physical attack with either a part of the human body or with an inanimate object (such as a weapon) intended to cause blunt trauma or penetrating trauma upon an opponent.

A plea or defense in a court of law that a person, whether a member of the military, law enforcement, a firefighting force, or the civilian population, should not be considered guilty of committing actions that were ordered by a superior officer or official.

Patriarchy described by the "mutually reinforcing dialectical relationship between capitalist class structure and hierarchical sexual structuring." More broadly, patriarchy is viewed through the lens of capitalism.
Garments worn directly on the legs (and feet).
Any of various instruments for inflicting spankings.

A person who is both a nurse (usually a registered nurse) and a midwife, having completed nursing and midwifery education leading to practice as a nurse midwife and sometimes credentialed in the specialty.
A striking blow with the fist.

A health professional who has "who has successfully completed a midwifery education program that is recognised in the country where it is located and that is based on the ICM Essential Competencies for Basic Midwifery Practice and the framework of the ICM Global Standards for Midwifery Education. who has acquired the requisite qualifications to be registered or legally licensed to practice midwifery and use the title midwife. and who demonstrates competency in the practice of midwifery."

A health professional who has "who has successfully completed a midwifery education program that is recognised in the country where it is located and that is based on the ICM Essential Competencies for Basic Midwifery Practice and the framework of the ICM Global Standards for Midwifery Education. who has acquired the requisite qualifications to be registered or legally licensed to practice midwifery and use the title midwife. and who demonstrates competency in the practice of midwifery."

A physical strike using the leg, in unison usually with an area of the knee or lower using the foot, heel, tibia (shin), ball of the foot, blade of the foot, toes or knee (the latter is also known as a knee strike).
A term which was considered to be medical at some point, but is no longer used in legal practice at all.
A targeted strike with the head, typically (when intentional) involving the use of robust parts of the headbutter's cranium as the area of impact.
A health provider who provides basic and emergency care to women and their newborns during pregnancy, childbirth and the postpartum period.
A piece of clothing worn on the feet and often covering the ankle or some part of the calf. Some type of shoe or boot is typically worn over socks.

A pregnancy and childbirth care provider who provides basic health care, support and advice during and after pregnancy and childbirth, based primarily on experience and knowledge acquired informally through the traditions and practices of the communities where they originated.
The process of seeking and gathering voluntary financial contributions by engaging individuals, businesses, charitable foundations, or governmental agencies.
Activities in which goods or services are made, provided, purchased, or sold.
Six aluminum rings, each in one of the colors of the rainbow flag. Sometimes worn as part of a necklace, bracelet, or key chain. Considering an LGBTQ symbol.
Reduced control and penalties in relationship to drug usage and/or transactionscompared to existing laws.
A broad term that usually refers to fewer government regulations and restrictions in relation to drug usage and/or transaction
A broad term that usually refers to fewer government regulations and restrictions, mainly on economic activities.
The process by which any of various drugs are legalized.
The lessening or termination of criminal penalties in relation to certain acts, perhaps retroactively, though perhaps regulated permits or fines might still apply (for contrast, see: legalization).
The process by which behaviors and individuals are transformed into crime and criminals.
The process of removing a legal prohibition against something which is currently not legal.
A division of an ocean, partially enclosed by islands, archipelagos, or peninsulas, adjacent to or widely open to the open ocean at the surface, and/or bounded by submarine ridges on the sea floor.
Any of various forms of sexual play which involve various kinds of fetishes and/or kinks.

The assembly of most or all of Earth's continental blocks or cratons to form a single large landmass. However, some earth scientists use a different definition: "a grouping of formerly dispersed continents", which leaves room for interpretation and is easier to apply to Precambrian times, although a minimum of about 75% of the continental crust then in existence has been proposed as a limit to separate supercontinents from other groupings.
Reference conveyed through pictures.

A mediterranean sea with higher salinity than the outer ocean due to evaporation, and water exchange consisting of inflow of the fresher oceanic water in the upper layer and outflow of the saltier mediterranean water in the lower layer of the connecting channel.
Any of various depictions in pornography, or depictions woud be considered pornographic in certain contexts.
A mostly enclosed sea that has limited exchange of water with outer oceans and with water circulation dominated by salinity and temperature differences rather than winds or tides.
Any of various tools characterized primarily by their usage in an industry or industries.
Assembly of interconnected links, typically made of metal used for connecting other components.
The geographical designation for the countries of the Middle East and the countries Bangladesh. Bhutan. India. Nepal. Pakistan. and Sri Lanka.

The westernmost subregion of Asia. It includes Anatolia, the Arabian Peninsula, Iran, Mesopotamia, the Levant region, the island of Cyprus, the Sinai Peninsula, and Transcaucasia (partly). The region is considered to be separated from Africa by the Isthmus of Suez in Egypt, and separated from Europe by the waterways of the Turkish Straits and the watershed of the Greater Caucasus. Central Asia lies to its northeast, while South Asia lies to its east. Eight seas surround the region (clockwise): the Aegean Sea, the Black Sea, the Caspian Sea, the Persian Gulf, the Arabian Sea, the Gulf of Aden, the Red Sea, and the Mediterranean Sea.
A fastener used to hang up clothes for drying, usually on a clothes line.
The depiction of human ejaculation, especially onto another person.
A name for the combined watershed of the Mississippi River Basin and the waterbody of the Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico.
A sexual activity in which a person ejaculates semen onto the face of one or more sexual partners.

A mediterranean sea with lower salinity due to freshwater gains such as rainfall and rivers, and water exchange consisting of outflow of the fresher mediterranean water in the upper layer and inflow of the saltier oceanic water in the lower layer of the channel. Renewal of deep water may not be sufficient to supply oxygen to the bottom.
A device designed to hold something in place.
A mediterranean sea located in the area between Southeast Asia and Australasia. It connects the Indian and Pacific Oceans.
A device designed to hold things firmly together.
A large political subdivision of the Frankish Empire.
Alamannia as a duchy of the Merovingian dynasty.
Alemannia following the loss of its independence, becoming a duchy of the Frankish Empire.
A narrative in which a character, place, or event is used to deliver a broader message about real-world issues and occurrences.

The territory inhabited by the Germanic Alemanni peoples after they broke through the Roman limes in 213. The Alemanni expanded from the Main River basin during the 3rd century, raiding Roman provinces and settling on the left bank of the Rhine River beginning in the 4th century. Ruled by independent tribal kings during the 4th to 5th centuries, Ruled by independent tribal kings during the 4th to 5th centuries, Alamannia lost its independence and became a duchy of the Frankish Empire in the 6th century.
A dune in the country of Mauritania.

A meta-ethnicity living in the countries of present-day Ghana and Ivory Coast. The Akan language (also known as Twi/Fante) are a group of dialects within the Central Tano branch of the Potou–Tano subfamily of the Niger–Congo family. Subgroups of the Akan people include: the Agona, Akuapem, Akwamu, Akyem, Ashanti, Bono, Fante, Kwahu, Wassa, and Sefwi. Subgroups of the Bia-speaking Akan groups include the Anyin, Baoulé, Chakosi (Anufo), Sefwi (Sehwi), Nzema, Ahanta, and Jwira-Pepesa.
A competitive contact sport that usually involves one-on-one combat. In many combat sports, a contestant wins by scoring more points than the opponent or by disabling the opponent.

The practice of terminating a pregnancy based upon the predicted sex of the infant. The selective abortion of female fetuses is most common where male children are valued over female children, especially in parts of East Asia and South Asia (particularly in countries such as People's Republic of China, India and Pakistan), as well as in the Caucasus, Western Balkans, and to a lesser extent North America.
Any of various regions of Metropolitan France.
Hate groups or sites which act primarily through means of the internet or recruit mainly through the internet.
Any of various sports that emphasize or require physical contact between players.

An induced abortion which occurs when a perpetrator or perpetrators cause abortion by force, threat or coercion, or by taking advantage of a person's incapability to give consent, or where they provide them consent under duress.
Any of various duchies in Alamannia.

Hate groups associated with particular religious beliefs, i.e. Christian hate groups, Islamic hate groups, etc. Note that the existence of such a group does not necessarily mean that all members of that religion belong to that group.
A sport consisting of hand-to-hand combat between two unarmed contestants seeking to pin or press each other's shoulders to the ground.
Any of various duchies in Alsace.
Sexual minority youth that are multiethnic.
Any of various wrestling activities which involve a certain amount of nudity among participants.
Abortion in which a characteristic or characteristics of the fetus or the pregnancy is not preferred for any reason (including if the abortion is therapeutic to the pregnant person).
A large political subdivision of the Merovingian dynasty.
The use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.

A stylized depiction of Guy Fawkes, the best-known member of the Gunpowder Plot, an attempt to blow up the House of Lords in London on 5 November 1605. The use of a mask on an effigy has long roots as part of Guy Fawkes Night celebrations. Illustrator David Lloyd stylised a smiling face with red cheeks, a wide moustache upturned at both ends, and a thin vertical pointed beard. the design came to represent broad protest after it was used as a major plot element in V for Vendetta (1982–1989) and its 2005 film adaptation. After appearing in Web forums it became a well-known symbol for the online hacktivist group Anonymous, used in Project Chanology, the Occupy movement, Anonymous for the Voiceless, and other anti-government and anti-establishment protests around the world.

A deliberate attempt to cause pain to the groin area of one's opponent. Often used in self-defense, the technique can be quickly debilitating, due to the large number of sensitive nerve endings in the penis and testicles, as well as the highly innervated vulva.

Any of a collection of behaviors that interfere with decision-making related to reproductive health. These behaviors are meant to maintain power and control related to reproductive health by a current, former, or hopeful intimate or romantic partner, but they can also be perpetrated by parents or in-laws. Ultimately, these behaviors infringe on individuals' reproductive rights and reduce their reproductive autonomy.
Legal dissolution of an officially recognized marriage relationship.

An item or device designed to prevent speech, often as a restraint device to stop the subject from calling for help and keep its wearer quiet. This is usually done by blocking the mouth, partially or completely, or attempting to prevent the tongue, lips, or jaw from moving in the normal patterns of speech. The more "effective" a gag appears to be, the more hazardous it is: for example, duct tape is fairly effective at keeping one's mouth shut but is hazardous if for some reason (e.g., the common cold) the subject cannot breathe freely through the nose. For this reason, a gagged person should never be left alone.

term: controlling the outcome of a pregnancy
comment: An attempt to influence a partner to continue or terminate a pregnancy. This can include abortion coercion, or pressuring, threatening, or forcing a partner to have an abortion or not.
Divorce in which the involved persons are of the same sex or gender.

A form of reproductive coercion which involves tampering with contraception or interfering with the use of contraception. Birth control sabotage includes removing a condom after agreeing to wear one (also called stealthing), damaging a condom, removing contraception (including vaginal rings, intrauterine devices (IUDs), and contraceptive patches), or throwing away oral contraceptive pills. Other methods of birth control sabotage include preventing a partner from obtaining or refilling contraceptive prescriptions, refusing to wear a condom, stating that a condom is being worn when one is not, not withdrawing after agreeing to do so, exaggerating the risks of hormonal contraceptives, and not telling a partner if a condom broke or fell off.
Divorce in which the involved persons are of dfferent sexes or genders.

Any of various restraint devices designed to secure an individual's wrists in proximity to each other. They comprise two parts, linked together by a chain, a hinge, or rigid bar. Each cuff has a rotating arm which engages with a ratchet that prevents it from being opened once closed around a person's wrist.
An association for and by retired persons.
Body piercing performed as part of a BDSM scene.
Neglect, physical abuse, and lack of respect during childbirth.
Organizations related to persons of a specific North American ethnicity or ethnicities, whether in favor of them and their rights or opposed to them.
Organizations related to Black persons, whether in favor of them and their rights or opposed to them.
Organizations related to persons of a specific racial group or groups, whether in favor of them and their rights or opposed to them.
Organizations related to persons of a specific ethnicity or ethnicities, whether in favor of them and their rights or opposed to them.
Procedures and/or course of action by which affirmative action policies are implemented.
A course of action.

A monarchy that spanned a geographical area in the current states of Ethiopia and Eritrea. It began with the establishment of the Solomonic dynasty by Yekuno Amlak from approximately 1270 and lasted until 1974, when Emperor Haile Selassie was overthrown in a coup d'état by the communist Derg. It was throughout much of its existence surrounded by hostile forces in the African Horn however it managed to preserve and develop its ancient form of Christianity based kingdom.
The repeal or abolition of a law, right, or agreement.
A form of adoption in which the biological and adoptive families have access to varying degrees of each other's personal information and have an option of contact.
A form of spanking which utilizes a device called a spanking paddle.

A village-level obstetric health worker in India who is known as the first contact person between the community and the health services. ANMs are regarded as the grass-roots workers in the health organization pyramid. Their services are considered important to provide safe and effective care to village communities. The role may help communities achieve the targets of national health programs.

An ethnic grouping which describes a level of commonality that is wider ("meta-") and more general (i.e., might differ on specifics) than ethnicity, but does not necessarily correspond to (and may actually transcend) nation or nationality.
Families having members who belong to any of various sexual minorities.
An object normally worn on the face, typically for protection, disguise, performance, or entertainment.
An individual educated in the discipline of midwifery, who possesses evidence of certification as a midwife.
Organizations related to Afro-American persons, whether in favor of them and their rights or opposed to them.
Families having members who belong to any of various gender and/or sexual minorities.
Any of various masks which are strongly associated with a specific practical function, usually protective in nature.
A direct-entry midwife who is licensed to practice, but only within a certain jurisdiction and typically exclusively serving the homebirth population in that jurisdiction.
Organizations related to persons of a specific American ethnicity or ethnicities, whether in favor of them and their rights or opposed to them.
Families having members who belong to any of various gender minorities.
A mask which tends to have some magical and/or religious funciton or functions and typically appear in rites of passage or in various kinds of theatre.

In the United States, a nurse midwife who exceeds the International Confederation of Midwives essential competencies for a midwife and is also an advanced practice registered nurse, having completed registered nursing and midwifery education leading to practice as a nurse midwife and credentialing as a Certified Nurse-Midwife.
A midwife who has become credentialed without first becoming a nurse.
Implement used to strike a person on the buttocks.

A certified midwife who is not a nurse. certified professional midwives are known for being "more natural and less intervention oriented." In other words, these midwives typically work outside of the hospital setting in homes and birth centers and do not employ methods for childbirth that physicians in hospitals commonly use such as caesarean section, forceps and other types of equipment and drugs.
Parents who are lesbians.
A mask used in relation to or in association with any of various political purposes, affiliations, or movements.
A parent or parents that are transgender.
Parents with LGBTQIA+ identities.
Any of various masks used primarily in medical care.
Someone who is training to become a midwife. a midwife in training.
Parents who are of the same sex or gender.
Any of various masks which primarily aim to afford some form of protection to the wearer.
A midwife who is a member of a hospital (or other medical center) staff.
Parents who are of different genders.

A mask used primarily to protect the wearer from inhaling airborne pollutants and toxic gases. The mask forms a sealed cover over the nose and mouth, but may also cover the eyes and other vulnerable soft tissues of the face.

the practice of forcing a woman to become pregnant, often as part of a forced marriage, or as part of a program of breeding slaves, or as part of a program of genocide. Forced pregnancy is a form of reproductive coercion.
Parents who are gay men.
A mask used to avoid recognition. a mask used as a form of disguise.
Any of various advanced practice providers who practice midwifery.
Life which is hypothesized to exist. Sometimes this concept overlaps with various forms of synthetic or extraterrestrial life, but might not in the future.
A fallacy in which a conclusion has been made on the basis of weak premises, or one which is not justified by sufficient or unbiased evidence.
A fallacy in which evidence provided is not representative of an argument due to its lack of precision.
A logical fallacy that asserts that if your ideas provoke the establishment to vilify or threaten you, you must be right.
A fallacious form of argument from authority (argumentum ab auctoritate) in which a false authority is appealed to as evidence to support a claim, i.e. citing a non-authority as an authority.
A fallacious form of argument from authority (argumentum ab auctoritate) in which a false authority is appealed to as evidence to support a claim, i.e. citing a non-authority as an authority.
An informal fallacy in which there is some confusion or ambiguity over the meaning or meanings of a word, phrase, or argument.

Native Americans living primarily in southern Montana. Today, the Crow people have a federally recognized tribe, the Crow Tribe of Montana, with an Indian reservation located in the south-central part of the state. The Crow are a Plains tribe, who speak the Crow language, part of the Missouri River Valley branch of Siouan languages.

A thin continuous polymeric material. Thicker plastic material is often called a "sheet". These thin plastic membranes are used to separate areas or volumes, to hold items, to act as barriers, or as printable surfaces.
The material or immaterial existence of a thing. Anything that exists is being. Anything that partakes in being is also called a "being".
One of the Western Dakota peoples. their name roughly translates as "Little village-at-the end".
A thin plastic film typically used for sealing food items in containers to keep them fresh over a longer period of time.

The branch of philosophy that studies concepts such as existence, being, becoming, and reality. It includes the questions of how entities are grouped into basic categories and which of these entities exist on the most fundamental level. Ontology is traditionally listed as a part of the major branch of philosophy known as metaphysics.
An irrelevant argument which attempts to invalidate someone else's position on the basis that the same view was held by Adolf Hitler or the Nazi Party.
The body of a dead human being.

A being believed to be supernatural, that is beyond understanding, having some characteristic or characteristics considered beyond scientific inquiry, or transcending some aspect or aspects of nature. A supernatural being may also simply appear to transcend understanding or depart from what is considered to be "normally" known.
An association fallacy in which a party is considered honorable based on an irrelevant association with another party.
Anatomical structure which is the aggregate material substance of an individual member of the kingdom Animalia.
Absence, lack of, or the state of not being. nonexistence.
