Unfair treatment of an individual based solely on their use of language. This use of language may include the individual's native language or other characteristics of the person's speech, such as an accent, the size of vocabulary (whether the person uses complex and varied words), modality, and syntax. It may also involve a person's ability or inability to use one language instead of another.

The first instance of sexual intercourse between two people, either following their marriage to each other or after a short or prolonged romantic/sexual attraction. The definition of consummation usually refers to penile-vaginal sexual penetration, but some religious doctrines hold that there is an additional requirement that no contraception must be used.
Either, a specific gender identity which is not male or female. or, more broadly, an umbrella term for gender identities not considered male or female.
An adolescent person belonging to any of various gender and/or sexual minority groups.
A form of institutional discrimination against individuals of a given group which has the effect of restricting their opportunities.

A scheduled period in which an inmate of a prison or jail is permitted to spend several hours or days in private with a visitor. The visitor is usually their legal spouse, and the visit's purpose is usually sexual activity. The generally recognized basis for permitting such visits in modern times is to preserve family bonds and increase the chances of success for a prisoner's eventual return to ordinary life after release from prison. They also provide an incentive to inmates to comply with the various day-to-day rules and regulations of the prison. Conjugal visits usually take place in designated rooms or a structure provided for that purpose, such as a trailer or a small cabin. Supplies such as soap, condoms, lubricant, bed linens, and towels may be provided.
A psychiatric action or administration of psychiatric therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process (or a process considered pathologic in nature).
An adolescent person belonging to any of various ethnic minority groups.
Discrimination against a person or persons based on socially constructed racial categories.
Culture specific to the transgender community and transgender people.
An adolescent person who is part of the LGBTQIA+ community or has an identity or identities considered LGBTQIA+.
Discrimination based on aspects of a person's sex- or gender-related characteristics, or the perception of such characteristics.
Discrimination based on aspects of a person's sex- or gender-related characteristics, or the perception of such characteristics.
An abbreviation consisting of initial letters pronounced separately.
An adolescent person who is transgender or otherwise gender nonconforming.
Discrimination against persons' based on their gender role, identity, and/or expression.
An abbreviation formed from the initial letters of other words and pronounced as a word.
An adolescent person who is bisexual.
Stereotyping and discrimination against individuals or groups on the basis of their age.
An adolescent person who is transgender.

The belief in the superiority of one race over another. It may also include prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism directed against other people because they are of a different race or ethnicity, or the belief that members of different races or ethnicities should be treated differently.
The class of all members of a set that are in a given equivalence relation.

Slang is language (words, phrases, and usages) of an informal register that members of special groups like teenagers, musicians, or criminals favor (over a standard language) in order to establish group identity, exclude outsiders, or both.
An adolescent man who is gay.

An independent state from 1917 to 1922, and afterwards the largest, most populous and most economically developed of the 15 Soviet socialist republics of the Soviet Union (USSR) from 1922 to 1990, then a sovereign part of the Soviet Union with priority of Russian laws over Union-level legislation in 1990 and 1991, during the last two years of the existence of the USSR. The Russian Republic comprised sixteen smaller constituent units of autonomous republics, five autonomous oblasts, ten autonomous okrugs, six krais and forty oblasts. Russians formed the largest ethnic group. The capital of the Russian SFSR was Moscow and the other major urban centers included Leningrad, Novosibirsk, Yekaterinburg, Nizhny Novgorod and Samara.
A Vajrayana Buddhist technique of a union practice with a physical or visualized consort. When the consort is a visualised one they are known as the jnanamudra.
A Vajrayana Buddhist technique of a union practice with a physical or visualized consort. When the consort is a visualised one they are known as the jnanamudra.

A short-lived state which controlled, de jure, the territory of the former Russian Empire after its proclamation by the Russian Provisional Government on 1 September (14 September, N.S.) 1917 in a decree signed by Alexander Kerensky as Minister-President and Alexander Zarudny as Minister of Justice.

Any of a wide variety of practices carried on in Hindu and Buddhist tantra to exercise sexuality in a ritualized or yogic context, often associated with antinomian or impure elements, like consumption of alcohol, and offerings of impure substances like meat to fierce deities. In particular, sexual fluids have been viewed as "power substances" and used ritualistically, either externally or internally.

The common English name for Germany between 1933 and 1945, when Adolf Hitler and his Nazi Party (NSDAP) controlled the country through a dictatorship. Under Hitler's rule, Germany was transformed into a totalitarian state where nearly all aspects of life were controlled by the government. The official name of the state was Deutsches Reich (German Reich) until 1943 and Großdeutsches Reich (Greater German Reich) from 1943 to 1945. Nazi Germany is also known as the Third Reich (Drittes Reich), meaning "Third Realm" or "Third Empire", the first two being the Holy Roman Empire (800–1806) and the German Empire (1871–1918). The Nazi regime ended after the Allies defeated Germany in May 1945, ending World War II in Europe.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in Hinduism.
Sexual slang is a set of linguistic terms and phrases used to refer to sexual organs, processes, and activities.

Upon defeat of Nazi Germany in World War II, the victorious Allies asserted joint authority and sovereignty over 'Germany as a whole', defined as all territories of the former German Reich west of the Oder–Neisse line, having declared the destruction of Nazi Germany at the death of Adolf Hitler. The four powers divided 'Germany as a whole' into four occupation zones for administrative purposes, under the United States, United Kingdom, France and the Soviet Union respectively. creating what became collectively known as Allied-occupied Germany.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in Buddhism.
The German nation state that existed from the unification of Germany in 1871 until the abdication of Kaiser Wilhelm II in 1918.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among Indian religions.

An unofficial historical designation for the German state from 1918 to 1933. The name derives from the city of Weimar, where its constitutional assembly first took place. The official name of the republic remained Deutsches Reich (’German Reich’) unchanged from 1871, because of the German tradition of substates.
Any of various festivals associated with BDSM or the BDSM community generally.

A Central European multinational great power from 1804 to 1867, created by proclamation out of the realms of the Habsburgs. During its existence, it was the third most populous empire after the Russian Empire and the United Kingdom in Europe. Along with Prussia, it was one of the two major powers of the German Confederation.
Any of various festivals associated with pornography or the pornography industry generally.
Refers to various kinds of slang used by different people on the internet.

The German federal state which existed from July 1867 to December 1870. Although de jure a confederacy of equal states, the Confederation was de facto controlled and led by the largest and most powerful member, Prussia, which exercised its influence to bring about the formation of the German Empire.
Any of various festivals centered around promoting fertility or associated with fertility.
Any of various festivals formed around a primarily sexual component, or otherwise related to sexuality.
Any of various conditions, states, or statuses considered intersex.

An ancient Japanese Shinto ritual gathering. Villagers would meet on a mountaintop, where singing, dancing, eating, having free sexual intercourse and the reciting of poetry would occur, in celebration of the beginning of spring or autumn. These events were closely associated with harvest rites, and therefore fertility.

An ancient Japanese Shinto ritual gathering. Villagers would meet on a mountaintop, where singing, dancing, eating, having free sexual intercourse and the reciting of poetry would occur, in celebration of the beginning of spring or autumn. These events were closely associated with harvest rites, and therefore fertility.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in Shintoism.
A medical patient who is transgender.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among East Asian religions.

A Wiccan ritual involving symbolic sexual intercourse with the purpose of drawing energy from the powerful connection between a male and female. Both receive more power. It is an uncommon ritual in a full coven, as it is used when the coven is in need of powerful spiritual intervention. Most often it is performed by the High Priest and High Priestess, but other participants can be elected to perform the Rite.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, the bisexual male community.
An adult person who is transmasculine, usually a transgender man.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in the Wicca religion.
Slang that is specific to, or primarily used within, the bisexual female community.
A young adult who is transgender.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among Neoplatonist religions.

A state established in 1922 under the Anglo-Irish Treaty of December 1921. That treaty ended the three-year Irish War of Independence between the forces of the self-proclaimed Irish Republic, the Irish Republican Army (IRA), and British Crown forces.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among Classical religions.

term: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland
comment: A sovereign state established by the Acts of Union 1800, which merged the kingdoms of Great Britain and Ireland.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among South American religions.

A client state of England and then of Great Britain that existed from 1542 until 1800. It was ruled by the monarchs of England and then of Great Britain in personal union with their other realms. The kingdom was administered from Dublin Castle nominally by the King or Queen, who appointed a viceroy (the Lord Deputy, later Lord Lieutenant) to rule in their stead. It had its own legislature (the Parliament of Ireland), peerage (the Peerage of Ireland), legal system, and state church (the Protestant Church of Ireland).
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among North American religions.

A sovereign state in western Europe from 1 May 1707 to 1 January 1801. The state came into being following the Treaty of Union in 1706, ratified by the Acts of Union 1707, which united the kingdoms of England (which included Wales) and Scotland to form a single kingdom encompassing the whole island of Great Britain and its outlying islands, with the exception of the Isle of Man and the Channel Islands. The unitary state was governed by a single parliament and government that was based in Westminster.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among Oceanic religions.

A sovereign state in northwest Europe traditionally said to have been founded in 843. Its territories expanded and shrank, but it came to occupy the northern third of the island of Great Britain, sharing a land border to the south with the Kingdom of England.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among European religions.
A sovereign state on the island of Great Britain from 927, when it emerged from various Anglo-Saxon kingdoms until 1707, when it united with Scotland to form the Kingdom of Great Britain.
A country in Southeast Europe, created from the two remaining federal republics of Yugoslavia after its breakup in 1992.
An application protocol used for transporting Usenet news articles (netnews) between news servers and for reading and posting articles by end user client applications.

An application layer protocol that facilitates communication in the form of text. The chat process works on a client/server networking model. IRC clients are computer programs that users can install on their system or web based applications running either locally in the browser or on a third party server.
A communication protocol for electronic mail transmission.
Any number of services provided using data transferred from internet servers to a computer.

A kind of sex magic which commonly uses repeated sexual stimulation (but not to physical orgasm) to place the individual in a state between full sleep and full wakefulness as well as exhaustion, allowing the practitioner to commune with their god.
An organization that provides services for accessing, using, or participating in the internet.

A 19th-century American spiritual sexual practice consisting of "sexual satisfaction from sexual contact" but without ejaculation. The practice was named for Diana, the Roman goddess of chastity, by American court reporter and astronomer Henry M. Parkhurst in his 1882 pamphlet Diana. In the 1890s, sexual mystic Ida Craddock included Dianism as part of her teachings. In the 20th century, the practice found favor with American followers of Aleister Crowley, most notably C.F. Russell.
Computer networks assigned particular geographic scopes or classified by scale of area.
A computer network that interconnects computers within a limited area such as a residence, school, laboratory, university campus or office building.

Occult society formed by Russian occultist and mystic Maria de Naglowska in Paris in 1932. Naglowska's occult teaching centered on what she called the Third Term of the Trinity, in which the Holy Spirit of the classic Christian trinity is recognized as the divine feminine. Her practices aimed to bring about a reconciliation of the light and dark forces in nature through the union of the masculine and feminine, revealing the spiritually transformative power of sex.

Occult society formed by Russian occultist and mystic Maria de Naglowska in Paris in 1932. Naglowska's occult teaching centered on what she called the Third Term of the Trinity, in which the Holy Spirit of the classic Christian trinity is recognized as the divine feminine. Her practices aimed to bring about a reconciliation of the light and dark forces in nature through the union of the masculine and feminine, revealing the spiritually transformative power of sex.
A telecommunications network that extends over a large geographical area for the primary purpose of computer networking.
Surgical procedures performed on soft tissue.
Any of various kinds of sex magic practiced in Contemporary Gnosticism.

An early packet-switching network and the first network to implement the TCP/IP protocol suite. Both technologies became the technical foundation of the Internet. The ARPANET was initially founded by the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA) of the United States Department of Defense.
Surgical removal of soft tissue.
Any of various kinds of sex magic practiced in Theosophy.
A worldwide distributed discussion system available on computers. It was developed from the general-purpose Unix-to-Unix Copy (UUCP) dial-up network architecture.
Surgical excision of soft tissue.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among Contemporary Gnostic religions.
Surgical removal of localized subcutaneous fat deposits.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced among Gnostic religions.
Gnostic esoteric religion formed by Samael Aun Weor.

A Rosicrucian Order originally established by German occultist Dr. Arnold Krumm-Heller, and acts in Brazil and Spanish-speaking countries. In Brazil, it was established in 1932 and has had its headquarters in Rio de Janeiro since 1933. The Brazilian FRA is associated with Fraternitas Rosae Crucis (FRC), a Rosicrucian fraternity with its headquarters in U.S., and with the Ecclesia Gnostica, its ecclesiastical branch.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the musculoskeletal system.
Slang related to the practice of polyamory or utilized by its participants.
A person with an intersex condition or who has had or has been diagnosed with an intersex condition.
A person with an intersex condition or who has had or has been diagnosed with an intersex condition.

Any of various contemporary religious movements, stemming from Gnostic ideas and systems from ancient Roman society. Gnosticism is an ancient name for a variety of religious ideas and systems, originating in Jewish-Christian milieux in the first and second century CE.
The physical, tangible parts or components of a computer, such as the cabinet, central processing unit, monitor, keyboard, computer data storage, graphics card, sound card, speakers and motherboard.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in Theosophy.

A digital telecommunications network which allows nodes to share resources. In computer networks, computing devices exchange data with each other using connections (data links) between nodes. These data links are established over cable media such as wires or optic cables, or wireless media such as Wi-Fi.
Any of various kinds of sex magic practiced in Thelema.

The principal communications protocol in the internet protocol suite for relaying datagrams across network boundaries. Its routing function enables internetworking, and essentially establishes the internet.
Any of various kinds of sex magic practiced in Rosicrucianism.
The conceptual model and set of communications protocols used in the Internet and similar computer networks.

An occult initiatory organization founded at the beginning of the 20th century. The origins of the O.T.O. can be traced back to the German-speaking occultists Carl Kellner, Heinrich Klein, Franz Hartmann and Theodor Reuss. English author and occultist Aleister Crowley is the best-known and most influential member of the order.

An abstraction layer that specifies the shared communications protocols and interface methods used by hosts in a communications network. The application layer abstraction is used in both of the standard models of computer networking: the Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP) and the OSI model.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in Thelema.

A conceptual division of methods in the layered architecture of protocols in the network stack in the Internet protocol suite and the OSI model. The protocols of this layer provide host-to-host communication services for applications.
Any of various sexual rituals specific to or practiced in Rosicrucianism.

A group of internetworking methods, protocols, and specifications in the Internet protocol suite that are used to transport network packets from the originating host across network boundaries, if necessary, to the destination host specified by an IP address.

Any type of sexual activity used in magical, ritualistic or otherwise religious and spiritual pursuits. One practice of sex magic is using sexual arousal or orgasm with visualization of a desired result. A premise posited by sex magicians is the concept that sexual energy is a potent force that can be harnessed to transcend one's normally perceived reality.

An application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web, where hypertext documents include hyperlinks to other resources that the user can easily access, for example by a mouse click or by tapping the screen in a web browser.

A spiritual, religious, and culture movement that arose in Europe in the early 17th century after the publication of several texts that purported to announce the existence of a hitherto unknown esoteric order to the world and made seeking its knowledge attractive to many. The mysterious doctrine of the order is "built on esoteric truths of the ancient past", which "concealed from the average man, provide insight into nature, the physical universe, and the spiritual realm." The manifestos do not elaborate extensively on the matter, but clearly combine references to Kabbalah, Hermeticism, alchemy, and Christian mysticism

A Sanskrit term for sexual intercourse within Tantric sex, or alternatively to the specific lack of sexual fluids generated, while mithuna is a couple participating in such a ritual. It is the most important of the five makara and constitutes the main part of the grand ritual of Tantra variously known as Panchamakara, Panchatattva, and Tattva Chakra. Maithuna means the union of opposing forces, underlining the nonduality between human and divine, as well as worldly enjoyment (kama) and spiritual liberation (moksha).

A Sanskrit term for sexual intercourse within Tantric sex, or alternatively to the specific lack of sexual fluids generated, while mithuna is a couple participating in such a ritual. It is the most important of the five makara and constitutes the main part of the grand ritual of Tantra variously known as Panchamakara, Panchatattva, and Tattva Chakra. Maithuna means the union of opposing forces, underlining the nonduality between human and divine, as well as worldly enjoyment (kama) and spiritual liberation (moksha).

A person who is licensed to practiced psychotherapy (psychological therapy), the use of psychological methods, particularly when based on regular personal interaction with adults, to help a person change behavior and overcome problems in desired ways.
A practitioner of sex therapy, a strategy for the improvement of sexual function and treatment of sexual dysfunction.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Costa Rican.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Colombian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Chinese.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Chilean.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Canadian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Burmese.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Bulgarian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Brazilian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Belgian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Bahraini.
Surgical removal of subcutaneous fat using suction.
A type of online chat that offers real-time text transmission over the internet.
A Usenet newsgroup is a repository usually within the Usenet system, for messages posted from many users in different locations using the internet.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Austrian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Australian.
The organization system for Usenet newsgroups, theoretically making it simpler to find related groups.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Argentinian.
LGBTQIA+ people who are Angolan.
Sex work that is deemed legal by a given jurisdiction.
Sex work that is deemed illegal by a given jurisdiction.
Any of various forms of violence perpetrated against sex workers, through physical or psychological means.
Violence against individuals of a given occupation, typically as part of the work carried out, or otherwise in the workplace.
Violence as organized by type.
Violence organized by group that has been abused.
Pulp fiction that deals primarily with LGBTQIA+ topics, or otherwise relates to LGBTQIA+ people.
Media created by fans of a work and derived from a character or other aspect of that work.
A type of content warning which usually appears in the header or metadata of a fanwork.
The material accepted as officially part of the story in the fictional universe of that story.
The body of legislation that relates to crime.
Fiction in which conception occurs due to lesbian or female-female sex.
Legislation which governs the relation between individuals and the goverment, and those relationships between individuals which are of direct concern to society.
Fiction which incorporates elements of erotic and speculative fictions.
Bills which infringe upon the rights of, or discriminate against, transgender persons.

A subgenre of speculative erotic fiction, and originally a subgenre of erotic fan fiction (slash fiction). Stories in the genre are premised on societies wherein humans are divided into a dominance hierarchy of dominant "alphas", neutral "betas", and submissive "omegas".
Bills which infringe upon the rights of, or discriminate against, LGBTQIA+ persons.
Fan fiction pertaining especially to LGBTQIA+ persons and/or culture.
Bills which discriminate against particular groups or collectives of individuals.

Certain ideas which become influential or widely accepted within fan communities, who refer to such ideas as "fanon", a portmanteau of fan and canon. alternatively, any fan's individual canon for a given set of media.
Bills which define crimes and punishments.
A fan's personal interpretation of a canon.
The body of bills that relate to crime.
Any of various tropes involving pregnancy.
Bills which govern the relation between individuals and the goverment, and those relationships between individuals which are of direct concern to society.
A trope in which a men (who is almost always cisgender) becomes pregnant. The trope occurs often in slash fiction.
Pulp fiction that deals primarily with lesbian topics, or otherwise relates to lesbians.
Fiction which primarily focuses on erotic elements and may be pornographic in terms of its content.
Erotic fiction pertaining especially to LGBTQIA+ persons and/or culture.
Having an identity considered male.
Usage of masculine, feminine, other gendered, ungendered, and ambiguous clothing, behavior, posture, mannerisms, speech patterns, and activites, among other things.
Usage of clothing, behavior, posture, mannerisms, speech patterns, and activites, among other things, to indicate a female gender identity or gender role.
Erotic fiction pertaining especially to lesbians and/or lesbian culture.
Usage of clothing, behavior, posture, mannerisms, speech patterns, and activites, among other things, to indicate a male gender identity or gender role.
Having a gender (identity) which is different from the sex one was assigned at birth: being assigned male at birth but having a female gender or vice versa. or, pertaining to such people.

Transgender people have a gender identity or gender expression that differs from their assigned sex. In some select cases, transgender people are sometimes called transsexual if they desire medical assistance to transition from one sex to another. "Transgender" is also an umbrella term: in addition to including people whose gender identity is the opposite of their assigned sex (trans men and trans women), it may include people who are not exclusively masculine or feminine (people who are genderqueer or non-binary, including bigender, pangender, genderfluid, or agender). Other definitions of transgender also include people who belong to a third gender, or else conceptualize transgender people as a third gender.

Not identifying with culturally conventional gender roles and categories of male or female. having changed gender identity from male to female or female to male, or identifying with elements of both, or having some other gender identity. or, pertaining to such people.

Any detectable and heritable change in the genetic material that causes a change in the genotype and which is transmitted to daughter cells and to succeeding generations.

A difficult to define term used to reference run-of-the-mill, low-quality literature, especially that in pulp magazines, being inexpensive fiction magazines that were published from 1896 to the late 1950s.

A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).
Pulp magazines dealing primarily with lesbian topics and/or aspects relating to lesbians.
A trope in which LGBTQIA+ characters are viewed as more expendable than their heteronormative counterparts for any of various reasons.
Pulp magazines dealing primarily with LGBTQIA+ topics and/or aspects relating to LGBTQIA+ people.
Art which derive from other art or other sources (such as literature), either being directly inspired by or continuations or alternate histories of.
Magazines dealing primarily with fiction and/or aspects relating to fiction.
Artwork created by fans of a work of fiction and derived from a series character or other aspect of that work.

Any of various inexpensive fiction magazines that were published from 1896 to the late 1950s. The term "pulp" derives from the cheap wood pulp paper on which the magazines were printed. In contrast, magazines printed on higher-quality paper were called "glossies" or "slicks". The typical pulp magazine had 128 pages. it was 7 inches (18 cm) wide by 10 inches (25 cm) high, and 0.5 inches (1.3 cm) thick, with ragged, untrimmed edges.
Media which derive from other media, either being directly inspired by or continuations or alternate histories of.
Erotic fiction pertaining especially to gay men and/or gay male culture.
A sexual identity in question, in the process of being questioned, or otherwise being explored.
A fandom which consists of the readers of bara.

An interpersonal identity in transition due to various processes of self-exploration, learning, and experimenting, especially in regard to one's gender identity, sexual identity, or romantic identity.
A gender system which is arranged around a particular number of genders.
Tropes related to or involving LGBTQIA+ persons.

A rare, autosomal recessive inherited syndrome caused by mutations in the FRAS1, FREM2, or GRIP1 genes. It is characterized by the presence of cryptophthalmos, cutaneous syndactyly, and genitourinary abnormalities.
Fan media that focuses on romantic or sexual relationships between fictional characters of the same sex.
Fan art that focuses on romantic or sexual relationships between fictional characters of the same sex.
Any of various conventions involving members of the slash fandom.
A type of fan art which involves photo manipulation, often in order to depict television and film characters in non-canonical situations.
A type of manip fan art involving same-sex eroticism, desire, romance, or sex.
Roleplay involving same-sex characters in relationships, including canonical and non-canonical (original) fan-created characters.

A type of slash created by taking clips of characters (generally ones not written as gay, or in a relationship together), and through juxtaposition, song choice, and other techniques, portray a slash relationship on screen.
Legislation which discriminates against particular groups or collectives of individuals.
Legislation which defines crimes and punishments.
Any of various relationships in fiction.
A theoretical fictional relationship desired by fans for two or more people or characters (or occasionally inanimate objects).
A fan's favorite pairing or ship in a given fandom.
Fan fiction which primarily focuses on transgender characters, especially those who are not canonically presented as transgender.

A piece of furniture which is used as a place to sleep, rest, and relax. Most modern beds consist of a soft, cushioned mattress on a bed frame. The mattress rests either on a solid base, often wood slats, or a sprung base. Many beds include a box spring inner-sprung base, which is a large mattress-sized box containing wood and springs that provide additional support and suspension for the mattress.
A name formed by combining existing names to form a new name.

Any of various laws relating to extramarital sex. Historically, many cultures considered adultery a very serious crime, some subject to severe punishment, especially in the case of extramarital sex involving a married woman and a man other than her husband, with penalties including capital punishment, mutilation, or torture. Such punishments have gradually fallen into disfavor, especially in Anglosphere and European countries from the 19th century. In countries where adultery is still a criminal offense, punishments range from fines to caning and even capital punishment. Since the 20th century, criminal laws against adultery have become controversial, with most countries repealing them.
A blended name applied to a relationship, usually romantic and/or sexual in nature.

Legislation that defines access to public toilets by gender (restrooms)—or for transgender individuals. Bathroom bills affect access to sex-segregated public facilities for an individual based on a determination of their sex as defined in some specific way—such as their sex as assigned at birth, their sex as listed on their birth certificate, or the sex that corresponds to their gender identity.
A fixed name for a particular pairing or ship created by fans or fan communities which usually take the form of blended names.
Legislation which infringes upon the rights of, or discriminate against, transgender persons.
Fan fiction in which rape is a central element.
Legislation which infringes upon the rights of, or discriminate against, LGBTQIA+ persons.
Removal of a cisgender man's penis and the testicles, usually non-consensually.
An informal fallacy that intends to discredit the opponent's argument by attacking the opponent's own personal behavior as being inconsistent with the argument's conclusion(s).
The branch of psychology concerned with the effects of group membership upon the behavior, attitudes, and beliefs of an individual.
The branch of psychology that studies persons and their relationships with others and with groups and with society as a whole.
A social science dealing with group relationships, patterns of collective behavior, and social organization.
The study of behavior and cognition.
The science of behavior and mind. Psychology includes the study of conscious and unconscious phenomena, as well as feeling and thought.
A person who undergoes any of the various processes of menstruation.
A basic science concerned with the composition, structure, and properties of matter. and the reactions that occur between substances and the associated energy exchange.
The science of the composition, structure, properties, and reactions of matter, especially of atomic and molecular systems.
A discipline concerned with the origin, structure, development, growth, function, genetics, and reproduction of animals, plants, and microorganisms.
The scientific study of living organisms.
A subspeciality of psychiatry and is related to criminology. It encompasses the interface between law and psychiatry.
Psychiatry in its legal aspects.
The study of crime and criminals with special reference to the personality factors and social conditions leading toward, or away from crime.
The scientific study of the nature, extent, management, causes, control, consequences, and prevention of criminal behavior, both on individual and social levels.
A variant of the tu quoque logical fallacy that attempts to discredit an opponent's position by charging them with hypocrisy without directly refuting or disproving their argument.

An informal logical fallacy that occurs when two sides of an argument are assumed to have equal or comparable value regardless of their respective merits, which (in turn) can lead to the conclusion that the answer to a problem is always to be found between two extremes.

A sociolinguistic model in which slang utilized in minority populations is assimilated into the "standard" language variant. For example, "shade" and "realness" being used exclusively in gay and transgender communities of color before being integrated into the gay white lexicon and then into the general "mainstream" lexicon.
A category of informal fallacies in which a cause is incorrectly identified.
The branch of science concerned with origin and development of humans in all their physical, social, and cultural relationships.
A fallacy which concludes that persons, groups, or agents generally are inherently inclined to bring about morally fair and fitting consequences.
Camp which is created by the producers of the text, and not decoded as such by the audience or spectators of the work.
Camp which calls into question dominant notions of gender and sexuality.
Camp which is a result of mainstream appropriation of camp, particularly of queer camp.
A term used, usually derogatory, to describe those whose wealth has been acquired within their own generation, rather than by familial inheritance.
Camp in which mainstream "serious" works are decoded as campy, such as cliché-ridden, badly acted Hollywood films.
[T]he inherited wealth of established upper-class families (i.e. gentry, patriciate) or "a person, family, or lineage possessing inherited wealth".
A person belonging to a social class of upper-class, white American Protestants, usually of British descent (hence Anglo-Saxon). Often abbreviated as "WASP".
Any of various cosmetics that are applied to the face to enhance one's appearance.
Homicide of an LGBTQIA+ person in which the person's attitudes toward LGBTQIA+ persons ultimately resulted in the homicide.
Any of various makeup products applied to the face.
Any of various makeup products applied to the area of the face around the eye, the eyelashes, or the eyebrows.
Any of various makeup products applied to the lips.
A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus.

term: heterosexual man who has sex with men
comment: A man who identifies as heterosexual and engages in sexual intercourse or behavior with other men.
A consumer product used for personal hygiene or for beautification.

Substances intended to be applied to the human body for cleansing, beautifying, promoting attractiveness, or altering the appearance without affecting the body's structure or functions. Included in this definition are skin creams, lotions, perfumes, lipsticks, fingernail polishes, eye and facial makeup preparations, permanent waves, hair colors, toothpastes, and deodorants, as well as any material intended for use as a component of a cosmetic product.

The medicalization of life in which medical professionals, pharmaceutical companies, and medical device companies have a vested interest in sponsoring sickness by creating unrealistic health demands that require more treatments or treating non-diseases that are part of the normal human experience, such as age-related declines.

The imposition or enforcement of normative gender expressions on an individual who is perceived as not adequately performing, through appearance or behavior, the sex that was assigned to them at birth (see gender performativity). Gender policing serves to devalue or delegitimize expressions that deviate from normative conceptions of gender, thus reinforcing the gender binary.
Discrimination based on a person's gender being outside of the gender binary.
Any of various makeup products applied to the cheeks.
A cosmetic product used to define and line the eyes.
A cosmetic product applied on the eyelids and under the eyes to add depth and dimension, complement their color, make them appear larger, or to simply draw attention to them.
The branch of social science that deals with the production and distribution and consumption of goods and services and their management.
A pejorative which is ableist in nature.
Any of various rituals associated with fertility.
Any of various rituals associated with reproduction.
A version of the just world fallacy in which a person states that they support something that they profess to disagree with because "surely there must be exceptions, right?"
A subfield of economics which seeks to understand the functioning and dynamics of the markets for wage labor.
Propaganda which portrays police officers as being strictly friendly and heroic.
The critical study of economics and economies, with a focus on gender-aware and inclusive economic inquiry and policy analysis.
An autobiography about an LGBTQIA+ person's life.
Any of various rituals that the father adopts during the partner's pregnancy.
Any of various rituals associated with pregnancy.
A lesion which occurs as the result of mechanical trauma.
Medical journals which cover urological topics.
An unnatural tract or ulcer.
A marriage or similar union, formal or informal, between an adult and a child or youth under a certain age, typically age eighteen.
The process by which being transgender becomes medicalized.
Marriages organized by the age or ages of the participants.
The process by which being gay becomes medicalized.

A type of marriage where the partners at the outset agree to adhere to a model of shared responsibility for earning money, meeting the needs of children, doing household chores, and taking recreation time in near equal fashion across these four domains.
The process by which being gay becomes demedicalized.
A legal framework in a limited number of jurisdictions where a couple is legally considered married, without that couple having formally registered their relation as a civil or religious marriage.
The process by which LGBTQIA+ identities become demedicalized.
Marriage between two family members who are second cousins or closer.
The process by which being intersex becomes medicalized.
A situation in which two adolescents, ranging in age from 13 to 19, who are joined in marriage.
The process by which being asexual becomes demedicalized.
A ceremony during which two or more people are united in marriage.
A ceremony during which two or more people are united in marriage.
The process by which being asexual becomes medicalized.
A wedding that is arranged to avoid embarrassment due to premarital sex possibly leading to an unintended pregnancy, rather than out of the desire of the participants.
The process by which being transgender becomes demedicalized.
A marriage which takes place between two or more legal adults.
The status during which a cisgender person carries their developing young in utero before birth, beginning from fertilization to birth.
The process by which being intersex becomes demedicalized.
A marriage with a parent’s sibling or with one’s sibling’s child.

The destruction of traditional ways of dealing with, and making sense of, death, suffering, and sickness. In this way the medicalization of life leads to cultural harm as society members lose their autonomous coping skills.
A condition in which an animal displays physical characteristics which are female and male, in varying proportions.
The injury done to patients by ineffective, unsafe, and erroneous treatments.
Gynandromorphism in which one half of the organism's body is female and the other half is male.
Phantom pain which mimics menstrual cramping.
Medicalization in which medical professionals unduly influence non-medical persons, especially in terms of hierarchy.
A cosmetic product applied to the lips for color, texture, and/or protection.
Medicalization wherein medical terms are invented for non-medical entities.
A cosmetic product used primarily to give the lips a glossy luster or to add a subtle color to them.

The process by which human conditions and problems come to be defined and treated as medical conditions, and thus become the subject of medical study, diagnosis, prevention, or treatment. Medicalization can be driven by new evidence or hypotheses about conditions. by changing social attitudes or economic considerations. or by the development of new medications or treatments.
A process by which nonmedical problems become defined and treated as medical problems, usually in terms of illnesses, or disorders.
A cosmetic substance used on the eyelashes.
Any of various processes related to medicine or medical practice.
A system which centers upon and naturalizes heterosexuality, a binary gender system, and on maleness being ascribed more value than femaleness.
The process by which something ceases to be medically defined as a problem or disorder.
The process by which LGBTQIA+ identities become medicalized.
Medicalization in which a medical professional redefines a social problem as a medical problem.
A marriage performed, recorded and recognized by a government official. Such a marriage may be performed by a religious body and recognised by the state, or it may be entirely secular.
The minimum age at which a person is allowed by law to marry, either as a right or subject to parental, judicial or other forms of approval.
A clinic which provides services for gender nonconforming, transgender, and intersex persons.
A medical clinic which specializes in areas of sexual health.

A type of pluralism in which various ethnic groups collaborate and enter into a dialogue with one another without having to sacrifice their particular identities. It can describe a mixed ethnic community area where multiple cultural traditions exist (such as New York City) or a single country within which they do (such as Switzerland, Belgium or Russia).

Support for cross-cultural dialogue and challenging self-segregation tendencies within cultures. Interculturalism involves moving beyond mere passive acceptance of a multicultural fact of multiple cultures effectively existing in a society and instead promotes dialogue and interaction between cultures.
The co-existence, to varying degrees, of two originally distinct cultures.
Interference of a person's reproductive ability without the consent of the person or guardian.
The process by which puberty is inhibited, especially in cases of precocious puberty and in the treatment of transgender youth.

A political philosophy is the recognition and affirmation of diversity within a political body, which permits the peaceful coexistence of different interests, identities, convictions, and ways of living.

A term used when smaller groups within a larger society maintain their unique cultural identities, and their values and practices are accepted by the wider dominant culture provided they are consistent with the laws and values of the wider society.
A marriage where the partners are cousins (i.e. people with common grandparents or people who share other fairly recent ancestors).
A marriage in which participants are from a specific social group.
The status during which a transgender person carries their developing young in utero before birth, beginning from fertilization to birth.
A cisgender ally is a cisgender person who supports equal civil rights, gender equality, LGBTQ social movements, and challenges homophobia, biphobia and transphobia.
A marriage in which participants are from different ethnic groups.
A term used to cover a broad category of things rather than a single specific item.
The status during which a transfeminine person or transgender woman carries their developing young in utero before birth, beginning from fertilization to birth.
The status during which a transmasculine person or transgender man carries their developing young in utero before birth, beginning from fertilization to birth.
Any of various behaviors related to different aspects of romance, romantic love, romantic orientation, or romantic identity.
A health care facility where patients are admitted to get treatment provided by a group of physicians practicing medicine together.
A marriage in which participants are from different social groups.
Any location where healthcare is provided.
The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.
A marriage in which participants are from different countries.
Biomedical laboratory, research, equipment or instrumentation facilities.
A marriage in which participants are from different religious backgrounds.
A marriage in which participants are from different races or racialized ethnicities.
A medical clinic that assists a person or persons who want to become parents but for medical reasons have been unable to achieve this goal.

term: gender and sexual minority health association
comment: Professional associations formed of and for those in the area of gender and sexual minority health.
Professional associations formed of and for those in the area of minority health.
Non-surgical techniques undertaken by trans men as a part of gender transition to make the perceived gender of their voices match their gender.
An ester of an estradiol.
An ester of an estrogen, most typically of estradiol but also of other estrogens such as estrone, estriol, and even nonsteroidal estrogens like diethylstilbestrol.
Professional associations formed of and for those in the area of transgender health.
Professional associations formed of and for those in the area of gender minority health.
Surgical procedures performed on parts of the scrotum.

A surgery for transgender men and transmasculine individuals in which the urethral plate and urethra are completely dissected from the clitoral corporeal bodies, then divided at the distal end, and the testosterone-enlarged clitoris is straightened out and elongated. A longitudinal vascularized island flap is configured and harvested from the dorsal skin of the clitoris, reversed to the ventral side, tubularized and an anastomosis is formed with the native urethra. The new urethral meatus is placed along the neophallus to the distal end and the skin of the neophallus and scrotum reconstructed using labia minora and majora flaps. The new neophallus ranges in size from 4-10 cm (with an average of 5.7 cm) and has the approximate girth of a human adult thumb.

A surgery for transgender men and transmasculine individuals in which the urethral plate and urethra are completely dissected from the clitoral corporeal bodies, then divided at the distal end, and the testosterone-enlarged clitoris is straightened out and elongated. A longitudinal vascularized island flap is configured and harvested from the dorsal skin of the clitoris, reversed to the ventral side, tubularized and an anastomosis is formed with the native urethra. The new urethral meatus is placed along the neophallus to the distal end and the skin of the neophallus and scrotum reconstructed using labia minora and majora flaps. The new neophallus ranges in size from 4-10 cm (with an average of 5.7 cm) and has the approximate girth of a human adult thumb.

An artificial breast form which is meant to replace lost breast tissue or to otherwise enhance the external cosmetic appearance of the breast. Instead of being implanted, a breast prosthesis is fitted into a bra cup or inside the bra itself.

Any substance that inhibits steroid 5-alpha-reductase, an enzyme that converts testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT). Since DHT has three times greater affinity for androgen receptors than testosterone, inhibition of 5-alpha-reductase results in a strong reduction in the androgenic effects of testosterone.
Interference of a person's reproductive ability with the consent of the person or guardian.

An estrogen medication which was previously used for indications such as menopausal hormone therapy and gynecological disorders. EHHB is given by injection into muscle at regular intervals, for instance once every few weeks.
Any of various surgical procedures which aim to feminize the voice.

A pharmaceutical preparation containing a mixture of water-soluble, conjugated estrogens derived wholly or in part from urine of pregnant mares or synthetically from estrone and equilin. It contains a sodium-salt mixture of estrone sulfate (52-62%) and equilin sulfate (22-30%) with a total of the two between 80-88%. Other concomitant conjugates include 17-alpha-dihydroequilin, 17-alpha-estradiol, and 17-beta-dihydroequilin. The potency of the preparation is expressed in terms of an equivalent quantity of sodium estrone sulfate.

Steroidal compounds related to estradiol. Estradiol congeners include important estradiol precursors in the biosynthetic pathways, metabolites, derivatives, and synthetic steroids with estrogenic activities.
Non-surgical techniques undertaken by trans women as a part of gender transition to make the perceived gender of their voices match their gender.
Non-surgical techniques undertaken by trans women and trans men as a part of gender transition to make the perceived gender of their voices match their gender.

Voice therapy consists of techniques and procedures that target vocal parameters, such as vocal fold closure, pitch, volume, and quality. This therapy is provided by speech-language pathologists and is primarily used to aid in the management of voice disorders, or for altering the overall quality of voice, as in the case of transgender voice therapy.
A set of neologistic pronouns created by George Winslow Pierce in 1890.
The surgical creation of a scrotum in transgender men (as part of gender confirmation surgery) or reparative plastic surgery of the scrotum in cisgender men.
An ester of an androgen, most typically of testosterone.
An antiandrogen with a nonsteroidal chemical structure.
A type of medication which modulates the GnRH receptor, the biological target of the hypothalamic hormone gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH. also known as luteinizing-releasing hormone, or LHRH).

Any agent that binds to the gonadotropin releasing hormone receptors and causes both the inhibition of gonadotropin releasing hormone activities and a decrease in the pituitary output of follicle stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone.

An estrogen medication which is used primarily in the treatment of prostate cancer in men. It is also used in women to treat breast cancer, as a component of hormone therapy to treat low estrogen levels and menopausal symptoms, and as a component of feminizing hormone therapy for transgender women.

A synthetic long-acting polymer derivative of the sex hormone estradiol. As the primary, most potent estrogen hormone produced by the ovaries, estradiol binds to and activates specific nuclear receptors. Estradiol exhibits mild anabolic and metabolic properties, and increases blood coagulability. Administration of polyestradiol phosphate leads to the marked decrease of testosterone levels and may exhibit a bone mass-preserving effect in patients with prostatic cancer.
An antiandrogen with a steroidal chemical structure.

An four-carbon ester form of Testosterone. The number of ester carbon atoms correlate with the half-life of the prodrug. Testosterone inhibits gonadotropin secretion from the pituitary gland and ablates estrogen production in the ovaries, thereby decreasing endogenous estrogen levels. In addition, this agent promotes the maintenance of male sex characteristics and is indicated for testosterone replacement in hypogonadal males.
An ester of testosterone.
Any synthetic or animal-derived agent that is chemically identical or similar to an endogenous hormone with therapeutic application.
